original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na lhag pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin 'thob la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na lhag pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin 'thob la /
translated: For, if one abides in superior morality, one attains the concentration of superior thought;

original: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and, on the basis of superior thought, one generates superior wisdom.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called superior morality, superior thought, and superior wisdom?

original: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du bya ba'i don dang lhag pa'i don te /
analyzed: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du bya ba'i don dang lhag pa'i don te /
translated: Superior means mastery and excellence.

original: de la dbang du bya ba'i don ni lhag pa'i sems kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang du bya ba'i don ni lhag pa'i sems kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Mastery means that morality is governed by superior thought; that is the training in superior morality.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Concentration is governed by superior wisdom; that is the training in superior thought.

original: sgrib pa spong ba'i dbang du byas pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba'i dbang du byas pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin te /
translated: Knowledge and insight governed by the abandonment of obscurations is the training in superior wisdom.

original: de ni dbang du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni dbang du bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of superior.

original: lhag pa'i don ni bslab pa de rnams ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di kho na la yod kyi 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pas phyi rol pa las lhag pa'i don te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i don ni bslab pa de rnams ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di kho na la yod kyi 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pas phyi rol pa las lhag pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of superior is that these trainings exist only in this teaching of the Sugata and do not exist in common with those outside this teaching.

original: de ni lhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni lhag pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of superior.

original: 'o na bslab pa de gsum pa de dag la ji skad bstan pa bzhin so sor nges pa kho na yin nam zhe na /üîΩlhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa med pa yang yod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na bslab pa de gsum pa de dag la ji skad bstan pa bzhin so sor nges pa kho na yin nam zhe na / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa med pa yang yod kyi /
translated: Are these three trainings definitely individual and distinct as they are taught?üîΩThere are those who have the training in superior ethics but not the training in superior mind or the training in superior wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i @229b shes rab kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa med pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa med pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i @229b shes rab kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa med pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yod la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa med pa ni mi srid de /
translated: There are those who have the training in superior wisdom but not the training in superior mind or the training in superior ethics, and it is impossible to have the training in superior mind but not the training in superior ethics.

original: de'i phyir gang na lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yod pa de na lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yod pa de na lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang yod la /
translated: Therefore, wherever there is the training in superior wisdom, there is also the training in superior mind and superior ethics.

original: gang na lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yod pa de na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang na lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yod pa de na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: And wherever there is the training in superior mind, there is also the training in superior ethics.

original: bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i sa'i yon tan gzhan thams cad kyang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i sa'i yon tan gzhan thams cad kyang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All other qualities of the levels that are included in the three trainings should be understood in the same way.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words result and so on has now been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words adverse factors and their antidotes will be explained.

original: da ni sa bcu gcig po de dag gi so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de gnyis ka'i gnas yongs su rdzogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: da ni sa bcu gcig po de dag gi so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de gnyis ka'i gnas yongs su rdzogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Now, the skill in the eleven stages is in the abandonment of the specific resistances on each stage, in the cultivation of the remedies, in the attainment of the results of the cultivation, and in the thorough completion of both the results and the remedies.

original: de'i phyir yan lag du dag gis bsdus pa lags zhes zhus pa dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag du dag gis bsdus pa lags zhes zhus pa dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is asked, ‚ÄúBy how many members are they included?‚Äù and it is said, ‚ÄúThey should be known as included by eleven members.‚Äù

original: de la sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the abandonment of the resistance to the first stage?

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is shown by the words ‚Äúthe stage of action in faith.‚Äù

original: sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni so so'i skye bo nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni so so'i skye bo nyid do //
translated: The resistance to the first stage is the status of the ordinary person.

original: de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ma thob pa thams cad yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ma thob pa thams cad yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, it should be applied to all who have not attained the supramundane path prior to the stage of action in faith.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the remedy?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas de las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas de las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Patience is indicated by ‚Äúhaving perfectly transcended that through cultivating interest in the ten kinds of bodhisattva activities.‚Äù

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la thug gi bar du chos spyod pa bcu po /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la thug gi bar du chos spyod pa bcu po /
translated: up to the supreme mundane level, the ten kinds of spiritual practiceüîΩare the bodhisattva canon of the Mahayana sutras and so forth.

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug ste ;
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug ste ;
translated: Having these written down in the form of letters,

original: 'dzin pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / kun chub par lung mnod pa dang / lung 'bogs pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha don byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / kun chub par lung mnod pa dang / lung 'bogs pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha don byed pa dang /
translated: one should preserve them, make offerings to them, give them to others, listen respectfully to them when they are being taught, read them oneself, receive the oral transmission of them, transmit the oral transmission of them, chant them aloud,

original: gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / @230a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / @230a * //
translated: and teach them extensively to others.

original: gcig bu dben par song ste sems pa dang sgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa dag gis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags shing nges par byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mos pa shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir chos stong pa la bzod
analyzed: gcig bu dben par song ste sems pa dang sgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa dag gis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags shing nges par byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mos pa shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir chos stong pa la bzod
translated: They are called the stage of action in faith because they are engaged in by those who have gone to a solitary place and are occupied with reflection and meditation, and because they are engaged in by those who have cultivated the faith that is conducive to the definite resolution of the roots of virtue that have been well accumulated.

original: pas mos pos spyod pa'i sa de las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnyen po bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: pas mos pos spyod pa'i sa de las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnyen po bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: The stage of action in faith is surpassed by the cultivation of the antidote, which is the acceptance of the teaching of emptiness.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the result of cultivation?

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang skyon med pa la 'jug go zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang skyon med pa la 'jug go zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The bodhisattva enters into the faultless state.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po mngon par 'grub pa ste ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po mngon par 'grub pa ste ;
translated: The faultless state of the bodhisattva is the first supramundane thought,

original: sa dang po thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'o //
translated: which is the attainment of the first stage.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: It is taught in four ways:

original: gnas pa dang nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / khyad par ro //
translated: as abiding, as verbal definition, as complete understanding, and as distinction.

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thog mar na byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag la sems de skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thog mar na byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag la sems de skye ba ste /
translated: Abiding in it refers to the bodhisattva in whom this mind first arises.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa'i gnas yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa'i gnas yod pa'o //
translated: It is the basis for the extremely well-cultivated roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: That extremely well-cultivated root of virtue should be known as ninefold:

original: tshul khrims 'khor dang bcas pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir chos bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'khor dang bcas pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir spyod pa bsags pa dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir bsnyen bkur byas pa bsags pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'khor dang bcas pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir chos bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'khor dang bcas pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir spyod pa bsags pa dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa legs par byas pa nyid kyi phyir bsnyen bkur byas pa bsags pa dang /
translated: the accumulation of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated morality together with its retinue, the accumulation of conduct through the extremely well-cultivated meditative stabilization together with its retinue, the accumulation of service through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge arisen from listening, the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge arisen from reflection, the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge arisen from meditation, the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge of the treatises, the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge of the arts and occupations, the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge of the world, and the accumulation of the roots of virtue through the extremely well-cultivated knowledge of the inner mind.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos legs par rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsdus pa bsags pa dang / de kho na rtogs par sbyor ba'i sgom pa la gdams ngag legs par rnyed kyi phyir yongs su bzung ba bsags pa dang /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos legs par rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsdus pa bsags pa dang / de kho na rtogs par sbyor ba'i sgom pa la gdams ngag legs par rnyed kyi phyir yongs su bzung ba bsags pa dang /
translated: The accumulation of the fully included is the accumulation of the virtue of the transcendent perfections and so forth that comes from the knowledge that arises from reflection. The accumulation of the fully embraced is the accumulation of the instructions for the meditation that is applied to the realization of thatness.

original: de kho na rtogs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir bsam pa rnam par dag pa bsags pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba lhag pa'i bsam pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu rgyas pa bsags pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir mos pa bsags pa dang /
analyzed: de kho na rtogs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir bsam pa rnam par dag pa bsags pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba lhag pa'i bsam pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu rgyas pa bsags pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir mos pa bsags pa dang /
translated: The accumulation of pure thought is the accumulation of the realization of thatness itself. The accumulation of the vast is the accumulation of the superior intention to benefit beings. The accumulation of interest is the accumulation of the wish for omniscient gnosis.

original: snying brtse ba dang snying rje la mang du gnas pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa bsags pa ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang snying rje la mang du gnas pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa bsags pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of manifest interest is the accumulation of dwelling frequently in love and compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa'i gnas te de lta bu yod pa la sems de skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa'i gnas te de lta bu yod pa la sems de skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is the basis of the accumulation of the roots of virtue, and since that thought is generated in that way, he is on the first stage.üîΩFor what reason?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni ci la dmigs nas de skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni ci la dmigs nas de skye ba ste /
translated: For the sake of what object does it arise?

original: @230b sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su zhes bya ba dang / spong ba dang mngon sum du byed pa dang / bsgom pa bla na med pa dang ldan pa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @230b sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su zhes bya ba dang / spong ba dang mngon sum du byed pa dang / bsgom pa bla na med pa dang ldan pa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the unsurpassed knowledge of a buddha, which is endowed with the unsurpassed abandonment, realization, and cultivation, and is desired.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de la yang las rnam pa dgu'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de la yang las rnam pa dgu'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that knowledge of a buddha should be known as ninefold, by way of the distinctions of its nine types of activity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi stobs kyi ye shes dris pa lan 'debs pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa'i ye shes phas kyi rgol ba tshar bcad pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes gang zag dang bdag med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin pa'i las can dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi stobs kyi ye shes dris pa lan 'debs pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa'i ye shes phas kyi rgol ba tshar bcad pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes gang zag dang bdag med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin pa'i las can dang /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha's powers has the function of answering questions, the wisdom of the Buddha's fearlessness has the function of annihilating opponents, the wisdom of the Buddha's equanimity has the function of giving instructions in order to realize the selflessness of persons and the wisdom of the Buddha's knowledge of all aspects has the function of teaching the Dharma in order to realize the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bskyab pa'i ye shes bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bo dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sbyong ba'i ye shes sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de'i gzhi yongs su sbyang ba'i las can dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bskyab pa'i ye shes bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bo dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sbyong ba'i ye shes sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de'i gzhi yongs su sbyang ba'i las can dang /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha's protection has the function of ripening sentient beings through the four means of gathering disciples and the wisdom of the Buddha's purification has the function of purifying the basis of the ripening of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ma lus par mkhyen pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la nyin mtshan drug tu rnam par gzigs pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su sbyong ba'i ye shes dang / sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ma lus par mkhyen pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la nyin mtshan drug tu rnam par gzigs pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su sbyong ba'i ye shes dang / sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas' omniscience has the function of seeing the world with the eye of the buddhas for six days and nights.üîΩThe wisdom of completely purifying the qualities of buddhahood has the function of engaging in all realms without impediment because the mind is unobstructed and engaging in emanations that are not defiled.

original: zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sprul pas 'jug par byed pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems can de dag gi dus gsum gyi bsam pa bag la nyal skad cig gcig gis mkhyen pa'i las can dang /
analyzed: zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sprul pas 'jug par byed pa'i las can dang / sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems can de dag gi dus gsum gyi bsam pa bag la nyal skad cig gcig gis mkhyen pa'i las can dang /
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas' realization has the function of knowing in a single instant the thoughts and latent tendencies of those sentient beings of the three times.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas rnam par thar pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i las can te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas rnam par thar pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i las can te /
translated: The wisdom of turning the wheel of the Dharma of the buddhas has the function of being skilled in the means of liberation by turning the wheel of the Dharma simultaneously in a hundred million Jambudvƒ´pas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de lta bu mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir sems de skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de lta bu mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir sems de skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because of the desire for such a Buddha intuition, that thought is generated, and so one is on the first stage.

original: gzhi gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gang las sems ji lta bur mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhing gang gi bdag nyid du skye ba ste /
analyzed: gzhi gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gang las sems ji lta bur mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhing gang gi bdag nyid du skye ba ste /
translated: The basis is that from which the thought is generated, what sort of thought, what sort of characteristics, and what sort of nature.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i gzhi las snying rje'i bdag nyid skye ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i gzhi las snying rje'i bdag nyid skye ba'o //
translated: It is generated from the basis that is preceded by great compassion, and it has the nature of great compassion.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba de yang snying rje chen po nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba de yang snying rje chen po nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: That great compassion which precedes it should be known as ninefold great compassion.

original: phra ba'i sdug bsngal nyid shes pa'i dbang gis skye ba nyid kyi phyir dbang du gyur pa chen po nyid dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba yongs su bskyab @231a * //
analyzed: phra ba'i sdug bsngal nyid shes pa'i dbang gis skye ba nyid kyi phyir dbang du gyur pa chen po nyid dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba yongs su bskyab @231a * //
translated: It is the great mastery, because it is generated by the power of the knowledge of the subtle suffering; it is the great protection, because it is the protection of suffering sentient beings; it is the great refuge, because it is the refuge of those without a refuge; it is the great support, because it is the support of those without a support; it is the great friend, because it is the friend of those who have no friend; it is the great hero, because it is the hero of those who are frightened; it is the great ship, because it is the ship for those who are drowning; it is the great medicine, because it is the medicine for the sick; and it is the great doctor, because it is the doctor for those who are ill.

original: pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yongs su zad pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid dang / de'i dus dang 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don bya bar khas len pas 'phel ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu rtogs pa chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yongs su zad pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su 'dzin pa chen po nyid dang / de'i dus dang 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don bya bar khas len pas 'phel ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu rtogs pa chen po nyid dang /
translated: It is great realization because it is the commitment to benefit sentient beings for as long as samsara lasts.üîΩIt is great immeasurable vastness because it is the result of holding the immeasurable power of the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa chen po dang rgya chen po la mos pa dang zab mo shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu rnam par phye
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa chen po dang rgya chen po la mos pa dang zab mo shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu rnam par phye
translated: It is great discernment because it is the victory over adverse factors through interest in the vast and the knowledge of the profound.üîΩIt is great concordance because it is the commitment to perfect enlightenment.

original: ba rnam par 'byed pa chen po nyid dang / rang gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir rjes su mthun pa nyid dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i man ngag yongs su tshol ba nyid gyi phyir yang dag par tshol ba nyid dang /
analyzed: ba rnam par 'byed pa chen po nyid dang / rang gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir rjes su mthun pa nyid dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i man ngag yongs su tshol ba nyid gyi phyir yang dag par tshol ba nyid dang /
translated: It is great search because it is the search for the instructions for progressing with distinction.

original: yon tan yongs su gzung ba gtsor byed pa nyid kyi phyir dam pa chen po dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i rgyu zang mi shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang / mthar phyin pa chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: yon tan yongs su gzung ba gtsor byed pa nyid kyi phyir dam pa chen po dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i rgyu zang mi shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang / mthar phyin pa chen po nyid dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the first stage is born into the family of the Tathagatas, because he has attained the path of insight which is the cause of the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i gzhi de lta bu las snying rje'i bdag nyid du sems de skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //üîΩci 'dra ba'i sems skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems de skyes na phan yon cir 'gyur ba ste /üîΩsems de bskyed ma thag tu so so skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa de 'dra ba'i sems skye ba'o //

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das ba ni 'phags pa nyid de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par ston to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das ba ni 'phags pa nyid de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the first stage is born into the family of the Tathagatas, because he has attained the path of insight which is the cause of the lineage of the Tathagatas.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is established in the first stage is born into the family of the Tathagatas, because he has attained the path of insight

original: shin tu 'das pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu 'das pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: That extreme passing beyond should be known as eightfold.

original: mngal du zhugs pa dang mthun pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang bor mngon par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhugs pas shin tu 'das pa dang / rigs su skyes pa dang mthun bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi shin tu 'das pa dang 'dra pa'i bu dang mthun par theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir nad med pas shin tu 'das pa dang
analyzed: mngal du zhugs pa dang mthun pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang bor mngon par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhugs pas shin tu 'das pa dang / rigs su skyes pa dang mthun bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi shin tu 'das pa dang 'dra pa'i bu dang mthun par theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir nad med pas shin tu 'das pa dang
translated: It is passing beyond through entry, because the first supramundane mind is achieved through entry into the womb. It is passing beyond through lineage, because one is born in the lineage of the Tathagata. It is passing beyond through health, because one is born from the practice of the Mahayana. It is passing beyond through birth, because one is born in the family of the Tathagata. It is passing beyond through the son, because one is born as the son of the Tathagata. It is passing beyond through the field, because one is born in the field of the Tathagata. It is passing beyond through the stage, because one is born in the stage of the Tathagata. It is passing beyond through the result, because one is born in the result of the Tathagata.

original: / 'gro ba gzhan du skyes pa dang mthun pas 'jig rten pa'i 'gro bas ma bsdus la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro ba las shin tu 'das pa dang / lung gi rang bzhin dang mthun pas snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi dgongs pa bdag gi dgongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis shin tu 'das pa dang /üîΩbtsas nas gnas pa dang / @231b mthun pas 'khor bar yongs su mi gtong la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gnas pa nyid kyi phyir gnas pa shin tu 'das pa dang / btsas nas 'tsho ba dang mthun pas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyis shin tu 'das pa dang /
analyzed: / 'gro ba gzhan du skyes pa dang mthun pas 'jig rten pa'i 'gro bas ma bsdus la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro ba las shin tu 'das pa dang / lung gi rang bzhin dang mthun pas snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi dgongs pa bdag gi dgongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis shin tu 'das pa dang / btsas nas gnas pa dang / @231b mthun pas 'khor bar yongs su mi gtong la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gnas pa nyid kyi phyir gnas pa shin tu 'das pa dang / btsas nas 'tsho ba dang mthun pas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyis shin tu 'das pa dang /
translated: It is beyond the nature of the scriptures, since it is the intention of the compassionate nature of the bodhisattvas themselves, and it is beyond the nature of reality, since it is in accord with the nature of the scriptures.üîΩIt is beyond abiding, since it does not abandon samsara, and it is beyond equality, since it is the skill in means of the absence of defilement.

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs las yongs su mi nyams shing /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs las yongs su mi nyams shing /
translated: It is beyond the nature of the aryas, since it is the wisdom of the aryas that realizes emptiness, and it is beyond perfection, since it does not fall from the lineage of the buddhas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir nges pas shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir nges pas shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: Because it is directed toward nirvana, it is transcendent.

original: de ltar sems de bskyed ma thag tu so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa de 'dra ba'i sems skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems de bskyed ma thag tu so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa de 'dra ba'i sems skye bas sa dang po la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, as soon as this thought is generated, one transcends the stage of ordinary beings. By generating such a thought, one is on the first stage.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúdefinition‚Äù means that one may ask, ‚ÄúWhy is the first stage called the ‚ÄòJoyous‚Äô?‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas pa nyid bla na med pa thog mar thob pas mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas pa nyid bla na med pa thog mar thob pas mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the ‚ÄúJoyous‚Äù because one has attained the unsurpassed state of perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals.

original: de ni 'og ma nas mi la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'og ma nas mi la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan to //
translated: This has been taught in the chapter on the wise in the previous section.

original: de la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su bsdo ba phun sum tshogs pas sa rgya cher yongs su sbyong ba dang sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su bsdo ba phun sum tshogs pas sa rgya cher yongs su sbyong ba dang sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: There, firmly established means that one is engaged in thoroughly purifying the stages with a perfect attitude, a perfect application, and a perfect completion.

original: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa dang / dang ba'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa dang / dang ba'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: There, perfect attitude means that one is engaged with a perfect attitude through the power of confidence and faith.

original: yid ches pa de yang dngos po gang dag la yid ches pa de dbang byed pa de'i bye brag gis dbang byed pa de rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa de yang dngos po gang dag la yid ches pa de dbang byed pa de'i bye brag gis dbang byed pa de rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: And that confidence is the power of those things in which one has confidence. By the power of their distinctions, that power should be known as ninefold.

original: dkon mchog gsum po dag la yid ches pa'i dbang dang / bdag gis rtogs pa la rnam par dag pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang gzhan gyis rtogs pa la srid par 'dzin pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying brtse ba dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po dag la yid ches pa'i dbang dang / bdag gis rtogs pa la rnam par dag pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang gzhan gyis rtogs pa la srid par 'dzin pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying brtse ba dang /
translated: It is the power of confidence in the Three Jewels, the power of confidence in one's own realization and the power of confidence in the realization of others, the power of confidence in love and compassion in order to ripen sentient beings,

original: snying rje'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de nyid kyi phyir byams pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / de yongs su smin par bya ba tshe rabs du mar rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yun ring du 'khor bar khas blangs pa'i phyir yongs su mi skyo ba'i dad pa'i dbang dang /
analyzed: snying rje'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de nyid kyi phyir byams pa'i yid ches pa'i dbang dang / de yongs su smin par bya ba tshe rabs du mar rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yun ring du 'khor bar khas blangs pa'i phyir yongs su mi skyo ba'i dad pa'i dbang dang /
translated: the power of confidence in love in order to ripen sentient beings, the power of confidence in not being discouraged in order to accomplish their complete ripening over many lifetimes by accepting samsara for a long time.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'khor bar bya ba'i phyir ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la 'dzem pa'i phyir tshul gang dang ngo tsha shes shing khrel @232a * //üîΩyod pa'i dad pa'i dbang dang / chos mthun pa la rnam par tho mi mtshams pa'i phyir des pa'i dad pa'i dbang ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'khor bar bya ba'i phyir ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la 'dzem pa'i phyir tshul gang dang ngo tsha shes shing khrel @232a * // yod pa'i dad pa'i dbang dang / chos mthun pa la rnam par tho mi mtshams pa'i phyir des pa'i dad pa'i dbang ste /
translated: Because of shame and abashment, he is not ashamed to take up the moralities, etc.

original: de la bsti stang byed pa'i phyir bstan pa la yid ches pa'i dbang ste /
analyzed: de la bsti stang byed pa'i phyir bstan pa la yid ches pa'i dbang ste /
translated: Because of the power of faith in the teaching, he is not ashamed to honor the teacher.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, with such a perfect attitude, he applies himself.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon bar brtson pas sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon bar brtson pas sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of application is the application to the roots of virtue, etc., by means of uninterrupted effort.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ba sogs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ba sogs pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: And those roots of virtue, etc., are to be known as eightfold:

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byed pa sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la dga' ba'i phyir chos kyi kun dga' dag la sogs pa dang / mang du thos pa tshol ba la ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir mang du thos pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byed pa sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la dga' ba'i phyir chos kyi kun dga' dag la sogs pa dang / mang du thos pa tshol ba la ngoms mi myong ba'i phyir mang du thos pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: In order to not waste their lives, they serve their teachers and so on, they delight in the Dharma and in settling the truth of the teachings, they are insatiable in their quest for much learning,

original: ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i phyir rtog pa sogs pa dang / bsam gtan ro myang ba med pa'i phyir gnas med pa sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i phyir rtog pa sogs pa dang / bsam gtan ro myang ba med pa'i phyir gnas med pa sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa dang /
translated: they properly reflect on the Dharma as they have heard it, they are without attachment to the taste of concentration, they completely avoid anything that would interrupt their training in the bodhisattva precepts and they are not discouraged by the length of time required to attain enlightenment.

original: ma thob pa la lhag par chags ba med pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir yo byad la mngon par dga' ba med pa la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pa'i phyir rin po che lta bu'i sems la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma thob pa la lhag par chags ba med pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir yo byad la mngon par dga' ba med pa la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad par mngon du byed pa'i phyir rin po che lta bu'i sems la sogs pa ste /
translated: And he has a jewel-like thought, because he manifests the supramundane thought without interruption.

original: de lta bu ni sbyor bar phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sbyor bar phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he is engaged in the practice by means of the perfection of practice.

original: yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa'i thabs kyis sbyor bar byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa'i thabs kyis sbyor bar byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of dedication is to be known as having eleven varieties, according to the differences in the aspiration for the stage of omniscience, the means of engagement, the engagement itself, the purification of the field, the purification of the lineage, the purification of the body of the birth, the purification of the circle of birth, the purification of the retinue, the purification of the family, the purification of the enjoyment of pleasures, and the purification of the manifestation of enlightenment and of nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la sogs pa la dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / yongs su spong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la sogs pa la dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / yongs su spong bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
translated: They aspire to the level of omniscience by focusing on the powers of the thus-gone ones and so forth. They aspire to the level of omniscience by means of purification, by means of complete abandonment,üîΩand by means of acting in accordance with what they say. They aspire to the level of omniscience by means of protection, by means of lineage,

original: de skad smras pa de bzhin byed pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rjes su bsrung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rigs su 'byin par byed pas thams cad mkhyen @232b pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de skad smras pa de bzhin byed pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rjes su bsrung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / rigs su 'byin par byed pas thams cad mkhyen @232b pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang /

original: mi g-yo bas thams cad mkhyen ba'i sa mngon bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dor la ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshol bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa ste /üîΩde lta bu ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo bas thams cad mkhyen ba'i sa mngon bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dor la ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshol bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa mngon par 'dod pa ste / de lta bu ni yongs su bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The one who is not wavering is the one who is intent on the level of the Omniscient One. The one who is not discarding is the one who is intent on the level of the Omniscient One. The one who is not accumulating is the one who is intent on the level of the Omniscient One. The one who is not seeking is the one who is intent on the level of the Omniscient One.üîΩThus, he is engaged in the perfection of dedication.üîΩ

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of morality as vow, the purity of morality as gathering virtuous factors, and the purity of morality as acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The purity of morality as vow is twofold:

original: rnam pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su bsrung bar skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su bsrung bar skyon med pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of all aspects and the faultless constant and uninterrupted protection.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad spang zhing dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad spang zhing dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase having abandoned all aspects means that one abandons all the paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions and takes up and maintains all the paths of the ten virtuous actions.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad bar rjes su bsrung ba skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad bar rjes su bsrung ba skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad yang dag par blangs te /
translated: The phrase always and continuously maintaining faultless protection means that one takes up and maintains all the paths of the ten virtuous actions.

original: gnas pa de la 'byung 'jug med pa ste /üîΩde gnyis kyis ni ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa de la 'byung 'jug med pa ste / de gnyis kyis ni ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: One does not engage in or disengage from them.üîΩThese two verses show that morality is free of the stain of bad character.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The purity of morality that acquires virtuous qualities is also twofold.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen bor gyur pa la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i las kyi lam du rab tu brtags nas gnyen po mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pa dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam gong nas gong du rnam par dag pas 'bras bu dang bcas la rab tu brtags nas mchog mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen bor gyur pa la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i las kyi lam du rab tu brtags nas gnyen po mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pa dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam gong nas gong du rnam par dag pas 'bras bu dang bcas la rab tu brtags nas mchog mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: He wishes to apply himself to the practice of accomplishing the antidote after having examined the path of action with its result that is adverse and the antidote.üîΩHe wishes to apply himself to the practice of accomplishing the supreme after having examined the path of action with its result that is pure by reason of the ever increasing virtue.

original: de la dang po ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro'i las kun du spyod pa'i rgyus 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba @234b bzhin du rab tu shes nas ngan 'gro'i rgyu'i las yang dag par len par byed pa'o
analyzed: de la dang po ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro'i las kun du spyod pa'i rgyus 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba @234b bzhin du rab tu shes nas ngan 'gro'i rgyu'i las yang dag par len par byed pa'o
translated: The first is the one who, having understood as it truly is the establishment of the result of the practice of the action that leads to evil destinies and good destinies, takes up the action that is the cause of evil destinies.

original: // gnyis pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag theg pa gsum gyi tshul gyis sgrub pa'i rgyus gong nas gong du 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas /
analyzed: // gnyis pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag theg pa gsum gyi tshul gyis sgrub pa'i rgyus gong nas gong du 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas /
translated: The second is the correct knowledge of the establishment of the results of the ten paths of action, which are accomplished by the cause of their practice in the manner of the three vehicles.üîΩTherefore, I should strive to purify and accomplish all aspects of the practice that is similar to the practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par sgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par sgrub ba nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes de bas kyang yang dag par slob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par sgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par sgrub ba nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes de bas kyang yang dag par slob par byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, he trains correctly.

original: de gnyis ni log bar rtsol ba'i dri ma dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni log bar rtsol ba'i dri ma dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: These two verses show the absence of the stain of false effort.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings has five aspects:

original: yongs su shes pa dang / smon lam dang / sgrub pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / smon lam dang / sgrub pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: complete knowledge, aspiration, practice, natural outcome, and the result of the natural outcome.

original: de la yongs su shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Complete knowledge is threefold:

original: gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu ngan song gsum du rim bzhin du 'gro bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu ngan song gsum du rim bzhin du 'gro bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The result that is experienced in this life is the complete understanding of the result of the great, middling, and small paths of unwholesome action, which is the experience of the three lower miserable destinies in order.

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu'i bye brag yongs su shes pa ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam re res kyang ngan song gsum du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bskyed bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu'i bye brag yongs su shes pa ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam re res kyang ngan song gsum du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bskyed bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The result of full ripening is the complete understanding of the specific result, which is the complete understanding that each of the paths of unwholesome action produces the result of full ripening in the three lower miserable destinies.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag yongs su shes pa ni brgya la mir skyen yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnyis gnyis myong bar 'gyur bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag yongs su shes pa ni brgya la mir skyen yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnyis gnyis myong bar 'gyur bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The result that is in accordance with the cause is the complete understanding of the specific result that is in accordance with the cause, which is the complete understanding that even if one is born as a human being, one experiences two results that are in accordance with the cause.

original: smon lam zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i don du dge ba'i chos bsdu ba'i phyir theg ba chen po'i mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi bsam pa smon pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i don du dge ba'i chos bsdu ba'i phyir theg ba chen po'i mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi bsam pa smon pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the aspiration to the Mahayana, with the intention of delighting in it, in order to gather wholesome dharmas for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bdag kyang dge ba'i las kyi lam la gnas par byed cing ;
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bdag kyang dge ba'i las kyi lam la gnas par byed cing ;
translated: Practice means that one abides in the path of virtuous karma oneself,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed la gzhan dag kyang de la 'jog par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed la gzhan dag kyang de la 'jog par sgrub pa'o //
translated: and establishes others in it, abandoning the discordant side.

original: rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje skyes pa la brten nas sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher snying rje'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje skyes pa la brten nas sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher snying rje'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Concordant cause means that, based on the arising of compassion, one generates a compassionate attitude toward sentient beings even more.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i khyad par gyis yongs su zin pa'i mthun pa'i khyad par gyis sems can rnams la sdug bsngal bar rtog cing gnyen po sgrub par byed pa ste /

original: de la ngas kyang log par rtsol ba'i dri ma dang bral bar bstan to //üîΩ'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni sngar sa dang po'i skabs su las su rung ba'i 'bras @235a * //

analyzed: gnyen po sgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the antidote?

translated: It is taught by the words: ‚Äúhe strives to perfect it by that factor.‚ÄùüîΩWhen he has advanced from the second to the third spiritual level, he generates the will to the pure thought which is called ‚Äúthe application to freedom from attachment.‚Äù

analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba sbyor ba 'byung bar byed ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i gsum pa gnon pa na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags
translated: The application to freedom from attachment is the bodhisattva‚Äôs will on the second spiritual level, the bodhisattva who has purified his superior attitude. When he advances to the third spiritual level, he is free from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: dang bral @235b ba'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i rgyu 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba zhes bya ba sbyor ba rnam pa gsum 'byung bar byed pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa'o //

translated: The mental attention of the resolve of the mind that is the cause of application to the meditative development of the formless attainments and the meditative absorption that is free from attachment is called the application that is the cause of freedom from attachment.

original: dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dag pa de 'byung ba'i rgyu yid la byed pa'o //

translated: The mental attention of the resolve of the pure mind is the mental attention that is the cause of the arising of the pure resolve of the mind that is the cause of freedom from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar sgrub ste /
translated: The application that is the cause of freedom from attachment is the application that is the cause of the attainment of the meditative absorption and the formless attainments that are free from attachment.

original: gnas par ma gyur gyi bar du de la sbyor ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par ma gyur gyi bar du de la sbyor ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of application to that until one becomes one who is free from attachment.

original: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / theg pa dman pa kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / thabs yongs su gzung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / theg pa dman pa kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / thabs yongs su gzung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of application are: application to protection from the defilement, application to protection from the Lesser Vehicle, and application to the retention of the means.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The application to protection from the defilement is twofold:

original: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag pa'i yongs su rtog pa dang / mngon du brten par bya ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag pa'i yongs su rtog pa dang / mngon du brten par bya ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: contemplation of impermanence with regard to all conditioned things, and contemplation of the non-substantiality of the individual.

original: de la mi rtag par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad la tshe'i 'du byed mi gnas pas nyes dmigs sna tshogs kyis sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad la tshe'i 'du byed mi gnas pas nyes dmigs sna tshogs kyis sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: Contemplation of impermanence is the repudiation of the various faults of conditioned things by the non-abiding of the life-continuum.

original: mngon du brten par bya ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de dag la rten med pas sems skyo ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du brten par bya ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de dag la rten med pas sems skyo ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Contemplation of the non-substantiality of the individual is the production of mental disgust by the non-reliance on them.

original: theg pa dman pa la kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa la kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The application of guarding against the Individual Vehicle is threefold.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ba dang / sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ba dang / sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the dedication to the knowledge of the Tathagata, the establishment of the attitude toward all beings, and the undertaking of striving for the protection of all beings.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa che ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa che ba nyid dang ldan pa la yon tan sna tshogs kyis phan yon du lta zhing de la 'dod pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa che ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa che ba nyid dang ldan pa la yon tan sna tshogs kyis phan yon du lta zhing de la 'dod pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the dedication to the knowledge of the Tathagata is the perception of the benefit through the various virtues of the great retention and the great purification of the knowledge of the Buddha, and the generation of desire for that.

original: sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni snying theg pa nas 'dug pas sems can gyi khams la mgon med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal bar blta'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni snying theg pa nas 'dug pas sems can gyi khams la mgon med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal bar blta'o //
translated: The line he is one who has set his mind on the welfare of sentient beings means that he is one who has set his mind on the welfare of sentient beings, and so he sees the realm of sentient beings as suffering, with its various sufferings that are without a protector.

original: sems can yongs su skyob @236a * //
analyzed: sems can yongs su skyob @236a * //
translated: He is one who exerts himself in striving in order to protect sentient beings.

original: pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This has three parts: from what he protects them, how he protects them, and how he becomes a protector.

original: gang las yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las so //
analyzed: gang las yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las so //
translated: From what does he protect them? From the karma that is to be protected against and from the afflictions and the afflictions of birth.

original: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni bslab pa gsum 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni bslab pa gsum 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
translated: How does he protect them? By having them take up the three trainings.

original: ji ltar na yongs su skyob pa por gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rnam pa gnyis thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su skyob pa por gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rnam pa gnyis thob par byed pa'o //
translated: How does he become a protector? By causing them to attain the two kinds of nirvana.

original: thabs yongs su gzung ba'i sbyor ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thabs yongs su gzung ba'i sbyor ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The application of taking hold of the means also has three parts:

original: mthar phyin pa'i rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa dang / de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa dang / de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the ultimate, the realization of the higher stages of the practice of the ultimate, and the application to the stage of the practice of that.

original: de la mthar phyin pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gtan du sdug ba las rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma bsgribs pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar phyin pa'i ye shes kho na yin par mthong ba'o
analyzed: de la mthar phyin pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gtan du sdug ba las rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma bsgribs pa sangs rgyas kyi mthar phyin pa'i ye shes kho na yin par mthong ba'o
translated: The realization of the ultimate is the perception that the method of liberating those sentient beings forever from suffering is the ultimate pristine wisdom of the Buddha, which is unobscured by any afflictions.

original: // mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi snang ba de sgrub pa'i gnas ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin yin la de la sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mnyan pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: // mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi snang ba de sgrub pa'i gnas ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin yin la de la sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mnyan pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par mthong ba ste /
translated: The realization of the higher stages of the practice of the ultimate is the perception that the stage of the practice of that pristine wisdom of the ultimate is concentration and meditative stabilization, and that the application to that is the study of the Bodhisattva canon.

original: 'di'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhe na bas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yod do //
analyzed: 'di'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhe na bas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yod do //
translated: At this time, there is the pride of understanding the Dharma, which is projected by the manifest attachment to the person.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du sbyor bas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor bas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du sbyor bas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor bas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar mi byed do //
translated: With regard to that, one is bound by the fetter of defilement, but one is protected from the lower vehicle by the application of freedom from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: thabs yongs su gzung bas ni shes rab kyi snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs mngon par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: thabs yongs su gzung bas ni shes rab kyi snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs mngon par sgrub par byed de /
translated: By the retention of the means, one accomplishes the concentration and retention of the Dharma which is the basis of the immeasurable light of wisdom.

original: de la 'bad ba ni gnyen po sgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bad ba ni gnyen po sgom pa yin no //
translated: Here, effort is the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the result of cultivation?

original: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is shown by the words: ‚ÄúHe attains it.‚Äù

original: sa gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu'i gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gyis khyad par thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu'i gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gyis khyad par thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: The third ground is taught as the attainment of the special abode of freedom from attachment and the abode of the result of freedom from attachment, and the attainment of the special result of the benefits of the result.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa thob pa'o //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúfreedom from attachment‚Äù is the attainment of the meditative stabilization of the formless realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa'i gzungs thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa'i gzungs thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe result of freedom from attachment‚Äù is the attainment of the four immeasurables and the five superknowledges.

original: 'bras bu'i @236b phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i @236b phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The special result of the benefits is as above.

original: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since one attains those abodes and those special qualities, it is said, ‚ÄúThat branch is perfected by that.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because one abandons the opposing side, cultivates the antidote, and attains the result of cultivation.

original: sa bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the elimination of the adversary of the fourth stage?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag gis de la mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag gis de la mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te ;
translated: It is taught by the phrase: ‚Äúbecause he is unable to rest his mind in a state of special equanimity with regard to craving for meditative concentration and craving for the Dharma, that stage is not perfected by that factor.‚Äù

original: sa bzhi pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The adversary of the fourth stage is the subtle simultaneous occurrence of the innate afflictions included in the view of the transitory composite and so on.

original: de yang gsum pa las lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i rnam par dag pa'i gzhi dag gis 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la gnas su zin kyang bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa dang
analyzed: de yang gsum pa las lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i rnam par dag pa'i gzhi dag gis 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la gnas su zin kyang bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa dang
translated: Moreover, the third is the inability to fully discern the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, such as the four establishments of mindfulness, in order to realize the truth, even though one abides in mundane meditative concentration, liberation, meditative absorption, and meditative attainment, due to the bases of purity that abide in superior morality.

original: / 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang thos pa'i chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pa nyid yin pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: / 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang thos pa'i chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pa nyid yin pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: And it is the inability to rest the mind in equanimity beyond the craving for mundane meditative attainment and the Dharma of hearing.

original: gnyen po bsgoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of antidotes?

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by ‚Äúthrough effort to complete that branch.‚Äù

original: sa gsum pa nas bzhi par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sa gsum pa nas bzhi par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: At the time of ascending from the third to the fourth stage,

original: rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba chos la snang bar 'jug pa thob pas gsum pa las 'phar zhing bzhi pa nod par gyur pa de la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba chos la snang bar 'jug pa thob pas gsum pa las 'phar zhing bzhi pa nod par gyur pa de la 'bad pa'o //
translated: one should strive for the cause of increasing purity and the cultivation of the counteragent, called the arrangement, because one has attained the entry into the light of the Dharma.üîΩThere, the cause of increasing purity and the cultivation of the counteragent is called the arrangement because the bodhisattva on the third stage, with very pure light, receives the fourth bodhisattva stage.

original: de la rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa la snang ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa nod pa nas bzhi pa la rnam par dag
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa la snang ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa nod pa nas bzhi pa la rnam par dag
translated: From the time of receiving the fourth stage, the bodhisattva on the fourth stage has the increase of purity called the increase of purity.

original: pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi ye shes yongs su smin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos thos pa'i phyir de @237a * //
analyzed: pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi ye shes yongs su smin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos thos pa'i phyir de @237a * //
translated: Because of the maturation of the wisdom that matures wisdom of the Dharma, he hears the Dharma of that nature in the lineage of the Tathagata.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par grub pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par grub pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the two, the attainment of the family of the Tathagata and the increase of the cultivation of the antidote, is the increase of the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment which are the antidote to the defilements.

original: chos la snang bas 'jug pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnam par dpyad pa tha dad pa la sa gsum pa'i sa rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi snang bas chos rnam par dpyad pa tha dad pa de dag rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos la snang bas 'jug pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnam par dpyad pa tha dad pa la sa gsum pa'i sa rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi snang bas chos rnam par dpyad pa tha dad pa de dag rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The entry by the light of the Dharma is the entry by the light of the wisdom of the third stage into the different analyses of the Dharma of the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: de ni sa gsum pa'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen bo dag sa bzhi pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni sa gsum pa'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen bo dag sa bzhi pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
translated: This is the cause of the purification of the fourth stage itself, which is the antidote to the pride of understanding the Dharma, projected by the adherence to the individual on the third stage, and of the increase of the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de la 'bad pa ni gnyen po bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa ni gnyen po bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: The effort in this is the cultivation of the antidote.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the result of meditation?

original: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the words: He attains.

original: sa bzhi pa rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnyen po bsgoms pa rnam par 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par thob pa bstan pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnyen po bsgoms pa rnam par 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par thob pa bstan pa thob pa'o //
translated: Attainment is taught by the distinction of the abode and the distinction of the result. The distinction of the abode is the establishment of the increase of purification and the establishment of the increase of the meditation of the antidote. The distinction of the result is the establishment of the result.

original: de la rnam par dag pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi yongs su smin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de bdag nyid kyis thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par 'grub pa yin no //
