analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi yongs su smin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de bdag nyid kyis thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the establishment of the increase of purification is the establishment of the increase of the maturation of the dharmas that bring maturation. By the maturation of the dharmas that bring maturation, he is established in the lineage of the Tathagata, because he attains it by his own nature.

original: de la ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos thob pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi po rang gi gnas la gnas pa'i ye shes byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la gnas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi phyir mi ldog
analyzed: de la ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos thob pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi po rang gi gnas la gnas pa'i ye shes byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la gnas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi phyir mi ldog
translated: The Dharma that brings wisdom to maturity is the four kinds of transcendent wisdom, which bring to maturity the wisdom of bodhisattvas who are abiding in the Great Vehicle.

original: pa'i bsam pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes dkon mchog gsum gyi rnam pa shes nas dad pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mi byed pa'i mthar thug pa'i 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: pa'i bsam pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes dkon mchog gsum gyi rnam pa shes nas dad pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mi byed pa'i mthar thug pa'i 'gro ba dang /
translated: The Dharma that brings faith to maturity is the faith of bodhisattvas who are irreversible from the Great Vehicle, who have faith in the Three Jewels and who, knowing the aspects of the Three Jewels, have the wisdom that brings faith to maturity.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos 'du byed kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par rnam par 'jig pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos 'du byed kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par rnam par 'jig pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of the establishment of the defilement and purification of the world is the cause of the perfection of the knowledge of establishment.

original: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa shes pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos 'jig @237b rten 'byung ba dang / las kyi srid par skye ba la rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa shes pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos 'jig @237b rten 'byung ba dang / las kyi srid par skye ba la rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the destruction of birth and death, of the non-arising of things by nature, and of the establishment of karma and rebirth in the world is the cause of the perfection of the knowledge of establishment.üîΩThe attainment of the qualities of the Tathagata family is the cause of the perfection of the knowledge of the attainment of the qualities of the Tathagata family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos thob ba zhes bya ba ni chos gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu phye ba shes bya'i sgrib pa gcod pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos thob ba zhes bya ba ni chos gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu phye ba shes bya'i sgrib pa gcod pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the qualities by which the Tathagata is distinguished, the attainment of the qualities by which the obscuration of the knowable is eliminated, and the attainment of the qualities by which the possession of the knowledge of all modes is attained is the cause of the perfection of the knowledge of the attainment of the qualities of the Tathagata family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi ye shes yongs su smin pas mang du thos pa'i gnas kyis ye shes khyad par du zhugs par gyur pas shes bya'i
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos kyi ye shes yongs su smin pas mang du thos pa'i gnas kyis ye shes khyad par du zhugs par gyur pas shes bya'i
translated: Thus, by the full maturation of the wisdom of Dharma that brings about the full maturation of wisdom, one attains the state of great learning, and by the state of great learning, one attains the special entry into wisdom.

original: sgrib pa spong ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: This is the special attainment of the relinquishment of the obscurations to knowledge.

original: de'i dus na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad par lta ba'i nga rgyal ni yod do //
analyzed: de'i dus na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad par lta ba'i nga rgyal ni yod do //
translated: At that time, one has the pride of viewing the different continuums of the pure powers and so on of the buddhas of the three times.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa'i 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa'i 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa 'phel ba'o //
translated: The increase of the cultivation of the antidote refers to the increase of the cultivation of the factors conducive to enlightenment, which are the antidote to affliction.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is twofold.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba'o //üîΩde la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba'o // de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir bsgom pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum
translated: The increase of meditation for the sake of protection from the defilements and the increase of meditation for the sake of protection from the lower vehicle.

original: cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
translated: The increase of meditation for the sake of protection from the defilements is the meditation on the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment for the sake of eliminating the defilements which are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation, such as the passion of the realm of desire.

original: theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir sgom pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag sems can thams cad lta ba dang bcas pas sgom pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir sgom pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag sems can thams cad lta ba dang bcas pas sgom pa'o //
translated: The increase of meditation for the sake of protection from the lower vehicle is the meditation on those aids to enlightenment together with all sentient beings.

original: de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The result of that is sixfold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po dang / de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba dang / de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang /üîΩde sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po dang / de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba dang / de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa'o //
translated: to be grateful to the teachers who show them those means and to be generous in giving them material things in return and to be generous in giving them the Dharma.üîΩThe special qualities of its resultüîΩThe special qualities of the result are as follows.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The special qualities of its nameüîΩThe name of this ground is Gone Far because the bodhisattvas have gone far in the practice of the transcendent perfections.

original: gnas dang khyad par de dag thos pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes gsungs te /üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob @238a * //
analyzed: gnas dang khyad par de dag thos pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes gsungs te / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob @238a * //
translated: The sixth groundüîΩThe sixth ground, The Manifest

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause for attaining this ground

original: sa lnga pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: The cause for attaining this ground is to have perfected the six transcendent perfections on the fifth ground.üîΩThe etymology of its nameüîΩThe etymology of the name of the sixth ground is as follows.üîΩThe ground is called The Manifest because the transcendent perfection of wisdom manifests in a direct manner.

original: bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa rtag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa rtag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa ste /
translated: The branches of the fifth stage are: the investigation of the truths, the non-one-sidedness with regard to cyclic life and nirvana, and the constant equanimity of mental attention that is directed toward enlightenment.

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The bodhisattva is unable to cultivate the elements that are conducive to enlightenment, which are embraced by the means, because he is still subject to the intimation of subtle signs.

original: sa lnga pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni theg pa dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni theg pa dman pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The opposing factors to the fifth stage are the parinirvana of the Hinayana.

original: de yang sa bzhi pa la 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas su gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu
analyzed: de yang sa bzhi pa la 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas su gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu
translated: Moreover, on the fourth stage, the bodhisattva, on the basis of the meditative concentration that is the basis for the purification of mundane knowledge, cultivates the thirty-seven elements that lead to enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, in order to realize the truths.

original: rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la gnas su zin kyang gnas pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu tha dad par lta ba'i nga rgyal yod pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la gnas su zin kyang gnas pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu tha dad par lta ba'i nga rgyal yod pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Although one has already attained the seventh stage of correct discernment, one is still unable to realize the truths of abiding just as they are, and one still has the pride of viewing the causes of the purity of the powers and so forth of the buddhas of the three times as being different.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the antidote?

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthrough striving to perfect that branch.‚Äù

original: sa bzhi pa nas lnga par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa bzhi pa las 'phar zhing sa lnga pa gnon par gyur pa
analyzed: sa bzhi pa nas lnga par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa bzhi pa las 'phar zhing sa lnga pa gnon par gyur pa
translated: When one has attained the fourth stage and is about to ascend to the fifth stage, one has attained the mental equipoise of purity, which is the antidote to the special pride that is to be abandoned.

original: de la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa'o //
translated: One strives for that.

original: de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug pa na /
translated: The antidote to the special kind of pride is called the establishment of the antidote. When the bodhisattva has completed the path on the fourth bodhisattva stage, when he enters the fifth bodhisattva stage,

original: des sngar sa gsum pa la gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i nga rgyal spangs kyang /
analyzed: des sngar sa gsum pa la gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i nga rgyal spangs kyang /
translated: he has previously abandoned the pride of understanding the teaching, which is projected by clinging to the individual on the third stage.

original: sa bzhi pa nyid kyi tshe na rnam par dag pa 'phel bas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad par lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma spangs pas nga rgyal snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'i nga
analyzed: sa bzhi pa nyid kyi tshe na rnam par dag pa 'phel bas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad par lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma spangs pas nga rgyal snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'i nga
translated: But on the fourth stage itself, he has not abandoned the pride of superiority, which views the continuum of the three times of the buddhas as different, because of the increase of purity.

original: rgyal de'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal de'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the antidote is the antidote to that pride, which is superior to the previous pride.

original: rnam par dag pa la sems @238b kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa la sems @238b kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Purity is the purification of the Buddha qualities of the Buddhas of the three times, such as the powers.

original: de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa dag dang ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur ba tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa dag dang ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur ba tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dag go //
translated: And those Buddha qualities are the powers, etc. of the three times, and the morality, concentration, wisdom, and the bringing of sentient beings to maturity, by which one becomes a Buddha.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa de dag gi rgyud tha mi dad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa de dag gi rgyud tha mi dad par mthong ba ste /
translated: The sameness of the thoughts of sentient beings is the perception of the non-difference of the mind-streams of those who have that purity.

original: de la 'bad pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin no //
translated: The effort in that is the cultivation of the antidote.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the result of cultivation?

original: de yang thob pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yang thob pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is indicated by the word attainment.

original: sa lnga pa mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par bstan pa theb po de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sa lnga pa mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par bstan pa theb po de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang /
translated: The special practice of the non-abiding path on the fifth ground, the presentation of its result, and the presentation of the special benefits of the result.

original: 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig nas sems can snying brtse bas brtson 'grus sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig nas sems can snying brtse bas brtson 'grus sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The special practice of the non-abiding path is called the special realization of the truths through the pure knowledge of objects, which is the non-abiding in samsara and the non-abiding in nirvana through the special practice of effort out of love for sentient beings, knowing that all conditioned things are false and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The special realization of the truths through the pure knowledge of objects is twofold.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pas rab tu shes pa'i phyir bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pas rab tu shes pa'i phyir bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste ;
translated: The presentation of the reality of the truths is fully known because of the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pas bden pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pas bden pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nyid yin la /
translated: The two truths are presented as the reality of defiled phenomena because of the difference between cause and effect.

original: gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid du rnam par gzhag pas rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid du rnam par gzhag pas rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The other two are presented as the reality of purified phenomena.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa rab tu shes pa'i phyir sems can yongs su grol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba dang / theg pa chen po'i 'dul ba tha dad pa dag la kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa rab tu shes pa'i phyir sems can yongs su grol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba dang / theg pa chen po'i 'dul ba tha dad pa dag la kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: The presentation of the means for liberating sentient beings is fully known because of the knowledge of conventional truth, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rim pa thams cad la mtshams sbyar ba bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rim pa thams cad la mtshams sbyar ba bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the connection with all the stages of the bodhisattva,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas @239a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas @239a * //
translated: It is to be skilled in the truth of the arising of the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas.üîΩ

original: pa rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: pa rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: He knows the arrangement of the skill in the truths up to the arising of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs pristine wisdom.

original: de gnyis kyis ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas pa bstan to //üîΩ'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig nas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pas brdzun pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas slu ba'i chos can dang dar ba'i mtha' rgud
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pas 'khor ba la mi gnas pa bstan to // 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig nas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pas brdzun pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas slu ba'i chos can dang dar ba'i mtha' rgud
translated: These two verses teach that, by realizing the truths, one does not abide in cyclic existence.üîΩHaving known all conditioned things to be false, etc.,

original: pa yin pas 'du shes pa dang phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po phyogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yin pas 'du shes pa dang phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po phyogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid par rigs par bya'o //
translated: means that, because they lack the signs of permanence, etc., they are false; because they are the basis for the manifest clinging to permanence, etc., they are deceptive phenomena; because their end is decline, they are perishable; and because they attract the foolish by the perfection of their appearance, they should be known as deceiving the childish.üîΩOut of compassion for sentient beings

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: means that great compassion manifests toward sentient beings.

original: byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: The light of great love also arises.

original: de la snying rje chen po ni rgyu gnyis kyis mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po ni rgyu gnyis kyis mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Great compassion arises from two causes:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang dus ring po nas 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang dus ring po nas 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la /
translated: from the correct discernment of dependent origination, one observes suffering as it really is; and from the correct discernment of the various kinds of suffering that have been experienced for a long time,

original: so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal drag po la dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal drag po la dmigs pa las so //
translated: one observes intense suffering.

original: byams pa chen po'i snang ba ni de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa'i sems tsan de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa thob par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i snang ba ni de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa'i sems tsan de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa thob par gyur pa nas /
translated: The light of great love arises from the desire to help those who are tormented by suffering, from the desire to bring them to the attainment of the highest happiness, from the desire to bring them to the attainment of the highest purity, and from the desire to bring them to the attainment of the highest purity, and from the desire to bring them to the attainment of the highest liberation.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs kyis ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyis mthar thug pa thob par bya ba'i don du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs kyis ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyis mthar thug pa thob par bya ba'i don du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the light of great love arises from the desire to bring them to the attainment of the highest liberation through the knowledge of the ten powers up to the attainment of the unobstructed knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don du bdag nyid gcig bu gnyis su med par gyur nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs shing sems can thams cad yongs su skyob bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don du bdag nyid gcig bu gnyis su med par gyur nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs shing sems can thams cad yongs su skyob bar byed pa ste /
translated: The special practice of effort is that, for their sake, one becomes a solitary being, without a second, and accumulates the collections of merit and wisdom, and protects all sentient beings.

original: de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan to //
translated: These show that one does not remain in nirvana.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The classification of its results is fourfold:

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the classification of the special acquisition of good qualities, the classification of the special practice, the classification of the special evolutionary development of living beings, and the classification of the special mundane knowledge that is accomplished.

original: de la yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par du rig par bya'o //
translated: The special retention of good qualities should be understood as the special retention of learning, morality, and knowledge.

original: sgrub pa'i khyad par @239b zhes bya ba ni bden par mtho ba'i rgyu dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i khyad par @239b zhes bya ba ni bden par mtho ba'i rgyu dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special practice is the practice of the cause of high rebirth and the cause of definite goodness, and so forth.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The special development of living beings is

original: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: the four means of unification, and so forth.

original: de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni gnod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yi ge la sogs pa dang / sdom pa'i cho ga la gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni gnod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yi ge la sogs pa dang / sdom pa'i cho ga la gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special attainment of mundane knowledge in conformity with that is the attainment of the antidote to harm and secondary defilement, such as the letters and so forth, and the observance of the rules of vows, and so forth.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The special benefit of the effect is as above.

original: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one attains that abiding and distinction, it is said that it is perfected by that factor.

original: sa drug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa drug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the elimination of the sixth stage's resistance?

original: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas nas de la skyo ba mang ba dang / mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas nas de la skyo ba mang ba dang / mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Since one is unable to manifest the engagement of formative influence and to abide frequently in the signless mental attention through dispassion for it, it is said that it is not perfected by that factor.

original: sa drug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa drug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The resistance of the sixth stage is the occurrence of gross signs.

original: de yang sa lnga pa la byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa la gnas su zin kyang de ma shes pas sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa
analyzed: de yang sa lnga pa la byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa la gnas su zin kyang de ma shes pas sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa
translated: Furthermore, although on the fifth ground one has already come to abide in the correct realization of the noble truths in dependence on the thorough differentiation of the factors of enlightenment, one is still unable to generate a great deal of disenchantment through the thorough differentiation of the arising of suffering together with its causeüîΩand the thorough differentiation of the cessation of suffering together with its cause through knowing that.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed par rab tu phye ba dang / de shes pas sdug bsngal 'gog pa rgyu dang bcas pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba'i skyo ba mang po bskyed par mi nus pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du ma 'gyur par mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pa nyid yinüîΩpar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed par rab tu phye ba dang / de shes pas sdug bsngal 'gog pa rgyu dang bcas pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba'i skyo ba mang po bskyed par mi nus pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du ma 'gyur par mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: And one is still unable to abide for the most part in the attention of signlessness through the mode of appearance of the perfection of wisdom called ‚Äúfacing the wisdom of nonattachment.‚Äù

original: gnyen po sgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po sgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the antidote?

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe strives to perfect it by that factor‚Äù indicates that.

original: sa lnga pa nas sa drug par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sa lnga pa nas sa drug par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: When he moves from the fifth to the sixth stage,

original: nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya bas chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa lnga pa las 'phar zhing sa drug pa gnon par 'gyur ba de la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya bas chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa lnga pa las 'phar zhing sa drug pa gnon par 'gyur ba de la 'bad pa'o //
translated: he strives to perfect the antidote to the special pride that is called ‚Äúthe establishment of the equality of all things.‚Äù

original: @240a * // de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyis khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: @240a * // de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyis khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug pa na /
translated: The special pride that is called ‚Äúthe establishment of the equality of all things‚Äù is as follows. When the bodhisattva, having completed the path on the fifth bodhisattva stage, enters the sixth bodhisattva stage, he attains the equality of all things.

original: sngar sa bzhi pa las gsum pa'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan pa dang / sa lnga pas bzhi pa'i dus na dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad pa lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan pa de las khyad par du gyur pa sa lnga pa'i dus na chos la mngon par zhen pa
analyzed: sngar sa bzhi pa las gsum pa'i dus na gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan pa dang / sa lnga pas bzhi pa'i dus na dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad pa lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan pa de las khyad par du gyur pa sa lnga pa'i dus na chos la mngon par zhen pa
translated: Previously, on the fourth ground, the antidote to the manifest pride of understanding the Dharma was taught, which was projected by the manifest clinging to the person on the third ground.üîΩOn the fifth ground, the antidote to the manifest pride of viewing the pure continuum of the three times and so on as different was taught.

original: las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos tha dad par lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal de'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos tha dad par lta ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal de'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa la bya'o //
translated: The presentation of the antidote to the manifest pride that arises from clinging to the Dharma on the fifth ground and from viewing the phenomena of affliction and purification as different should be understood as superior to that.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas zhes bya bas ni skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas zhes bya bas ni skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: By the phrase ‚Äúthrough attaining the sameness of phenomena,‚Äù it is understood that the imagined nature of the twelve sense spheres is realized to be the same in being nonexistent.

original: de la 'bad pa ni gnyis po bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa ni gnyis po bsgom pa yin no //
translated: The effort in that is the cultivation of the two.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of the result of cultivation?

original: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'thob po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is taught by ‚Äúhe attains.‚Äù

original: sa drug pa la mi gnas par lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gyis khyad par bstan pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa drug pa la mi gnas par lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gyis khyad par bstan pa thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the result is taught by the special presentation of the path of practice without abiding on the sixth stage, by the presentation of its result, and by the special benefit of the result.

original: de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba la ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba la ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The special presentation of the path of practice without abiding is the nonabiding in nirvana because of the compassion of the three times, which is the possession of the view of sentient beings, and the nonabiding in samsara because of the discernment of all aspects of subtle dependent origination, which is the purity of wisdom.

original: de la dus gsum gyi snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas sems can la lta ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bya ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de la dus gsum gyi snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas sems can la lta ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bya ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva's view of sentient beings, which is based on the bodhisattva's possession of the distinctive compassion of the three times, refers to the bodhisattva's view of the origination and destruction of the world, which is preceded by great compassion, which is governed by great compassion, and which is perfected by great compassion.

original: 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba dang / des ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba dang / des ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par bstan to //
translated: This view of the origination and destruction of the world is the bodhisattva's means of avoiding the extreme of nirvana.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pas zhes bya ba la ye shes rnam par dag pa @240b zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'jug pa cha phra ba la sgo gsum nas rtog pa ste
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pas zhes bya ba la ye shes rnam par dag pa @240b zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'jug pa cha phra ba la sgo gsum nas rtog pa ste
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva's discernment of the aspects of the profound dependent origination refers to the bodhisattva's discernment of the three doors of insight into the subtle process of dependent origination.

original: / sgo gsum ni sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so ;
analyzed: / sgo gsum ni sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so ;
translated: The three doors are: the door of establishment, the door of answers to objections, and the door of the presentation of the characteristics.

original: / de la sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par sgrub pa'o //üîΩbrgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med du zin na /
analyzed: / de la sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par sgrub pa'o // brgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med du zin na /
translated: The door of establishment is the establishment of selflessness in dependent origination.

original: bdag ni mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la byis pa'i blo can du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la byis pa'i blo can du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab pa'o //
translated: The door of answers to objections is the answer to the objection, ‚ÄúIf there is no self, how can attachment to self arise?‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag ba zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas shing 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag ba zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas shing 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The door of the presentation of the characteristics is the presentation of the twelve members of dependent origination as they are established by their characteristics.üîΩThe door of the presentation of the ultimate truth is the presentation of the ultimate truth of dependent origination as it is established by its characteristics.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de yongs su shes pas rnam par grol bar gyur pa de yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de yongs su shes pas rnam par grol bar gyur pa de yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: The chapter called ‚ÄúThe Gate of the Presentation of the Ultimate Truth‚Äù is the investigation of how one becomes liberated through understanding it.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yongs su rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yongs su rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The chapter called ‚ÄúThe Gate of the Presentation of the Conventional Truth‚Äù is the investigation of how one enters into the ultimate truth through understanding it.

original: don rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six topics:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa dang / rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes dmigs bsdu bar yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes pa spang ba yongs su brtag pa dang / yid mi 'byung ba dang yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa dang / rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes dmigs bsdu bar yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes pa spang ba yongs su brtag pa dang / yid mi 'byung ba dang yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa dang /
translated: the investigation of the basis of affliction, the investigation of the cause, the investigation of the summary of problems, the investigation of the abandonment of faults, the investigation of the causes of despair and inspiration,

original: zab pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: zab pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: and the investigation of profundity.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i yan lag rnam pa bdag dang bral ba'i sems tsam la brten pas sems gcig pu la brten par yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i yan lag rnam pa bdag dang bral ba'i sems tsam la brten pas sems gcig pu la brten par yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: The examination of the basis of affliction is the examination of the mind alone as the basis, since the members of existence are based on the mind alone, which is devoid of a self.

original: rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The examination of the cause is twofold:

original: rang gi bya ba byed pas yan lag gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su brtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su brtag pa dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi rgyu'i dngos por rkyen du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir bdag nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o //üîΩnyes dmigs bsdus par yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis nyon mongs pa dang / las dang sdug bsngal @241a * //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba byed pas yan lag gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su brtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su brtag pa dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi rgyu'i dngos por rkyen du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir bdag nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o // nyes dmigs bsdus par yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis nyon mongs pa dang / las dang sdug bsngal @241a * //
translated: The examination of the other continuum is the examination of the cause of the other continuum, because it is the cause of the activity of the other members. The examination of the self is the examination of the condition in the nature of the cause of its own class, such as ignorance.

original: gyi lam gsum gyis bsdus par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: gyi lam gsum gyis bsdus par brtag pa'o //
translated: The examination of the collection of disadvantages is the examination of the twelve members as included in the three: the path of affliction, action, and suffering.

original: nyes pa yongs su spang bar brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la nyes pa gsum yod pa gzhan rtog pa yongs su spong ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa yongs su spang bar brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la nyes pa gsum yod pa gzhan rtog pa yongs su spong ba ste /
translated: The investigation of the complete abandonment of faults is the complete abandonment of the three faults imagined by others in the proponent of dependent origination.

original: nyes pa gsum ni rgyu bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa dang / byed po med pa las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / 'bras bu ma bskyed par rgyu 'gag pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum ni rgyu bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa dang / byed po med pa las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / 'bras bu ma bskyed par rgyu 'gag pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The three faults are the fault that all bodies would simultaneously arise because there is no specific cause, the fault that there would be no object of action without an agent, and the fault that karma would perish because a cause would cease without generating a result.

original: nyes pa de gsum ni dus gsum gyi mthar bltas pas rim bzhin du yongs su spang bar brtag go //
analyzed: nyes pa de gsum ni dus gsum gyi mthar bltas pas rim bzhin du yongs su spang bar brtag go //
translated: These three faults are completely abandoned in order by observing the three times.

original: yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gsum las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal cha phra mo ni yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gsum las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal cha phra mo ni yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The investigation of the cause of non-discouragement and discouragement is that the subtle aspect of the suffering of contaminated formations does not cause discouragement.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rags pas ni yid 'byung bar brtag go ;üîΩ/ zab pa nyid yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩrang gi rgyud las byung ba'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams bdag gis ma byas pa dang / bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas byed pa med pa'i phyir skye ba tsam la rag las pas gnyis kas ma byas pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rags pas ni yid 'byung bar brtag go ; / zab pa nyid yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste / rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams bdag gis ma byas pa dang / bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas byed pa med pa'i phyir skye ba tsam la rag las pas gnyis kas ma byas pa dang /
translated: The gross suffering of suffering and the suffering of change are to be considered as the causes of disgust.

original: srid pa'i lugs bzhin du 'byung bas rgyu med pa las ma byung bas zab par yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i lugs bzhin du 'byung bas rgyu med pa las ma byung bas zab par yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The four kinds of profundity are: the members of existence are not created by another, because they arise from one's own continuum; the members of existence are not created by a self, because they arise from conditions; the members of existence are not created by both, because they are not created by a self and not created by another, and because they are dependent on the mere occurrence of the cause; and the members of existence do not arise causelessly, because they arise in accordance with the system of causality.

original: de dag gis ni shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba la mi gnas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by these four kinds of profundity, it is shown that one does not remain in cyclic life because of the purity of intuition with respect to the knowable.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The fivefold classification of its result is:

original: gnyen po 'thob pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa dang gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / nus pa'i khyad par thob pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po 'thob pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa dang gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / nus pa'i khyad par thob pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the attainment of the counteragent, the distinction of the weakening of the adverse elements, the attainment of the distinction of practice and of the distinction of meditative concentration, the attainment of the distinction of mental disposition, and the attainment of the distinction of ability.

original: de la gnyen po thob pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnyen po thob pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein, the attainment of the counteragent and the distinction of the weakening of the adverse elements.

original: gnyen po thob ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po thob ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the counteragent refers to the attainment of the three doors of liberation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum po bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / byed pa po dang tsher ba po'i 'du shes dang / @241b yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum po bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / byed pa po dang tsher ba po'i 'du shes dang / @241b yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'o //
translated: The weakening of the adverse elements refers to the absence of the three kinds of conceptualization, namely, the conceptualization of self and other, the conceptualization of the agent and the object of action, and the conceptualization of existence and non-existence.

original: sgrub pa dang gnas kyi khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni sgrub pa rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩgo cha'i sgrub pa 'dus byas la nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par yongs su shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / skye ba'i tshogs pa spong pa sems can gyi don byed pa khyad par can dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po nyes pa mang po skyon chags par so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang gnas kyi khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni sgrub pa rnam pa gnyis te / go cha'i sgrub pa 'dus byas la nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par yongs su shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / skye ba'i tshogs pa spong pa sems can gyi don byed pa khyad par can dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po nyes pa mang po skyon chags par so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: The special attainment is the two kinds of attainment:üîΩThe attainment of armor is the knowledge that compounded things are flawed by many faults, and the special benefit for sentient beings is the abandonment of the bonds of karma and affliction and of the collection of birth.

original: spong ba'i gnyen pos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis med par so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i gnyen pos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis med par so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The attainment of engagement is the individual investigation of the many faults that are flaws, which is the antidote of complete rejection, and the individual investigation of the absence of intrinsic reality of general and specific characteristics, which is the antidote of abandonment.

original: gnas pa'i khyad par ni ye shes dang snying rje'i khyad par dang ldan pas mi gnas pa'i lam la gnas pa dang / de'i tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: gnas pa'i khyad par ni ye shes dang snying rje'i khyad par dang ldan pas mi gnas pa'i lam la gnas pa dang / de'i tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du gyur pa dang /
translated: And, because one's equipment is not yet complete, one is on the perfection of wisdom called facing unobstructed intuition, which is manifest in the manner of illumination.

original: 'dus byas dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rab tu rtogs pas de dang mi 'grogs mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rab tu rtogs pas de dang mi 'grogs mi gnas pa'o //
translated: And, by thoroughly realizing the equality of the compounded and the uncompounded, one does not associate with or abide in that.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i sgo ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag bcu mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i sgo ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag bcu mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The distinctive feature of concentration is that one hundred thousand concentrations such as emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness become manifest.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i phyir mi phyed pa'i bsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub la shin tu song ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i phyir mi phyed pa'i bsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub la shin tu song ba thob pa'o //
translated: The special thought is mentioned in order to show that one attains the special thought which is undivided, and which is directed towards the enlightenment of the Tathagatas.

original: nus pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i nus pa dang / the tshom sel ba'i nus pa dang / theg pa la mi g-yo ba'i nus pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas la mos pa'i nus pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i nus pa dang / the tshom sel ba'i nus pa dang / theg pa la mi g-yo ba'i nus pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas la mos pa'i nus pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The special ability is mentioned in order to show that one attains the ability to defeat opponents, the ability to resolve doubts, the ability to remain unshaken in one's vehicle, the ability to have faith in the secret points, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The special benefit of the result is as previously explained.

original: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang khyad par de dag thob pas na de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase one who has attained the state of abiding and distinction means that one who has attained the state of abiding and distinction is one who has perfected that stage.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one abandons the counteragent, cultivates the counteragent, and attains the result of cultivation.

original: sa bdun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the abandonment of the counteragent on the seventh stage?

original: bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa'i mang du gnas par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya bas bstan te /üîΩsa bdun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mtshan ma phra ba @242a * //

translated: Because they are unable to abide for a long time in signless attention without interruption or break, that branch is incomplete.

original: kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The subtle signs that occur are the counteragents to the seventh level.üîΩThey are distinguished by the thorough differentiation of suffering and its cause, which is due to the nonunderstanding of that, and by the thorough differentiation of the cessation of suffering and its cause, which is due to the understanding of that.
