translated: The etymology of the word pudgala is explained:

original: mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is called pudgala because it is unshaken by the occurrence of the defilement of signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva obtains the immovable stage because he is unshaken by the arising of the passions associated with signs.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: This is shown in two ways.

original: gcig tu mi g-yo ba dang / gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo bas sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu mi g-yo ba dang / gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo bas sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He obtains the immovable stage because he is unshaken by the one and by the many.

original: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni rtag par rgyun du de bzhin @258b gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni rtag par rgyun du de bzhin @258b gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: Therein, he is unshaken by the one because he is always and continuously well-blessed by the buddhas.

original: de yang yon tan rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang yon tan rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood in terms of five virtues.

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsdu bas mchod pa'i yon tan dang / lag na rdo rje rtag par phyi bzhin du 'brang bas kun du bsrungs pa'i yon tan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs ma btang bas gnas kyi yon tan dang /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsdu bas mchod pa'i yon tan dang / lag na rdo rje rtag par phyi bzhin du 'brang bas kun du bsrungs pa'i yon tan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs ma btang bas gnas kyi yon tan dang /
translated: The qualities of being worshipped by Indra, Brahma and the world protectors, the quality of being constantly guarded by Vajrapani, the quality of abiding by not giving up the power of samadhi,

original: lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: the quality of the complete purity of the realm by accomplishing immeasurable divisions of the body and the five qualities of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: lus kyi spyod pa'i stobs thams cad dang ldan pas ched du bsams te skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan dang mngon par shes pa chen po rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pas dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes pa'i nus pa'i yon
analyzed: lus kyi spyod pa'i stobs thams cad dang ldan pas ched du bsams te skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan dang mngon par shes pa chen po rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pas dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes pa'i nus pa'i yon
translated: The quality of taking birth through deliberate choice by possessing all the powers of physical conduct, the quality of the power to know the faculties, thoughts and latent tendencies of others by perfecting the fully ripened effect of the great superknowledges,

original: tan dang / ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pas chos kyi tshul la gzud pa'i phyir chos mtha' yas pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i yon tan dang / lung bstan pa tshad med pa yang dag par nod pas 'dzin nus pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: tan dang / ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pas chos kyi tshul la gzud pa'i phyir chos mtha' yas pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i yon tan dang / lung bstan pa tshad med pa yang dag par nod pas 'dzin nus pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: And because they have mastery over infinite qualities and concentrations, they have the quality of being able to retain infinite Dharma teachings in order to introduce beings to the way of the Dharma.üîΩAnd because they have received limitless prophecies, they have the quality of being able to retain them.üîΩAnd because they demonstrate perfect enlightenment in accordance with the full maturation of beings, they have the quality of being able to explain the Dharma.

original: 'gro ba ji ltar yongs su smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pas bshad pa'i nus pa'i yon tan gyis gcig tu mi g-yo bas sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'gro ba ji ltar yongs su smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pas bshad pa'i nus pa'i yon tan gyis gcig tu mi g-yo bas sa mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Because they are unmoved in any of these, they are said to have attained the immovable level.

original: gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor tha dad pa med par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor tha dad pa med par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Unmoved in their oneness refers to their having entered the mandala of the Great Vehicle without any differentiation.

original: de ni tha mi dad pa rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni tha mi dad pa rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood in terms of nine aspects of nondifferentiation.

original: shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes dang mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pas ye shes tha mi dad pa dang / rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong bas bshad pa tha mi dad pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes dang mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pas ye shes tha mi dad pa dang / rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong bas bshad pa tha mi dad pa dang /
translated: They constantly emit the light rays of the illumination of insight, so their teaching is undifferentiated.üîΩThey have entered the path of the unattached expanse of reality, so their liberation is undifferentiated.üîΩThey are skilled in discerning the paths of the world systems, so their pure buddha field is undifferentiated.

original: chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pas rnam par grol ba tha mi dad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lam rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pas zhing yongs su dag pa tha mi dad pa dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pas theg pa chen po las 'jug pa tha mi dad pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pas rnam par grol ba tha mi dad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lam rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pas zhing yongs su dag pa tha mi dad pa dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pas theg pa chen po las 'jug pa tha mi dad pa dang /
translated: They perfectly demonstrate all the aspects of good qualities, so their entry into the Great Vehicle is undifferentiated.

original: rang gi sems sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pas thams cad shes pa tha mi dad pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas dri ba lung ston par nus pa tha @259a * //
analyzed: rang gi sems sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pas thams cad shes pa tha mi dad pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas dri ba lung ston par nus pa tha @259a * //
translated: Since it controls the generation of one's own mind, it is the nondifferentiation of omniscience.üîΩSince it possesses the pristine wisdom that thoroughly realizes the prior limit and the later limit, it is the nondifferentiation of the ability to answer questions and give predictions.üîΩSince it possesses the pristine wisdom that engages and turns away from all the activities of Mara, it is the nondifferentiation of entering the essence of enlightenment.

original: mi dad pa dang / bdud kyi las thams cad 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas byang chub kyi snying po la 'jug pa tha mi dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tha mi dad pas gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi dad pa dang / bdud kyi las thams cad 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas byang chub kyi snying po la 'jug pa tha mi dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tha mi dad pas gcig pa nyid du mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it enters all the domains and spheres of activity of the Tathagata, it is the nondifferentiation of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the eighth level is called the Immovable.

original: sa dgu pa ni zhes bya ba las sa dgu pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul la /
analyzed: sa dgu pa ni zhes bya ba las sa dgu pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul la /
translated: The ninth level is called the Good Intelligence because it is the level of the perfection of the wisdom that is the intelligence of the Dharma.

original: ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par sgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po thob pas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par sgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po thob pas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Excellent intelligence is taught by the attainment of the vast intelligence of the analytical knowledges that accomplish the teaching of the Dharma through excellent speech.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul ni /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul ni /
translated: The object of perfect knowledge

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: is the power to teach the Dharma in all its aspects.üîΩOn the ninth level, the perfection of knowledge is taught.

original: sa dgu pa la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la gang shes nas gang gi dbang du byas te ston pa zhes bstan pa la gang shes nas ston ce na /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la gang shes nas gang gi dbang du byas te ston pa zhes bstan pa la gang shes nas ston ce na /
translated: What is taught through knowing what and taking what as the basis?

original: yongs su smin par gyur pa'i grol ba'i snod dang / gdul bas rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin dang / theg pa gsum tha dad pas rnam par grol ba'i bar du dbye ba shes nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin par gyur pa'i grol ba'i snod dang / gdul bas rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin dang / theg pa gsum tha dad pas rnam par grol ba'i bar du dbye ba shes nas ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught through knowing the vessel of liberation that is fully matured, the nature of liberation through being guided and the classification of liberation through the different vehicles.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas ston ce na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas ston ce na /
translated: What is taught by taking what as the basis?

original: gnyen po'i man ngag gi snod dang / chos bstan pa'i snod dang / dpe ji lta bu nye bar sgrub pa'i snod dang / rnam grangs ji lta bu'i snod la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ston pa shes pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i man ngag gi snod dang / chos bstan pa'i snod dang / dpe ji lta bu nye bar sgrub pa'i snod dang / rnam grangs ji lta bu'i snod la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ston pa shes pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i yul ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: The vast intelligence of the analytical knowledges that accomplishes the teaching of the Dharma through perfect speech isüîΩtaught by the line he attains the vast intelligence of the analytical knowledges.

original: ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par sgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po 'thob pa ni /
analyzed: ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par sgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po 'thob pa ni /
translated: The vast intelligence of the analytical knowledges that accomplishes the teaching of the Dharma through perfect speech is

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: taught by the line he attains the vast intelligence of the analytical knowledges.

original: sa dgu pa la ngag phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de ltar ye shes tshad med pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshig gis chos ston pa zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ngag phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de ltar ye shes tshad med pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshig gis chos ston pa zhes bstan pa la /
translated: On the ninth level, called that of The One of Perfect Intelligence, he has limitless gnosis and so teaches the Dharma with the words that are accomplished by means of the four kinds of perfect knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshig gis chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gis chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni ngag phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa yin no //
translated: The words that he uses to teach the Dharma are the perfect speech that he has.

original: de mngon par sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa ni ngag phun @259b sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de mngon par sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa ni ngag phun @259b sum tshogs pas chos ston pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo gros rgya chen po thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The accomplishment of that is the attainment of the four kinds of perfect knowledge of the bodhisattvas, which is called the attainment of the vast intelligence of the perfect knowledge that accomplishes the teaching of the Dharma with perfect speech.

original: de ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su dag cing mi g-yo ba nyid la brten nas blo gros rgya chen po rgya che ba shin tu thob ste /
analyzed: de ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su dag cing mi g-yo ba nyid la brten nas blo gros rgya chen po rgya che ba shin tu thob ste /
translated: This is the attainment of the vast, vast intelligence on the basis of the utterly pure and unwavering concentration endowed with wisdom.

original: gzhan dag la chos yang dag par ston pa bla na med pa las brtsams nas chos kyi rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'byed pa'i blo gros yin pas na de thob pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la chos yang dag par ston pa bla na med pa las brtsams nas chos kyi rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'byed pa'i blo gros yin pas na de thob pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and from the perspective of the unsurpassed correct teaching of the Dharma to others, it is the intellect that begins with the Dharma discourses, characteristics, etymologies, and classifications, and it is the intellect that analyzes and differentiates them.

original: de'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the ninth level is called Excellent Intellect.

original: sa bcu pa ni zhes bya ba las bcu pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni bstan pa las sa 'di la sprin dang 'dra ba'i chos rnam pa gsum gyis chos kyi sprin zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa ni zhes bya ba las bcu pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni bstan pa las sa 'di la sprin dang 'dra ba'i chos rnam pa gsum gyis chos kyi sprin zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: The tenth level is called Cloud of Dharma because, like a cloud, it is endowed with three qualities that cause rain to fall.

original: thos pa'i chos sprin lta bus sa bcu pa'i lus nam mkha' lta bu la khyab par byed pas khyab pa dang / chos des sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang / me lce rab tu zhi bar byed pas rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa'i chos sprin lta bus sa bcu pa'i lus nam mkha' lta bu la khyab par byed pas khyab pa dang / chos des sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang / me lce rab tu zhi bar byed pas rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: That Dharma completely pacifies the dust and flames of the afflictions of sentient beings, so it is completely pacifying.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can 'don pa'i phyir sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'don pa bzhin du 'don pas so //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can 'don pa'i phyir sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'don pa bzhin du 'don pas so //
translated: And it is like a cloud that produces a harvest through rain, because it gradually delivers sentient beings from the realm of Tushita and so on.

original: de la khyab par byed pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi tshogs sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi tshogs sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Pervasiveness is indicated by the phrase pervading the spacelike body of negative tendencies with the great cloudlike accumulation of Dharma.

original: de phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa las skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig las chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi gsal ba chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po tshad med pa bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa las skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig las chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi gsal ba chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po tshad med pa bzod pa dang /
translated: In an instant, a short moment, a small fraction of time, from the immeasurable bhagavat buddhas of the ten directions, the bodhisattva accepts the great light of Dharma, the great illumination of Dharma, and the great cloud of Dharma.

original: yang dag par len pa dang / bdag gir byed pa dang yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par len pa dang / bdag gir byed pa dang yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the correct adoption, the appropriation, and the correct grasping of those dharmas.

original: rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / 'don par byed pa ni khebs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan te /üîΩchos de dag sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang ; me lce rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas snying brtse ba dang /
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / 'don par byed pa ni khebs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bstan te / chos de dag sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang ; me lce rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas snying brtse ba dang /
translated: It is the pacification and the removal of the burning, as is shown by the words ‚Äúbecause of the covering.‚Äù

original: snying rje chen po'i sprin gyi chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrag pa'i 'brug sgra chen po rab tu sgrogs pa dang / bdud kyi @260a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i sprin gyi chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrag pa'i 'brug sgra chen po rab tu sgrogs pa dang / bdud kyi @260a * //
translated: The pacification of the burning of the dust of the afflictions and the flames of the afflictions of those beings is the great roar of the thunder of the great cloud of compassion and the great light of the Dharma of the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva stage Cloud of Dharma.

original: tshogs shin tu tshar gcod pa kun nas bsdus pa'i skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par bkang nas dge ba'i bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun chen pos bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa
analyzed: tshogs shin tu tshar gcod pa kun nas bsdus pa'i skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par bkang nas dge ba'i bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun chen pos bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa
translated: In a single instant, a short moment, a small fraction of time, he fills the extensive worlds of the ten directions and with a great rain of the nectar of virtue, he pacifies all the dust and flames of ignorance

original: las langs pa'i rdul dang me lce thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las langs pa'i rdul dang me lce thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: arisen from karma in the minds of sentient beings, in accordance with their wishes.

original: dga' ldan gnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can 'don pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can 'don pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva level Cloud of Dharma gradually delivers sentient beings from the Abode of Tushita and so on.

original: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang /üîΩbdud btul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang /
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang / bdud btul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang /
translated: and the deeds of the Tathagata, such as passing away, passing into nirvana, entering the womb, being born, enjoying youth, living in the retinue of queens, leaving home, practicing austerities, going to the site of enlightenment,

original: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pas sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'don pa bzhin du sems can 'don par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pas sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'don pa bzhin du sems can 'don par byed pa yin te /
translated: subduing Mara, attaining manifest, perfect buddhahood, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and demonstrating great nirvana, are all blessed to be like clouds that bring down rain to ripen crops, ripening sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations and the way they are to be guided.

original: de'i phyir sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the tenth level is called the Cloud of Dharma.

original: sa bcu gcig pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eleventh stage is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i nges pa'i tshig ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi sgo nas shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'jug pas kun du 'od ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i nges pa'i tshig ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi sgo nas shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'jug pas kun du 'od ces bya bar ston to //
translated: The etymology of the stage of buddhahood is taught by the phrase ‚Äúbecause the light of nonattachment and unobstructedness enters into all aspects of objects of knowledge.‚Äù

original: de la spangs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas zhes bya bas bstan te /üîΩye shes kyi sgo nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la spangs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas zhes bya bas bstan te / ye shes kyi sgo nas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching by way of abandonment is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúbecause the extremely subtle afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience are abandoned.‚Äù

original: chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnam par thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnam par thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The teaching by way of exalted wisdom is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúbecause all aspects of objects of knowledge are manifestly and completely enlightened without attachment and without obstruction.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it is called the buddha stage indicates that the stage of buddhahood is called universal light because it is the basis of the light of nonobstructed knowledge that illuminates all aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: ming @260b la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ming @260b la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the terms for skill in name, etc., has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the terms for skill in the differentiation of counteragents, etc., should be explained.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni sngar sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'o ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni sngar sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'o ;
translated: The differentiation of counteragents is the differentiation of the counteragents to the stages that have already been explained.

original: / de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: counteragents to the liberation of wisdom and counteragents to the liberation of mind.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun du rmongs pa ni du mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun du rmongs pa ni du mchis /
translated: The Blessed One, how many kinds of delusion are there?

original: gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: How many kinds of negative tendencies are there that are adverse to the factors that contribute to enlightenment?

original: kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni sa bcu gcig la gnyis gnyis su sbyar te /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni sa bcu gcig la gnyis gnyis su sbyar te /
translated: Twenty-two kinds of delusion are mentioned. Two are associated with each of the eleven stages.

original: de ni ma rig pa yin pas shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa yin pas shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Since these are forms of nescience, they are adverse to the perfection of wisdom.

original: gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ces bya ba ni sa bcu gcig la re rer sbyar te de ni bag la nyal yin pas sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ces bya ba ni sa bcu gcig la re rer sbyar te de ni bag la nyal yin pas sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Eleven kinds of negative tendencies are mentioned. One is associated with each of the eleven stages. Since these are forms of latent afflictions, they are adverse to the perfection of mind.

original: sa dang po la ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa dang po la ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the first stage, the bodhisattva abandons the delusion that consists in the notional attachment to the multiplicity of the apprehended object.

original: sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so so'i skye bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so so'i skye bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: (a) the confusion that consists in the adherence to the personal entity and the dharmas and (b) the confusion that consists in the moral defilement of the lower realms.

original: so so'i skye bo'i dus na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dus na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: At the time of being an ordinary being, one adheres to a personal entity and engages in non-virtue.

original: ma rig pa de gnyis yod na mthong ba'i lam gyi shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de gnyis ni sa dang po'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no ;
analyzed: ma rig pa de gnyis yod na mthong ba'i lam gyi shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de gnyis ni sa dang po'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no ;
translated: Since the path of vision does not arise if these two kinds of nescience exist, therefore, these two are the adverse elements to the wisdom that is liberated on the first spiritual level.

original: / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
translated: The adverse elements to the negative reflex actions of these two are the propensities for these two.

original: de yod na mthong ba'i lam gyi sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa dang po'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de yod na mthong ba'i lam gyi sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa dang po'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Since the mind that is liberated on the path of vision does not arise if these two exist, therefore, these are the adverse elements to the mind that is liberated on the first spiritual level.

original: gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba las gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs log par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba las gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs log par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is the classification of the errors of the second ground, which are the opposites of the virtues of that ground. They are: the confusion of the errors of the minor infractions, and the confusion of the various aspects of karma.

original: sa dang po'i dus na ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma kun du rmongs pa dang / log pa'i rtsol ba'i dri ma kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i dus na ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma kun du rmongs pa dang / log pa'i rtsol ba'i dri ma kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: On the first ground, there are the confusion of the stain of bad character and the confusion of the stain of wrong effort.

original: ma rig pa de @261a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa de @261a * //
translated: When those two confusions exist, then the wisdom of the second ground is not born.

original: gnyis yod na sa dang po nas gnyis par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba drang po'i bsam pa thob pas na /
analyzed: gnyis yod na sa dang po nas gnyis par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba drang po'i bsam pa thob pas na /
translated: When one is in the state of rising from the first ground to the second, one obtains the pure intention called ‚Äústraightforwardness.‚Äù

original: dang po las 'phar zhing gnyis pa non par gyur pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gnyis pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: dang po las 'phar zhing gnyis pa non par gyur pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gnyis pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Because of that, the wisdom of the second ground, which is the rising from the first and the entering into the second, is not born. Therefore, that is the opposite of the wisdom of the second ground.

original: de ni gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: de ni gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
translated: The latent impressions of those two are the resistance to the purification of the abode.

original: de yod nas gnyis pa la rang bzhin rnam par dag pas gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //üîΩgsum pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yod nas gnyis pa la rang bzhin rnam par dag pas gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no // gsum pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since the mind that abides in the nature of purity does not arise in the second abode, therefore that is the resistance to the purification of the abode of the mind.

original: sa gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams brjod pas mun par byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa las kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams brjod pas mun par byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa las kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: In the third, the classification of darkness is the obscuration of desire realm attachment and the obscuration of the complete perfection of the retention of what is heard.

original: sa gnyis pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: At the time of the second abode, there is the obscuration of concentration and the obscuration of the retention of what is heard.

original: ma rig pa de gnyis yod nas gnyis pa nas gsum par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba dag pa'i sems bsam pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor zhes bya ba sbyor
analyzed: ma rig pa de gnyis yod nas gnyis pa nas gsum par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba dag pa'i sems bsam pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor zhes bya ba sbyor
translated: The cause of the mental state of freedom from attachment is the mental attention of the intention to attain freedom from attachment.üîΩThrough attaining the three types of freedom from attachment, one ascends from the second ground and reaches the third ground.

original: ba rnam pa gsum thob pas sa gnyis pa las 'phar zhing gsum pa la gnon par 'gyur ba'i shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gsum pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ba rnam pa gsum thob pas sa gnyis pa las 'phar zhing gsum pa la gnon par 'gyur ba'i shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gsum pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The wisdom that is liberated from the obscurations is not yet generated, and therefore it is the counteragent to the wisdom that is liberated from the obscurations on the third ground.

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe negative tendencies that are counteragents to those‚Äù refers to the propensities for those two types of ignorance.

original: de yod nas gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bus gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol bas mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gsum pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //üîΩbzhi pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yod nas gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bus gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol bas mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa gsum pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no // bzhi pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since one is free from attachment to the third stage, and since one abides in the result of freedom from attachment, the mind is liberated and is not born again. Therefore, it is the counteragent to the liberation of the mind on the third stage.üîΩOn the fourth stage, the counteragent to the subtle propensities of the notional attachment to the perishable mind and body as the self and of the self as possessed of attributes and of the notion that this is the self, is the path of relinquishment.

original: sa bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The classification of the subtle propensities of the notional attachment to the perishable mind and body as the self, etc. which are the counteragents to the fourth stage, is as follows:üîΩthe delusion of craving meditative concentration and the delusion of craving the dharmas.

original: sa gsum pa'i dus na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ting @261b nge 'dzin la srid pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzungs kyi chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i dus na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ting @261b nge 'dzin la srid pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzungs kyi chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: At the time of the third stage, there is the delusion of craving existence in meditative concentration, and the delusion of craving the dharmas of retention in the attainment of the result of freedom from attachment.

analyzed: lnga pa la ni zhes bya ba las lnga pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs theg pa chung ngus yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The fifth is the obscuration to the fifth, which is the differentiation of the Nirvana of the Sravakas.

original: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: It is the confusion of attention to the one-sidedness of Samsara and the one-sidedness of Nirvana.

original: sa bzhi pa'i dus na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la kun du rmongs pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu tha dad par lta ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa'i dus na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la kun du rmongs pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu tha dad par lta ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: At the time of the fourth stage, there is the confusion about the four noble truths and the confusion about the different causes of the purification of the powers, etc. of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: ma rig pa de gnyis yod na sa bzhi pa nas lnga par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs nas nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa las sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa bzhi pa las
analyzed: ma rig pa de gnyis yod na sa bzhi pa nas lnga par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs nas nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa las sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa bzhi pa las
translated: When those two ignorances exist, then the wisdom and liberation of the fourth ground that is called the ‚Äúspecial antidote to pride‚Äù is not generated, because the mental attitude of equality is attained on the fourth ground.

translated: When those exist, then the mental liberation that is the path of not abiding on the fifth ground and the mental liberation that is the result of establishing that path are not generated. Therefore, that is the counteragent to the mental liberation of the fifth ground.

analyzed: drug pa la ni zhes bya ba la sa drug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /

analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du bya ba nyid la kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: There is confusion about the direct realization of the engagement of the formative forces and confusion about the appearance of many signs.

original: sa lnga pa'i dus na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jug pa phra mo mngon sum du bya ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du bya ba la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i dus na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jug pa phra mo mngon sum du bya ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du bya ba la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: At the time of the fifth level, there is confusion about the direct realization of the subtle engagement of dependent origination and confusion about the manifestation of the perfection of wisdom called the inclination towards non-conceptual gnosis through the mode of illumination.

original: ma rig pa de gnyis yod nas lnga pa nas drug par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa lnga pa las 'phar zhing drug pa gnon par 'gyur ba'i shes
analyzed: ma rig pa de gnyis yod nas lnga pa nas drug par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba chos mnyam pa nyid thob pas sa lnga pa las 'phar zhing drug pa gnon par 'gyur ba'i shes
translated: When one has those two ignorances and is in the process of ascending from the fifth to the sixth ground, the wisdom and liberation of the sixth ground do not arise because one has not yet attained the equality of phenomena and one has not yet ascended from the fifth ground and overcome the sixth ground.

original: rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa drug pa'i shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /
translated: The negative reflex actions of those two are the propensities for those two.

original: de yod na sa drug pa la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa drug pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //

translated: When one has those propensities, the wisdom and liberation of the seventh ground do not arise because one has not yet attained the path of direct realization of the no self of dharmas and one has not yet ascended from the seventh ground and overcome the eighth ground.üîΩTherefore, those two are the counteragents to the wisdom and liberation of the seventh ground.

original: bdun pa la ni zhes bya ba las bdun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni zhes bya ba las bdun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: On the seventh, the differentiation of the appearance of subtle signs is the counteragent to the subtle signs that appear.

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig pu yid la byed pas thabs kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig pu yid la byed pas thabs kun du rmongs pa ste /

original: sa drug pa'i dus na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jug pa phra mo mngon du gyur pas mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon du gyur pas shes rab kyi shas che la thabs la kun du rmongs pa'o //

translated: And since the spiritual level of the One Who Appears as He Wishes, which is the perfection of wisdom, becomes evident in the manner of illumination, wisdom predominates, and there is the confusion about the means.

original: ma rig pa de gnyis yod na sa drug pa nas bdun par 'phar ba'i gnas skabs na mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan brtsams

translated: When those two ignorances exist, then the antidote called the ‚Äúpath of manifest realization through method and wisdom‚Äù is set forth as the antidote to delight in the absence of manifest effort at the time of ascending from the sixth to the seventh ground.

original: pa'i khyad par thob pas sa drug pa las 'phar zhing bdun pa gnon par @262b 'gyur ba'i shes rab rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa bdun pa'i shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //

translated: Because the wisdom of liberation that ascends from the sixth ground and conquers the seventh ground is not generated, therefore that is the counteragent to the wisdom of liberation of the seventh ground.

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bag chags te /

original: de yod na sa bdun pa la de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam rab tu thob pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / sa snga phyi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas gnas pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni sa bdun pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //

Therefore that is the counteragent to the liberated mind on the seventh level.

translated: On the eighth,
