original: mngon par 'grub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i sku bsod nams sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su bsdus pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i sku bsod nams sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su bsdus pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang /
translated: The result of the perfection of giving and so on is the attainment of the body of the thirty two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being of the Tathagata, which is fully included in the various immeasurable merits of giving and so on.üîΩThe result of the perfection of giving and so on is the attainment of the body of the thirty two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being of the Tathagata, which is fully included in the various immeasurable merits of giving and so on.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i tshe bdud dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis gnon par bya ba dang / tho 'tshams pa dang /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i tshe bdud dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis gnon par bya ba dang / tho 'tshams pa dang /
translated: The result of the perfection of giving and so on is the attainment of the body of the thirty two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being of the Tathagata, which is fully included in the various immeasurable merits of giving and so on.

original: bskyod par mi nus pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i mchog gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: bskyod par mi nus pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa kun du bsten pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i mchog gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa dang /
translated: The result of the perfection of generosity is the attainment of the result of being unable to regress from the path, the result of the perfection of ethics is the attainment of the result of irreversibility, the result of the perfection of patience is the attainment of the result of definite separation, the result of the perfection of effort is the attainment of the result of certain enjoyment, the result of the perfection of concentration is the attainment of the result of the unshakable ones and the result of the perfection of wisdom is the attainment of the result of the supreme quality of arhat.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi po sku dang dmigs pa dang thugs dang ye shes rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ste /üîΩde yang sa dang po la de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi po sku dang dmigs pa dang thugs dang ye shes rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ste /üîΩde yang sa dang po la de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che ba yin te /
translated: The result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of the tathagatas through completely relying on generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation.üîΩThe result of the perfection of generosity and so on that is the cause of definite separation is the attainment of the result of the supreme bliss of the qualities, liberation, concentration and meditative attainment of

original: lhag ma rnams ci nus kyi tshul du yang dag par mi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ci nus kyi tshul du yang dag par mi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The rest are not completely accomplished in any way. This is taught up to the Buddha ground, where it is extremely pure.

original: sangs rgyas mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @265b kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @265b kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of seeing and serving the buddhas is the purity of the offerings to the Three Jewels by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of offerings to the Tathagata:

original: sku la mchod pa dang / mchod rten la mchod pa dang / mngon sum du mchod pa dang / mngon sum ma yin par mchod pa dang / bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: sku la mchod pa dang / mchod rten la mchod pa dang / mngon sum du mchod pa dang / mngon sum ma yin par mchod pa dang / bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang /
translated: offering to the body, offering to stupas, offering to the manifest, offering to the unmanifest, offering made by oneself, offering made by having others do, offering of wealth, offering of practice, offering of the Dharma, and offering of the roots of virtue.

original: bkur sti'i mchod pa dang / rgya chen po'i mchod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mchod pa dang / sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti'i mchod pa dang / rgya chen po'i mchod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mchod pa dang / sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: worship of respect, worship of generosity, worship of non-affliction, and worship of practice.

original: de la sku la mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku nyid la mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sku la mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku nyid la mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Worship of the body is to worship the body of the Tathagata himself.

original: mchod rten la mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten nam gdung khang byur bu 'am gtsang khang ngam mchod rten rnying pa'am mchod rten sar pa la mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten la mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten nam gdung khang byur bu 'am gtsang khang ngam mchod rten rnying pa'am mchod rten sar pa la mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Worship of the stupa is to worship the stupa of the Tathagata, whether it be a stupa of relics, a stupa of memory, a stupa of symbols, an old stupa, or a new stupa.

original: mngon sum du mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'am mchod rten la mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'am mchod rten la mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Worship in the presence is to worship the body of the Tathagata or his stupa in his presence.

original: mngon sum ma yin par mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum mam mchod rten mngon sum du ma gyur pa la de'i phyir dmigs te mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin par mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum mam mchod rten mngon sum du ma gyur pa la de'i phyir dmigs te mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Worship in the absence is to worship the body of the Tathagata or his stupa in his absence, with the intention of being present.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa thun mong gi mchod pa yang yod de //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'am mchod rten gcig la mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa na lhag pa'i bsam pa 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa gcig dang mchod rten gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa thun mong gi mchod pa yang yod de // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'am mchod rten gcig la mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa na lhag pa'i bsam pa 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa gcig dang mchod rten gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: There is also a common offering of direct perception and non-perception.

original: dang / mchod rten thams cad kyi ched nyid yin pas bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dang mchod rten mngon du gyur pa 'di la mchod pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gzhan thams cad la yang mchod do snyam pa'i sems kyis mchod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: dang / mchod rten thams cad kyi ched nyid yin pas bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dang mchod rten mngon du gyur pa 'di la mchod pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gzhan thams cad la yang mchod do snyam pa'i sems kyis mchod pa byed pa ste /
translated: When one makes an offering directly to one statue or stupa of the Tathagata, with this superior intention, one thinks, The reality of this one Tathagata and one stupa is the very reality of all Tathagatas and stupas in the ten directions and three times. Therefore, by making offerings to this directly perceived Tathagata and stupa, I make offerings to all Tathagatas and stupas in the ten directions and three times.

original: de la mngon sum gyi mchod pa ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi mchod pa ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
translated: In this, the offering of direct perception has a vast result of merit.

original: mngon sum du ma yin pa'i mchod pa ni de bas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma yin pa'i mchod pa ni de bas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
translated: The worship that is not direct is of greater merit than that.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa thun mong gi mchod pa ni de bas kyang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che bar rig par bya'o //üîΩbdag gis byas pa'i @266a * //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa thun mong gi mchod pa ni de bas kyang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che bar rig par bya'o // bdag gis byas pa'i @266a * //
translated: The worship that is both direct and indirect should be understood as being of greater merit than that.

original: mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'am mchod rten la rang gi lag gis mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'am mchod rten la rang gi lag gis mchod pa byed de /
translated: Worship that one does oneself is when one worships the Tathagata or his monuments with one's own hand.

original: le lo dang snyom las dang bag med pa la brten te gzhan byed du mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: le lo dang snyom las dang bag med pa la brten te gzhan byed du mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: One does not have others do it out of laziness, idleness, or lack of mindfulness.

original: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad chud shas bdog pa snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba bsod nams chung zhing mi nus pa gzhan dag la bstan te mchod pa byed du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad chud shas bdog pa snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba bsod nams chung zhing mi nus pa gzhan dag la bstan te mchod pa byed du bcug pa'o //
translated: Worship that one has others do is when one has others do it out of compassion for the poor and the weak who are unable to do it themselves.

original: bdag gis byas ba dang gzhan byed du bcug pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bdag gis byas ba dang gzhan byed du bcug pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a common worship that one does oneself and has others do.

original: bdag nyid kyang byed la gzhan dag kyang byed du 'jug pa ste /üîΩde la bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byed la gzhan dag kyang byed du 'jug pa ste / de la bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa ni /
translated: One does it oneself and one causes others to do it.

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //üîΩgzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa ni de bas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no // gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa ni de bas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
translated: The worship that one does oneself has a vast result of merit.üîΩThe worship that one causes others to do has a still vaster result of merit.

original: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa ni de bas kyang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che bar rig par bya'o //üîΩrnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa ni de bas kyang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rgya che bar rig par bya'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: The worship that one does oneself and causes others to do has a still vaster result of merit.

original: mchod rten lan bza' dang zhal zas dang gzims cha dang bsnyun gyi gsos sman yo byad dang / gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / mchod pa'i las dang / bstod pa dang /
analyzed: mchod rten lan bza' dang zhal zas dang gzims cha dang bsnyun gyi gsos sman yo byad dang / gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / mchod pa'i las dang / bstod pa dang /
translated: The worship of gain and honor is the worship of the Tathagata or his stupa with food and drink, clothes, vehicles, garlands, incense, oil for the lamps, bedding, medicine, and other necessities, with polite services, prostrations, rising in his presence, joining the palms in reverence, worship, and praise.

original: rin po che dang / yo byad la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che dang / yo byad la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: One makes offerings with precious things, articles, and so on.

original: rgya che ba'i mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa ni dngos po bdun rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i mchod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa ni dngos po bdun rgya che ba yin te /
translated: Extensive offerings are offerings to the Tathagata or his stupa with the seven jewels.

original: yun ring por mchod pas dus rgya che ba dang / dngos po mang pos mchod pas dngos po mang po rgya che ba dang / dngos po gya nom pas mchod pas dngos po gya nom pa rgya che ba dang / mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par mchod pas gnas kyi khyad par rgya che ba dang /
analyzed: yun ring por mchod pas dus rgya che ba dang / dngos po mang pos mchod pas dngos po mang po rgya che ba dang / dngos po gya nom pas mchod pas dngos po gya nom pa rgya che ba dang / mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par mchod pas gnas kyi khyad par rgya che ba dang /
translated: They are extensive because of the duration of time, since one makes offerings for a long time; because of the abundance of things, since one makes offerings with many things; because of the excellence of things, since one makes offerings with excellent things; because of the excellence of the place, since one makes offerings in a place that is either in the presence of the Tathagata or in his absence;

original: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du gzhug pas mchod pa byed pa'i gang zag gi khyad par rgya che ba dang / snying thag pa nas dga' ba mngon du gyur cing mos pa drag pos mchod pas bsam pa rgya che ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing mchod pas 'bras bu bsngo ba rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du gzhug pas mchod pa byed pa'i gang zag gi khyad par rgya che ba dang / snying thag pa nas dga' ba mngon du gyur cing mos pa drag pos mchod pas bsam pa rgya che ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing mchod pas 'bras bu bsngo ba rgya che ba'o //
translated: The offering is dedicated to the unsurpassed enlightenment of all beings, so the result is of great importance.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i @266b mchod pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa rnam pa drug spangs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i @266b mchod pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa rnam pa drug spangs pa ste /
translated: Uncontaminated offering is the avoidance of the six kinds of contaminated offering.üîΩThe offering is made with one's own hands, so there is no contamination of laziness in having others do it.üîΩThe offering is made respectfully, so there is no contamination of disrespect.

original: rang gi lag gis byed pas le los gzhan byed du 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / gus pas byed pas ma gus pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems mi g-yeng bas byed pas sems g-yeng ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi lag gis byed pas le los gzhan byed du 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / gus pas byed pas ma gus pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems mi g-yeng bas byed pas sems g-yeng ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: The offering is made with an undistracted mind, so there is no contamination of distraction.

original: bsam pa dag pas byed pas bsam pa ma dag pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / tshul 'tshos pa med pas byed pas tshul 'chos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i dngos po ba blas byugs pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pas byed pas bsam pa ma dag pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / tshul 'tshos pa med pas byed pas tshul 'chos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i dngos po ba blas byugs pa dang /
translated: It is free from the defilement of incompatibility, since it is performed with compatible things,

original: mar khus bkru ba dang / gu gul gyis bdug pa dang / aarga'i me tog gis gtor ba la sogs pa spangs te /üîΩmthun pa'i dngos pos byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mar khus bkru ba dang / gu gul gyis bdug pa dang / aarga'i me tog gis gtor ba la sogs pa spangs te / mthun pa'i dngos pos byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: such as anointing with the ashes of burnt cow dung, washing with milk, fumigating with gugul, scattering argha flowers, and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni nyan thos dang thun mong tshad med pa'i rgyu bsgom pa dang / 'du shes bsgom pa dang / rjes su dran pa bsgom pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa de kho na'i don bsgom pa dang / bslab pa gsum bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni nyan thos dang thun mong tshad med pa'i rgyu bsgom pa dang / 'du shes bsgom pa dang / rjes su dran pa bsgom pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa de kho na'i don bsgom pa dang / bslab pa gsum bsgom pa dang /
translated: The worship of accomplishment is the cultivation of the cause of the immeasurables common to the sravakas, the cultivation of perception, the cultivation of recollection, the cultivation of the meaning of thatness not common to the sravakas, and the cultivation of the three trainings.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la sogs pa cung zad cung zad dang / yud tsam du tha na ba 'jos tsam gyi bar du yang bsam pa dang / sbyor ba sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la sogs pa cung zad cung zad dang / yud tsam du tha na ba 'jos tsam gyi bar du yang bsam pa dang / sbyor ba sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: They are the thought and the practice of cultivating the elements leading to enlightenment and so on, even for a little while, even for a mere instant, even for a mere finger snap.

original: de mchod pa'i mchog dam pa gya nom pa gong na med pa yin te /üîΩsnga ma'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa rnam pa thams cad kyis brgya'i cha dang stong gi cha nas rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de mchod pa'i mchog dam pa gya nom pa gong na med pa yin te / snga ma'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa rnam pa thams cad kyis brgya'i cha dang stong gi cha nas rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro ba yin no //
translated: It is the supreme, the most sublime, the unexcelled worship of the Tathagata,üîΩand it is the supreme, the most sublime, the unexcelled worship of the Dharma and the Sangha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: The worship of the Tathagata by means of the worship of the Dharma and the Sangha is the supreme worship of the Tathagata.üîΩThe worship of the Dharma and the Sangha by means of the worship of the Tathagata is the supreme worship of the Dharma and the Sangha.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pa drug gis byed de yon tan gyi zhing bla na med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa bla na med pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pa drug gis byed de yon tan gyi zhing bla na med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa bla na med pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas who make these ten kinds of offerings to the Three Jewels do so with six kinds of superior intention: the superior intention of being a field of good qualities, the superior intention of being a field of benefit,

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du shin tu dkon pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gcig pu ste /üîΩ'ba' zhig lhag pa'i bsam @267a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du shin tu dkon pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gcig pu ste / 'ba' zhig lhag pa'i bsam @267a * //
translated: the superior intention of being the best of all sentient beings, the superior intention of being as rare as a fig tree flower, the superior intention of being the only one in the great trichiliocosm,

original: pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i don thams cad ston pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas byed pas na rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i don thams cad ston pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas byed pas na rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: the superior intention of being the only one in the great trichiliocosm, and the superior intention of showing all that is perfect, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de yangs dang por skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas brgya mthong zhing mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur dpag tu med pa byed do zhes bstan pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yangs dang por skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas brgya mthong zhing mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur dpag tu med pa byed do zhes bstan pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The same is true of the other perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe purity of the accomplishment of the aims of all beings is the accomplishment of the aims of all beings by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas in six ways:üîΩby the gift of material goods, by the gift of fearlessness, by the gift of Dharma, by the demonstration of good examples, by the demonstration of the path, and by the demonstration of the result.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The purity of the accomplishment of the aims of all beings is the accomplishment of the aims of all beings by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas in six ways:

original: yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: by the gift of material goods, by the gift of fearlessness, by the gift of Dharma, by the demonstration of good examples, by the demonstration of the path, and by the demonstration of the result.

original: de la yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la kun du bsten pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'i mthar thug pa na de'i mod la rnam par dag pa mngon sum du
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la kun du bsten pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'i mthar thug pa na de'i mod la rnam par dag pa mngon sum du
translated: The essence of complete maturation is the final stage of correct practice, which is the cause of the complete maturation of the seeds of virtuous natures and the cause of the complete maturation of virtuous natures through reliance on virtuous natures.

original: bya'i skal pa dang ldan zhing mthu yod pa'o //
analyzed: bya'i skal pa dang ldan zhing mthu yod pa'o //
translated: It is the possession of good fortune and power, which is the direct realization of purification.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of persons to be completely matured:

original: nyan thos kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: those who are to be completely matured by the Disciple Vehicle, who are of the family that has been established as the family of disciples; those who are to be completely matured by the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, who are of the family that has been established as the family of the Solitary Buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can theg pa chen pos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / theg pa gsum gyi rigs yang dag par ma sgrubs pa bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can theg pa chen pos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / theg pa gsum gyi rigs yang dag par ma sgrubs pa bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: The family that has not been properly established in the lineage of the three vehicles is to be brought to full maturity in order to go to good rebirths.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The analysis of full maturity is sixfold:

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: full maturity of the faculties, full maturity of the wholesome roots, full maturity of knowledge, and full maturity that is small, middling, and great.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
translated: The means of full maturity is seventeenfold:

original: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa @267b dang ; dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / dang po 'jug pa dang / dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang /
analyzed: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa @267b dang ; dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / dang po 'jug pa dang / dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang /
translated: nourishing the elements, establishing the present conditions, engagement, holding the delight, initial engagement, non-initial engagement, distant purification,

original: rnam par dag pa thag nya ba dang / sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / zang zing gi nye bar sgrub pa dang / chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa dang / chos ston pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa dang /üîΩrnam par phye ste chos brjod pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu dang / sbyor ba 'bring dang / sbyor ba chen po dang / thos pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / sdud pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang / bdag gis byed pa dang /üîΩgzhan la rtsol ba dang / gnyi gas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thag nya ba dang / sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / zang zing gi nye bar sgrub pa dang / chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa dang / chos ston pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa dang / rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu dang / sbyor ba 'bring dang / sbyor ba chen po dang / thos pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / sdud pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang / bdag gis byed pa dang / gzhan la rtsol ba dang / gnyi gas sbyor ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of the Dharma, of meaning, of language and of inspired speech.üîΩThe four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of the Dharma, of meaning, of language and of inspired speech.

original: yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag ni sa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag ni sa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i dus byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i dus byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is a beginner is one who has newly generated the thought of enlightenment. The bodhisattva who is a practitioner is one who has entered the stages.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is a non-practitioner is one who has not entered the stages. The bodhisattva who is a master is one who has entered the eighth stage.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is a non-master is one who has not entered the eighth stage. The bodhisattva who is a solitary one is one who has entered the stage of the solitary.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is a non-solitary one is one who has not entered the stage of the solitary. The bodhisattva who is a leader is one who has entered the stage of the certain.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is a non-leader is one who has not entered the stage of the certain. The bodhisattva who is a follower is one who has entered the stage of the certain.

original: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par gyur pa dang / nges par spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par gyur pa dang / nges par spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par gyur pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is a non-follower is one who has not entered the stage of the certain. The bodhisattva who is a perfected being is one who has entered the stage of the perfected.

original: yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid ni theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid ni theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristics of the person who is fully matured are the characteristics of the lesser, middling, and greater maturity of persons who are being matured by means of the three vehicles.

original: de la nyan thos ni sngon dge ba la goms pas gang gi tshe yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la nyan thos ni sngon dge ba la goms pas gang gi tshe yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te /
translated: The sravaka, because of his previous habituation to virtue, when he is in the stage of small maturity, has small aspiration and small application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi 'thob cing tshe de nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi thob bo //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi 'thob cing tshe de nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi thob bo //
translated: He goes to the miserable destinies and does not obtain the fruit of the sramana in that very life, nor does he obtain nirvana in that very life.

original: gang gi tshe yongs su smin pa 'bring la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa 'bring dang / sbyor ba 'bring yin te /üîΩngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni 'thob kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi thob po //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yongs su smin pa 'bring la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa 'bring dang / sbyor ba 'bring yin te / ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni 'thob kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi thob po //
translated: When he is in the stage of medium maturity, he has medium aspiration and medium application.

original: gang @268a * //
analyzed: gang @268a * //
translated: He does not go to the miserable destinies, but he does not obtain the fruit of the sramana in that very life, nor does he obtain nirvana in that very life.

original: gi tshe yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa che ba dang / sbyor ba che ba yin te /
analyzed: gi tshe yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni 'dun pa che ba dang / sbyor ba che ba yin te /
translated: When he is in the stage of great maturity, he has great aspiration and great application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe 'di nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang thob mya ngan las 'das pa yang thob po //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe 'di nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang thob mya ngan las 'das pa yang thob po //
translated: He does not go to the unfortunate planes of existence, and in this very life he attains the fruit of the practitioner and attains nirvana.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyan thos dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyan thos dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of maturity in the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas should be understood as similar to that of the Disciples.

original: theg pa chen pos yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa'i chung ngu yin te //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa'i chung ngu yin te //
translated: The characteristic of maturity in the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas is as follows: The one who is in the stage of action in faith is of small maturity.

original: 'dun pa chung ba dang sbyor ba chung bas ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa'i dang por gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa chung ba dang sbyor ba chung bas ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa'i dang por gtogs pa yin te /
translated: He goes to the unfortunate planes of existence, and he is included among those who have begun the first incalculable aeon,

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: because he is not endowed with all the virtues, the elements leading to enlightenment, the purification, the immovability, and the complete purification.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa 'bring yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa 'bring yin te /
translated: The one who is in the stage of pure universal responsibility is of middling maturity.

original: 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin pas ngan song rnams su mi 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa'i gnyis par gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin pas ngan song rnams su mi 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa'i gnyis par gtogs pa yin te /
translated: Since their interest and practice are middling, they do not go to the lower realms and they belong to the second incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang ni mi ldan la shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ni mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang ni mi ldan la shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ni mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: They do not possess the virtues of the factors conducive to enlightenment that are purified and unshakable and they do not possess complete purity.

original: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur pa ni yongs su smin pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur pa ni yongs su smin pa chen po yin te /
translated: The great level of complete ripening is definite and final.

original: 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che bas ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che bas ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs pa yin te /
translated: Since their interest and practice are great, they do not go to the lower realms and they belong to the third incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They possess all the virtues of the factors conducive to enlightenment that are purified and unshakable and they possess complete purity.

original: de la sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags shing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang phan yon che ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags shing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang phan yon che ba'o //
translated: The term purified means that they are naturally firm, clear, of great fruit, and of great benefit, since they are cultivated by analysis.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang yongs su mi nyams ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang yongs su mi nyams ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The term immovable means that the roots of virtue are not turned back from, not lost, and are advanced, in whatever way they have been obtained and accumulated.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gong na med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gong na med pa'o //
translated: The term extremely pure means that they are purer than those on the other stages, and are unsurpassed.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de yang sa dang po la skad cig gcig la sems can brgya @268b yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de yang sa dang po la skad cig gcig la sems can brgya @268b yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The term maturing sentient beings means that they are extremely pure, more and more so, from the first stage up to the Buddha stage, as shown by the statement that on the first stage one matures a hundred sentient beings.

original: skye ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skye ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The purity of birth refers to the four kinds of birth of bodhisattvas.

original: las kyi dbang gis skye ba dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis skye ba dang / 'byor pa'i dbang gis skye ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis skye ba dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis skye ba dang / 'byor pa'i dbang gis skye ba'o //
translated: They are birth by the power of karma, by the power of prayer, by the power of concentration, and by the power of mastery.

original: de la las kyi dbang gis skye ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams las kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la las kyi dbang gis skye ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams las kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
translated: Birth by the power of karma is the birth of those on the stage of action in faith in the desire realm by the power of karma.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba ni sar chud pa rnams smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas ngan par skye ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba ni sar chud pa rnams smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas ngan par skye ba'o //
translated: Birth by the power of prayer is the birth of those who have entered the stages in the lower realms such as the animal realm by the power of prayer in order to develop living beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis yongs su skye ba ni bsam gtan thob pa rnams bsam gtan rnam par bzlog nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis yongs su skye ba ni bsam gtan thob pa rnams bsam gtan rnam par bzlog nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
translated: Birth by the power of concentration is the birth in the desire realm of those who have attained the dhyanas by turning away from the dhyanas.

original: 'byor ba'i dbang gis skye ba ni sprul pa rnams kyis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye ba'o //üîΩlhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa yan chad skye ba de dag gang gis skye yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'byor ba'i dbang gis skye ba ni sprul pa rnams kyis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye ba'o // lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa yan chad skye ba de dag gang gis skye yang rung ste /
translated: Birth through mastery is the birth of emanations in the abode of Tushita and so on.üîΩBirth of the bodhisattvas is always for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In brief, it is fivefold:

original: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / de dang skal pa mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa'i skye ba dang / chen por skye ba dang / bdag por skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / de dang skal pa mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa'i skye ba dang / chen por skye ba dang / bdag por skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba'o //
translated: birth for the sake of eliminating harm, birth through the power of prayer, birth through mastery, birth for the sake of demonstrating reality and birth for the sake of perfecting the transcendences.üîΩBirth for the sake of eliminating harm is the birth of bodhisattvas in situations of great calamity, such as an epidemic, in order to eliminate the calamity.

original: de la gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni mu ge las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang /
analyzed: de la gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni mu ge las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang /
translated: Birth that completely pacifies harm is birth that completely pacifies harm caused by famine, birth that completely pacifies harm caused by imbalance of the elements,

original: gzhan gyis sprul pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / log par lta bas bsgrubs pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi par byed pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sprul pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba dang / log par lta bas bsgrubs pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi par byed pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: birth that completely pacifies harm caused by the emanations of others and birth that completely pacifies harm caused by the practice of wrong views.

original: de la mu ge las gyur ba'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten du mu ges phongs shing gnod pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus dag tu smon lam btab nas sems can rnams tshegs chung dus 'tsho barüîΩ'gyur ba'i rgyur bdag @269a * //
analyzed: de la mu ge las gyur ba'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten du mu ges phongs shing gnod pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus dag tu smon lam btab nas sems can rnams tshegs chung dus 'tsho barüîΩ'gyur ba'i rgyur bdag @269a * //
translated: Birth that completely pacifies harm caused by famine is when a bodhisattva, in times of famine and great harm in the world, makes aspirations and is born in order to provide beings with a means of living with little difficulty.

translated: He takes birth as a great fish and so on, and

analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa ni 'jig rten du sems can rnams la khams ma snyoms pa'i nad mang po byung ba'i dus dag tu nad de dag rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i smon lam btab nas bdag nyid
translated: The birth that completely pacifies harm caused by imbalance of the elements is when, in the world, many beings are afflicted by diseases caused by imbalance of the elements, at that time, having made prayers to completely pacify those diseases,

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang grub pa'i sman pa chen po'i lus yongs su 'dzin cing sems can rnams kyi nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //

original: gzhan gyis sprul pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni pha rol gyi dmag tshogs las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i sems
analyzed: gzhan gyis sprul pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba ni pha rol gyi dmag tshogs las gyur pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i sems
translated: The birth that completely pacifies harm caused by the emanations of others is the birth that completely pacifies harm caused by the armies of others. analyzed: de yang dgos pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa yin te /

analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas dang / mdzad pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is a perfect buddha for oneself and one benefits others through deeds.

translated: The bodhisattvas are born in the past, future, and present in births that are virtuous, good, and auspicious, and they will be born in all of them, in whatever births they may be. original: skye ba rnam par dag pa de yang sa dang po nas sangs rgyas kyi sa de ma gtogs pa bcu pa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //

translated: The power of superknowledge, the power of Dharma, the power of co-emergence, the power of commonality, and the power of uncommonality.
