analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'ur bstan pa yin no //
translated: Their divisions were previously taught in the chapter on noble Maitreya.

original: de yang sa dang po nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sa dang po nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gong nas gong du ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, from the first ground up to the Buddha ground, they are increasingly more pure.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba rnam par dag pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas su grub nas skye ba len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba rnam par dag pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas su grub nas skye ba len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the Buddha ground, except for the purity of birth... means that once one has attained Buddhahood, there is no more taking birth.

original: de'i yon tan dang yang mnyam la zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams kyi yon tan yang de na yod pas de dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yon tan dang yang mnyam la zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams kyi yon tan yang de na yod pas de dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: ...one is equal to the qualities of that... means that since the qualities of the lower grounds are also present there, one is equal to them.

original: gnyen po'i rab @270b tu dbye ba'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnyen po'i rab @270b tu dbye ba'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The divisions of the antidotes, the meaning of the words, and so on, have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the term and so on should be explained for the skill in the means of ripening one's own and others' mental continua.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par grub pas so sor brtags te skye ba len pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pas bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par grub pas so sor brtags te skye ba len pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pas bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: Skill in the means of ripening one's own and others' mental continua refers to the bodhisattva's taking birth in a state of purity through the power of his roots of virtue and his being endowed with compassion for the sake of protecting all beings, and thus being free from the afflictions.

original: nyid dang gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi srid par skye ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: nyid dang gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi srid par skye ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: The taking of birth in existence in order to turn away the afflictions of oneself and others is the means of ripening one's own and others' mental continua.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of skill in that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,üîΩhe says:

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du srid par skye ba thams cad kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rab mchog ces bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du srid par skye ba thams cad kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rab mchog ces bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus te /
translated: Why is it that, among all the births in existence, the birth of a bodhisattva is said to be the best?

original: srid par skye ba mngal du 'jug na yang so so'i skye bo phal pa ni mi shes par 'jug cing gnas te /
analyzed: srid par skye ba mngal du 'jug na yang so so'i skye bo phal pa ni mi shes par 'jug cing gnas te /
translated: When entering the womb to take birth in existence, ordinary people enter and stay there without knowing what is happening.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba ni shes bzhin du 'jug pa la mi shes par gnas shing 'byung /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba ni shes bzhin du 'jug pa la mi shes par gnas shing 'byung /
translated: A universal monarch enters with knowledge but stays and leaves without knowledge.üîΩA disciple or a solitary sage enters and stays with knowledge but leaves without knowledge.üîΩBut a bodhisattva enters with knowledge, stays with knowledge, and leaves with knowledge.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas par mi shes par 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' ni shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas te 'byung ba dang / skye gnas dang / khams dang / 'gro ba gang du skyes kyang byang chub sems dpa'i chen por skye ba rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshe dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas par mi shes par 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' ni shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas te 'byung ba dang / skye gnas dang / khams dang / 'gro ba gang du skyes kyang byang chub sems dpa'i chen por skye ba rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshe dang /
translated: And wherever a bodhisattva is born, in whatever womb, in whatever realm, in whatever kind of existence, he is born as a great bodhisattva, naturally superior to the whole world in his life span,

original: kha dog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa des kyang 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kha dog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa des kyang 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: mastery, and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa des kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa de ci'i phyir zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa des kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa de ci'i phyir zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: And by that maturation, he ripens the continuums of himself and others.

original: rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: For four reasons.üîΩThe first two of the four causes that will be explained below are causes, and the latter two are results, because it is possible to connect them as cause and result.

original: rgyu rnam pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dang po gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'og ma gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par srid pas skye ba len pas na byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnasüîΩyin pa'i phyir srid par @271a * //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dang po gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'og ma gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par srid pas skye ba len pas na byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir srid par @271a * //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva's birth is the basis for ripening the continuums of himself and others.

original: skye ba thams cad kyi nang na rab mchog ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad kyi nang na rab mchog ces bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that among all births in existence, it is the best.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas so sor brtags te legs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas so sor brtags te legs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of this is stated below: ‚Äúbecause of the excellence of each investigation.‚Äù

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad do //
translated: Therein, the roots of virtue are all the roots of virtue such as generosity, etc., which are conducive to enlightenment.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa dang / phul du byung ba dang / rnam par dag pas shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa dang / phul du byung ba dang / rnam par dag pas shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are said to be extremely pure because of the purity of practice, excellence, and purification.

original: de la kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
analyzed: de la kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
translated: Therein, the purity of practice is due to three causes:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
translated: by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: phul du byung ba la ni rgyu gnyis te /
analyzed: phul du byung ba la ni rgyu gnyis te /
translated: Excellence is due to two causes:

original: rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgya che ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas so //
translated: because of its vastness and because it is not defiled.

original: de la rgya che ba ni sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgya che ba ni sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pa ste /
translated: The immensity of the bodhisattvas is shown to be threefold: in terms of sentient beings, in terms of things, and in terms of time.

original: sems can la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten te brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa byed kyi bdag 'ba' zhig kho na'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten te brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa byed kyi bdag 'ba' zhig kho na'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
translated: In terms of sentient beings, the bodhisattvas practice those roots of virtue such as generosity, etc., in dependence on all sentient beings, and they do so for the sake of all sentient beings, not just for their own sake.

original: dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: In terms of things, they practice those roots of virtue such as generosity, etc., in every way and in all their aspects.

original: dus la dbye ba med pa ni tshe 'di la mtshan mo dang nyin mo rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing /
analyzed: dus la dbye ba med pa ni tshe 'di la mtshan mo dang nyin mo rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing /
translated: In terms of time, they do not give up their practice of generosity, etc., day or night in this life, and they do not give it up in future lives.

original: brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe rabs thams cad du yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe rabs thams cad du yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: and not abandoning effort, and by that very cause, in all lives, he practices those roots of virtue.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang mi brten pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang mi brten pa ste /
translated: The highest joy is not afflicted, the absence of opposition, and the absence of reliance.

original: mchog tu dga' ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rten par byed cing gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rten par byed cing gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed pa'o //
translated: The highest joy is that the bodhisattva, with a joyful mind, without suffering, and without mental dissatisfaction, relies on those roots of virtue, and on that basis, does not regret it.

original: mi mthun pa med pa'i gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa'i gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The absence of opposition is that he practices those roots of virtue without harming others and without attachment to views.

original: gus pas ni gus pa dang snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan dang snying por lta la shin tu @271b nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang gzhan gyis mi bkri bar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o //üîΩmi brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam /üîΩbrgya byin nyid dam /
analyzed: gus pas ni gus pa dang snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan dang snying por lta la shin tu @271b nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang gzhan gyis mi bkri bar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par blangs te kun du spyod pa'o // mi brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam / brgya byin nyid dam /
translated: With respect means with devotion, and with the core of one's heart, to regard those very wholesome roots as virtues and as the essence, and to take them up and practice them with great certainty, without being led by others and without being led astray by others.

original: bdud nyid dam /
analyzed: bdud nyid dam /
translated: Those wholesome roots are unattached in that one does not hope for the evolutionary development of those wholesome roots as a universal monarch, or as ≈öakra, or as a MƒÅra, or as a BrahmƒÅ.üîΩOne does not expect anything in return from others.

original: tshangs pa nyid du re ba med pa dang / gzhan las len du phan 'dogs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la brten pa med pa'o //üîΩde la rnam par dag pa ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid du re ba med pa dang / gzhan las len du phan 'dogs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la brten pa med pa'o // de la rnam par dag pa ni rgyu gsum gyis te /
translated: One does not depend on gain, honor, or fame.

original: sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Purity is threefold: through purification, through stability, and through complete purity.

original: de la sbyangs pa dang mi g-yo ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa dang mi g-yo ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The roots of virtue of one who has entered the stage of pure superior intention are purified and unshakable.

original: sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags shing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags shing byed pa rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang / gsal ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba'o //
translated: Purification means that one is naturally stable, clear, of great fruit, and of great benefit.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Unwavering means that one does not turn back from the roots of virtue as they have been obtained and as they have been accumulated, one does not fall away from them, and one proceeds ever higher.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni nges pa'i dang mthar thug par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni nges pa'i dang mthar thug par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Very pure means the roots of virtue of one who has attained certainty and the ultimate.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gong na med pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las ches yongs su dag pa gong na med pa'o /
translated: On the bodhisattva stages, they are purer than that, and there is nothing higher.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyu gsum gyis kun du spyod pa dang / rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung ba dang / rgyu gsum gyis rnam par dag pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyu gsum gyis kun du spyod pa dang / rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung ba dang / rgyu gsum gyis rnam par dag pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the roots of virtue that are thoroughly practiced through three causes, that are preeminent through two causes, and that are purified through three causes are called ‚Äúextremely pure.‚Äù

original: yang dag par grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa de yang dag par 'grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi rigs pa dang / dang po sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i rim gyis yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: yang dag par grub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa de yang dag par 'grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi rigs pa dang / dang po sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i rim gyis yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: Because they are perfectly accomplished means that the accomplishment of those extremely pure roots of virtue is accomplished through the stage of the bodhisattva‚Äôs own lineage, the generation of the initial thought of enlightenment, and the application to the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ni rang gi rigs la brten cing gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can du 'byung zhing mthu yod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ni rang gi rigs la brten cing gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can du 'byung zhing mthu yod par 'gyur bas /
translated: Just as the bodhisattva, relying on and abiding in his own lineage, has the fortune and power to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: rang gi rigs ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yin la /üîΩdang po sems bskyed pa la brten cing gnas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @272a * //
analyzed: rang gi rigs ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yin la / dang po sems bskyed pa la brten cing gnas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @272a * //
translated: One‚Äôs own family is the basis of good fortune.

original: thams cad la sbyor bar byed pas dang po sems bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yin /
analyzed: thams cad la sbyor bar byed pas dang po sems bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yin /
translated: The first generation of bodhicitta is the basis for engaging in the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct, because once one relies on and abides in the first generation of bodhicitta, one will engage in generosity and so forth, in the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and in all the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba de nyid la brten cing gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba ni byang chub chen po yongsüîΩsu rdzogs pa'i gzhi yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba de nyid la brten cing gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba ni byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzhi yin pas /
translated: The engagement in the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct is the basis for perfecting great enlightenment, because once one relies on and abides in that very engagement in the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct, one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: gzhi de gsum gyi rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa de yang dag par 'grub la /
analyzed: gzhi de gsum gyi rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa de yang dag par 'grub la /
translated: Thus, through the sequence of these three bases, one will perfectly accomplish those roots of virtue that are utterly pure.

original: de yang dag par 'grub pas so sor brtags te skye ba len par byed do ;
analyzed: de yang dag par 'grub pas so sor brtags te skye ba len par byed do ;
translated: He takes birth by discriminating, because he is perfectly accomplished.

original: / so sor brtags te len pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par grub pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: / so sor brtags te len pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par grub pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Because he takes birth by discriminating is the result of that perfectly accomplished, very pure root of merit.

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rnam par dag pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rnam par dag pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin par sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with the previously explained pure births of the bodhisattva.

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Because he possesses compassion for the protection of all beings is the cause of the later statement: ‚ÄúBecause he is himself unafflicted and because he turns others away from affliction.‚Äù

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje rnam par dag pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje rnam par dag pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin par sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with the previously explained pure compassion of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Because he is himself uncontaminated and he turns others away from contamination. This is the result of his compassion, which is to protect all migrating beings.

original: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is himself uncontaminated refers to the bodhisattva's possession of six kinds of skill in means, beginning with the maturation of the inner qualities of a buddha.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par lta ba dang / 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par lta ba dang / 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva's view is endowed with compassion for all beings, he knows all the formative forces just as they are, he desires the gnosis of unexcelled perfect enlightenment, he is not discouraged by the sufferings of birth and so on, he is not attracted to the happiness of the tranquil liberations, and he is not attached to the taste of meditative concentration.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par blta ba la brten nas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba @272b bzhin du yongs su shes pa la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba nas 'khor ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par blta ba la brten nas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba @272b bzhin du yongs su shes pa la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba nas 'khor ba dang /
translated: It is the non-abandonment of samsara on the basis of the view that all sentient beings are endowed with the essence of the tathiigatagarbha, and the non-abandonment of samsara on the basis of viewing all sentient beings with compassion.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa la brten nas brtson 'grus 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa la brten nas brtson 'grus 'bar ba'o //
translated: It is the burning of the fire of diligence on the basis of the desire for the wisdom of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reversal of the afflictions of others is the bodhisattva's skill in means, which is endowed with six aspects, beginning with the maturation of other sentient beings.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu rnams 'bras bu tshad med par sgrub par byed pa dang / tshogs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa yang dag par skyed cing nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu rnams 'bras bu tshad med par sgrub par byed pa dang / tshogs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa yang dag par skyed cing nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva causes the roots of virtue of sentient beings to be accomplished with immeasurable results from small beginnings, and with small collections he generates and accomplishes vast and immeasurable roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba sel bar byed pa dang / tha mal pa rnams 'dzud par byed pa dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba sel bar byed pa dang / tha mal pa rnams 'dzud par byed pa dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: He removes the hostility of those who are hostile to the Buddha‚Äôs teaching, he introduces those who are neutral, he brings to maturity those who have been introduced, and he liberates those who have matured.

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa de dag gis bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba ni rab mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa de dag gis bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba ni rab mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of those skillful means, the bodhisattva‚Äôs birth is said to be supreme, since he himself is not defiled and he turns others away from defilement.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the skill in means for perfecting one's own and others' continuums has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the skill in means for perfecting the resolve should be explained.

original: bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i tshig gi don la smon lam mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs yin pas de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i tshig gi don la smon lam mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs yin pas de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: The skill in means for perfecting the resolve is the means for perfecting the resolve to complete the Buddha qualities and to ripen beings by the Bodhisattva's accomplishment of the aspirational prayers for the meaning of the true words. The meaning of the skill in that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags zhes bya ba zhus te /üîΩbyang @273a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags zhes bya ba zhus te / byang @273a * //
translated: The Blessed One, why is it that the bodhisattvas go with vast aspirations, with excellent aspirations, with the power of aspiration?

original: chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas' true aspirations are, in brief, of five kinds:

original: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po'o //
translated: the aspiration to generate the mind , the aspiration to be born , the aspiration to the sphere of activity , the true aspiration, and the great aspiration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i smon lam de lta bu mngon par bsgrub cing bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i de'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i smon lam de lta bu mngon par bsgrub cing bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i de'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' true aspirations are accomplished in this way. What is the cause of fulfilling their intention?

original: de la smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam gyis 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam gyis 'gro ba ste /
translated: Here, going with vast aspirations refers to going with the aspiration to generate the mind and the aspiration to be born.

original: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par sgrub pa'i gong du dang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par sgrub pa'i gong du dang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The vow of generating the Thought is the first generation of the Thought of supreme enlightenment, in order to accomplish the Bodhisattva lineage.

original: skye ba'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la sems can gyi don dang mthun pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skye ba'i smon lam pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la sems can gyi don dang mthun pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skye ba'i smon lam pa'o //
translated: The vow of birth is the vow to be born in the future in the destinies suitable for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sems bskyed pa'i smon lam gyis ni dang po sems bskyed pa yan chad nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas thams cad du 'gro la skye
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa'i smon lam gyis ni dang po sems bskyed pa yan chad nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas thams cad du 'gro la skye
translated: The vow of generating the Thought leads to all the stages of one's own perfection, from the first generation of the Thought up to the supreme enlightenment.üîΩThe vow of birth leads to all the stages of the perfection of others' aims.

original: ba'i smon lam gyi sna de'i bar du gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i smon lam gyi sna de'i bar du gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of the two vows, one goes by the great vow.

original: smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Possessing excellent vows means

original: spyod yul gyi smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: spyod yul gyi smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: possessing excellent vows for the sphere of activity.

original: spyod yul gyi smon lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod yul gyi smon lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Vows for the sphere of activity means

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed par smon pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i yul la smon pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed par smon pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i yul la smon pa'o //
translated: vows for the discernment of phenomena and vows for the sphere of activity of cultivating virtuous dharmas such as the immeasurables.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul thams cad bsgom pa'i smon lam bzang po dang ldan pas na smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul thams cad bsgom pa'i smon lam bzang po dang ldan pas na smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he possesses excellent vows for cultivating all the spheres of activity of the bodhisattva, he is called one who possesses excellent vows.

original: smon lam gyi stobs can zhes bya ba ni yang dag par smon lam dang chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs can zhes bya ba ni yang dag par smon lam dang chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Possessing the power of vows means possessing the power of true vows and great vows.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la mdo dang rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba thams cad sdud pa yon tan thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir smon pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la mdo dang rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba thams cad sdud pa yon tan thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir smon pa'o //
translated: A true vow is a vow for the future to gather all the virtues of the bodhisattva, as explained in the sutras and their commentaries, in order to gather all good qualities.

original: smon @273b lam chen po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i smon lam de nyid las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smon @273b lam chen po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i smon lam de nyid las rig par bya ste /
translated: The great aspiration is to be understood from the very same true aspiration.

original: da yang rnam pa bcu ste /üîΩphyi ma la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro ba thams cad dpag tu med par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung zhing bsrung bar bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
analyzed: da yang rnam pa bcu ste / phyi ma la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro ba thams cad dpag tu med par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung zhing bsrung bar bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
translated: It is also tenfold:üîΩThe great aspiration to make immeasurable offerings and services to the Tathagata in the future, the great aspiration to uphold and protect the holy Dharma of the Buddha Bhagavans,

original: chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi smon lam chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad legs par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi smon lam chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad legs par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
translated: the great aspiration to uphold the way of the Dharma, the great aspiration to dwell in the Tusita realm and so on until passing into parinirvana, the great aspiration to accomplish all aspects of bodhisattva conduct,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
translated: the great vow to bring all sentient beings to full maturity; the great vow to reveal all the world systems; the great vow to purify the buddha-fields;

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
translated: the great vow to enter the Great Vehicle and to have the same thoughts and practices as all the bodhisattvas; the great vow to make all one‚Äôs right practices fruitful;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i smon lam chen po'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i smon lam chen po'o //
translated: and the great vow to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de dag re re la yang smon lam gyi 'khor 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de dag re re la yang smon lam gyi 'khor 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag yod de /
translated: Each of these has countless hundreds of thousands of subsidiary vows.

original: de yang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs can rnams smon lam khyad par can gyis rnam par 'phrul pas na smon lam gyi stobs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs can rnams smon lam khyad par can gyis rnam par 'phrul pas na smon lam gyi stobs can zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas who have the power of vows, from the stage of pure universal responsibility onward, are called those who have the power of vows because they are emanations through special vows.üîΩFor four reasons,

original: rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'og nas rgyu rnam pa bzhi'i 'byung ba dang po gnyis ni gnyen po yin /üîΩtha ma gnyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de lta bu'i gnyen po thob kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spong bas so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs kyi yang dag
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'og nas rgyu rnam pa bzhi'i 'byung ba dang po gnyis ni gnyen po yin / tha ma gnyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de lta bu'i gnyen po thob kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spong bas so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs kyi yang dag
translated: the first two causes are antidotes,

original: pa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and the last two are the correct vows that are the means of accomplishing the complete fulfillment of the intention, because they are superior to ordinary beings and ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., who do not abandon the opposing factors even though they have attained such antidotes.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan @274a * //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan @274a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas,

original: las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Skill in abiding in the bliss of nirvana refers to not being afraid of nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid la mos pa des sbyor ba de mya ngan las 'das pas yid mi skrag pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan mthong ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa mi spong ba'i phyir gong du mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid la mos pa des sbyor ba de mya ngan las 'das pas yid mi skrag pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan mthong ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa mi spong ba'i phyir gong du mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to emptiness does not fear nirvana through that practice. Thus, he sees the benefits of nirvana, has faith in seeing its virtues, and does not abandon his devotion.

original: de ni rgyu dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first cause.

original: de myur du thob par nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: de myur du thob par nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: The ability to quickly attain it refers to correctly knowing samsara.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid la mos pa des sbyor ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid la mos pa des sbyor ba na /
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to emptiness does not fear samsara through that practice.

original: 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog par nus te /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog par nus te /
translated: Since one thoroughly knows samsara just as it is, one is able to rest one's mind in equanimity with regard to all afflictions such as attachment.

original: de la sems lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag na sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur la de ltar gyur nas /
analyzed: de la sems lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag na sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur la de ltar gyur nas /
translated: If one rests one's mind in equanimity with regard to that, one's mind is not afflicted and one will not wander in samsara. Having become that way,

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa'o //üîΩde la sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa'o // de la sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Generosity of the wise is giving to those who are in need and to those who are not in need.üîΩGenerosity of the wise who have attained forbearance is giving to those who are in need and to those who are not in need, with a mind that is free of defilements.üîΩGenerosity of the transcendent lords is giving to those who are in need and to those who are not in need, with a mind that is free of defilements and with a mind that is not attached to one's own flesh and limbs.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po rang bzhin dang / sgo dang / dngos po dang / bsam pa dang / len pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa'o //üîΩde la rang bzhin ni yo byad thams cad dang rang gi lus la mi lta ba'i ma chags pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po rang bzhin dang / sgo dang / dngos po dang / bsam pa dang / len pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa'o //üîΩde la rang bzhin ni yo byad thams cad dang rang gi lus la mi lta ba'i ma chags pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o //
translated: Generosity of the bodhisattvas is giving to those who are in need and to those who are not in need, with a mind that is free of defilements and with a mind that is not attached to one's own flesh and limbs, and with a mind that is not attached to one's own flesh and limbs.

original: sgo ni des kun nas bslang la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: sgo ni des kun nas bslang la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: The door is the physical and verbal actions that give up the thing to be given, motivated by that.

original: dngos po ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad gtong ba'o //
translated: The thing is the giving up of all the things to be given that are not reprehensible.

original: bsam pa ni sdom pa la gnas pa dang / 'ong ba mthong zhing 'bras bu la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni sdom pa la gnas pa dang / 'ong ba mthong zhing 'bras bu la lta ba'o //
translated: The attitude is the presence of the vow, the vision of the coming, and the vision of the result.

original: len pa ni su gang 'dod pa de la dngos po de so sor sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: len pa ni su gang 'dod pa de la dngos po de so sor sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: The receiver is the one who wants something, to whom one gives that thing individually.

original: thams cad sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is giving everything? It is twofold:

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving internal things and giving external things.

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold, according as it is appropriate:

original: dngos po dang / rgyu dang bye brag go //
analyzed: dngos po dang / rgyu dang bye brag go //
translated: the thing, the cause, and the distinction.

original: dka' ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dka' ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving difficulty?

original: rnam pa gsum ste sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chung ngu bdog pa bdag nyid la gnod par byas te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chung ngu bdog pa bdag nyid la gnod par byas te /
translated: It is threefold: giving up the thing to be given, even though it is small and you have it; giving up what is dear; and giving up what is difficult.

original: sdug bsngal dang du blangs nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / sdug pa'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis byams pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du blangs nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / sdug pa'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis byams pa'am /
translated: One gives to others after dispelling attachment to things that are dear, whether by nature dear,

original: yun ring po nas 'dris pa'am /
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'dris pa'am /
translated: or through long acquaintance,

original: shas cher phan pa'am /
analyzed: shas cher phan pa'am /
translated: or through great usefulness.üîΩOne gives to others the best and most excellent things to be given.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po mchog dang rab mchog tu gyur pa la zhen pa bsal nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos tshegs chen po sa sgrub pa rnams gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po mchog dang rab mchog tu gyur pa la zhen pa bsal nas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos tshegs chen po sa sgrub pa rnams gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: One gives to others things to be given that are acquired with great effort.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is giving in all its forms? It is fourfold:üîΩOne gives what one has oneself.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po @276b bdag la bdog pa yang sbyin par yang byed pa dang / gzhan dag las bslangs te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po @276b bdag la bdog pa yang sbyin par yang byed pa dang / gzhan dag las bslangs te /
translated: One gives after having asked for it from others.

original: yang sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa po bdag gi tshal pa la sogs pa yang sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo pa gzhan 'dod pa rnams la yang sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa po bdag gi tshal pa la sogs pa yang sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo pa gzhan 'dod pa rnams la yang sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: 1) the giving of one's own goods and chattels; 2) the giving of one's own flesh, etc.; 3) the giving of what is desired by others who are not beggars.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: What is giving to holy persons? It is fivefold:

original: dad pas sbyin pa byed pa dang / gus pas sbyin pa byed pa dang / rang gi lag nas sbyin pa byed pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas sbyin pa byed pa dang / gus pas sbyin pa byed pa dang / rang gi lag nas sbyin pa byed pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa byed pa'o //
translated: 1) giving with faith; 2) giving with respect; 3) giving with one's own hand; 4) giving respectfully; 5) giving without doing harm.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving in all its forms?

original: yon tan rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold, making thirteen in all.

original: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni mi rten par sbyin pa dang / mi sri bar byed pa dang / dga' bar sbyin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin pa dang / snod la sbyin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni mi rten par sbyin pa dang / mi sri bar byed pa dang / dga' bar sbyin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin pa dang / snod la sbyin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la sbyin pa'o //
translated: The sixfold giving is: 1) giving without seeking a basis; 2) giving without seeking a return; 3) giving with joy; 4) giving uninterruptedly; 5) giving to a worthy person; 6) giving to an unworthy person.

original: rnam pa bdun ni thams cad sbyin pa dang / kun la sbyin pa dang / dus thams cad du sbyin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang / sems can gyi dngos po sbyin pa dang / yul gyi dngos po sbyin pa dang /üîΩnor dang 'bru'i dngos po sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni thams cad sbyin pa dang / kun la sbyin pa dang / dus thams cad du sbyin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang / sems can gyi dngos po sbyin pa dang / yul gyi dngos po sbyin pa dang / nor dang 'bru'i dngos po sbyin pa'o //
translated: The seven aspects are giving everything, giving to everyone, giving at all times, giving without reproach, giving sentient beings, giving objects, and giving wealth and grain.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Giving to the destitute and to those who ask is eightfold:

original: zas dang skom gyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la zas dang skom sbyin pa dang / bzhon pas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa dang / gos kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa dang / rgyan gyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la rgyan sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: zas dang skom gyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la zas dang skom sbyin pa dang / bzhon pas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa dang / gos kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa dang / rgyan gyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la rgyan sbyin pa dang /
translated: giving food and drink to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving vehicles to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving clothes to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving ornaments to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving beds and seats to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving servants to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving household necessities to those who are destitute and who ask for them, giving lamps to those who are destitute and who ask for them.

original: snod spyad kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la snod spyad sbyin pa dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pa sbyin pa dang / gnas kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: snod spyad kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la snod spyad sbyin pa dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pa sbyin pa dang / gnas kyis phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa dang /

original: snang bas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la snang ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: snang bas phongs shing 'dod pa rnams la snang ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving vessels to those who are in need of vessels, giving perfume, flower garlands and ointments to those who are in need of perfume, flower garlands and ointments, giving shelter to those who are in need of shelter, giving light to those who are in need of light.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: What is generosity which brings happiness in this life and the next? It is ninefold:

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa ser sna dang / gsog 'jog gi dri ma bsal nas bzang po dang / gtsang ba dang / rung ba sbyin pa gsum dang / mi 'jigs pa @277a * //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa ser sna dang / gsog 'jog gi dri ma bsal nas bzang po dang / gtsang ba dang / rung ba sbyin pa gsum dang / mi 'jigs pa @277a * //
translated: Giving material things, giving good things, giving pure things, giving suitable things, giving fearlessness, giving the Dharma, giving material support, giving service, giving medicine when sick.

original: sbyin pa dud 'gro la sogs pa dang / mi dang / sems can du bgrod pa ma yin pa las bskyab pa gsum dang / chos kyi sbyin pa phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa dang / rigs par ston pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa gsum mo ;
analyzed: sbyin pa dud 'gro la sogs pa dang / mi dang / sems can du bgrod pa ma yin pa las bskyab pa gsum dang / chos kyi sbyin pa phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa dang / rigs par ston pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa gsum mo ;
translated: Generosity is also threefold: giving the Dharma without error, teaching correctly, and encouraging the practice of the precepts.

original: / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /üîΩthogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / bsags pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / khengs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mi rten pa'i sbyin pa dang / zhum pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste / thogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / bsags pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / khengs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mi rten pa'i sbyin pa dang / zhum pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang /
translated: What is pure generosity? It is generosity endowed with ten qualities:üîΩgenerosity that is not obstructed, generosity that is not held as supreme, generosity that is not accumulated, generosity that is not arrogant, generosity that is not dependent, generosity that is not discouraged,

original: ngan pa ma yin pa'i sbyin pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / lan la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ma yin pa'i sbyin pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / lan la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity that is not inferior, generosity that is not turned away, generosity that does not look for rewards, and generosity that does not look for ripening.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nine aspects of morality are the same as before.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of morality?

original: yon tan rnam pa bzhi po pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed de dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang ldan pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhi po pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed de dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang ldan pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: It is the vow which is taken well and correctly from another, which is the pure superior attitude, which is restored when broken, and which is endowed with mindfulness and respect for the purpose of not breaking it again.

original: tshul khrims thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is all morality?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: that which belongs to the class of the laity and that which belongs to the class of monastic life.

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold, according as it is appropriate:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring that which is wholesome, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: What is morality of accumulating good? It is threefold:

original: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod che la dbang phyug la dbang byed cing 'dun pa las de spangs nas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / tshul khrims blangs nas nyam thag ste srog la thug kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de nyams par mi byed cing /üîΩmed par mi byed pa dang / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ci nas nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod che la dbang phyug la dbang byed cing 'dun pa las de spangs nas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / tshul khrims blangs nas nyam thag ste srog la thug kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de nyams par mi byed cing / med par mi byed pa dang / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ci nas nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung na /
translated: The bodhisattva, having great wealth and power, renounces it and takes up the vow of morality. Having taken up morality, he does not violate the vow of morality even to save his life, and does not abandon it.üîΩAnd as long as he lives, he acts, moves, and thinks in such a way that not even a minor offense occurs,

original: lci ba lta 'byung bar ga la 'gyur ba de ltar spyod pa dang / gnas @277b pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad la dran pa nye bar gnas shing bag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: lci ba lta 'byung bar ga la 'gyur ba de ltar spyod pa dang / gnas @277b pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad la dran pa nye bar gnas shing bag yod pa yin no //
translated: much less a grave one. He is mindful and careful in all his actions, movements, and thoughts.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is morality of all the branches? It is fourfold:

original: yang dag par blangs ba dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / goms pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs ba dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / goms pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: morality of acceptance, natural morality, habitual morality, and skillful morality.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is morality of the holy ones?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang nyes par gyur na chos bzhin du 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang nyes par gyur na chos bzhin du 'chos pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva is himself endowed with morality; he induces others to accept morality; he praises morality; he rejoices when he sees another endowed with morality; and he extols morality.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is morality of all modes?

original: yon tan rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold qualities.

original: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: In summary, it is thirteenfold.

original: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni rgya che ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / brtan pa dang / tshul khrims rgyan dang ldan pa'o //üîΩrnam pa bdun ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni rgya che ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / brtan pa dang / tshul khrims rgyan dang ldan pa'o // rnam pa bdun ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: The six aspects of virtue are: vast, free of demerit, conducive to the basis of joy, constant, firm, and endowed with the ornament of morality.üîΩThe seven aspects are: morality of restraint, morality of acquiring virtue, morality of acting for the benefit of beings, morality of the vow of individual liberation, morality of the trainings, morality of the bodhisattva, and morality of the Buddhas.

original: sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The eight aspects are: morality of renouncing immorality, morality of undertaking good conduct, morality of benefitting sentient beings, morality of not shrinking from the suffering of samsara, morality of not being diverted by the attractions of pleasure, morality of not being diverted by laziness, morality of not being diverted by pride, and morality of not being diverted by desire for gain and honor.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: What is morality for the destitute and the desirous? It is eightfold.

original: gsang ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / lag pa dang / bong ba dang / lcag la sogs pas rnam par 'tshe ba dang /üîΩbdag nyid la gzhan gyis byas na des bdag nyid phongs shing de'i gnyen po 'dod pa bzhin du bdag gis gzhan dag la byas na yang des gzhan dag phongs shing de'i gnyen po 'don par 'gyur ro snyam du so sor brtags nas nyes pa de brgyad kun du
analyzed: gsang ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / lag pa dang / bong ba dang / lcag la sogs pas rnam par 'tshe ba dang / bdag nyid la gzhan gyis byas na des bdag nyid phongs shing de'i gnyen po 'dod pa bzhin du bdag gis gzhan dag la byas na yang des gzhan dag phongs shing de'i gnyen po 'don par 'gyur ro snyam du so sor brtags nas nyes pa de brgyad kun du
translated: 8. harming others with one‚Äôs hands, clods, sticks, etc.üîΩOne should reflect, ‚ÄúJust as I do not want others to harm me and I want to avoid their antipathy, in the same way, others do not want to be harmed by me and they want to avoid my antipathy.‚Äù

original: mi spyod pa'o //üîΩ'di dang @278a * //
analyzed: mi spyod pa'o // 'di dang @278a * //
translated: Having reflected in this way, one should not commit these eight faults.

original: gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: What is morality which is conducive to happiness here and in the next world? It is ninefold:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can dgag par bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba rnams 'gog par byed pa dang / gnang bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams gnang bar byed pa dang / bsdu bar bya ba rnams sdud par byed pa dang / tshar gcad par bya ba rnams tshar gcod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can dgag par bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba rnams 'gog par byed pa dang / gnang bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams gnang bar byed pa dang / bsdu bar bya ba rnams sdud par byed pa dang / tshar gcad par bya ba rnams tshar gcod par byed pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas stop sentient beings from doing what should be stopped, they allow them to do what should be allowed, they gather those who should be gathered and they subdue those who should be subdued.

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: What is the morality of generosity, the morality of patience, the morality of perseverance, the morality of concentration, the morality of wisdom and the morality of complete purification?

original: dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / ha cang thal ba ma yin pa dang / bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / ha cang thal ba ma yin pa dang / bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: 1. the initial undertaking of the vow, 2. not being excessively timid, 3. not being excessively rash, 4. being fully engaged in carefulness, 5. making good prayers, 6. being fully engaged in the perfect rite,

original: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs ba dang / nges par 'byed pa dang / yongs su ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs ba dang / nges par 'byed pa dang / yongs su ma nyams pa'o //
translated: 7. being fully engaged in the perfect livelihood, 8. avoiding the two extremes, 9. the penetrating, and 10. not degenerating.

original: bzod pa rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nine types of patience are as above.

original: de la bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of patience?

original: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po rten gyi khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po rten gyi khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: It is indifference endowed with four kinds of distinction: distinction of basis, distinction of state, distinction of object, and distinction of cause.

original: de la rten gyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la rten gyi khyad par ni /
translated: What is the distinction of basis?

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based on the power of discernment and the power of cultivation.

original: gnas kyi khyad par ni sems can mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa thams cad la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi khyad par ni sems can mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa thams cad la gnas pa'o //
translated: The specific basis is that it is present in all sentient beings, whether they are friends, enemies, or neutral persons, whether they are happy, suffering, or neither.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par ni gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / chos la rtog pa thams cad la dmigs pa'o //üîΩrgyu'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par ni gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / chos la rtog pa thams cad la dmigs pa'o // rgyu'i khyad par ni /
translated: The specific object is that it is concerned with all the injuries, sufferings, and ideas about the Dharma.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems dang snying rje 'ba' zhig gis ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems dang snying rje 'ba' zhig gis ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: The specific cause is that it is the result of the cause of the absence of desire for material things and of compassion.üîΩThe specific action is that it is the support for not retaliating and for patience.üîΩThe specific aid is that it is the support for the perfection of giving, because one does not retaliate.

original: bzod pa thams cad gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bzod pa thams cad gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is patience?

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //üîΩde yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o // de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa @278b la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa'o //

translated: Moreover, it is threefold, according as it is the patience of not retaliating against harm done by others, the patience of voluntarily enduring suffering, and the patience of certainty in respect to the Dharma.

original: dka' ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: What is patience in the face of difficulties? It is threefold:

original: sems can nyam chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa dang / bdag nyid rje dpon du gyur pa bran g-yog gis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa dang / sems can bdag pas rigs dang rus ches dman pa dag gis gnod pa mchog tu chen po byas pa bzod pa'o //

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is patience in the face of all? It is fourfold:

original: mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal ba dang / gsum char gyis dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang lhag pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal ba dang / gsum char gyis dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang lhag pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'o //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: What is patience of the holy? It is fivefold:
