analyzed: kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas kun nas mnar sems mi byed pa dang / brtsal ba rnam pa lnga po sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang / chos rnams yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa dang ;
translated: The five kinds of seeking are: seeking to remove the suffering of suffering beings; seeking the teachings; practicing the teachings in accordance with the teachings;

original: chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang / sems can gyi byed pa rnams dang / bya ba rnams la yang dag pa'i grogs su 'gro ba'i brtsal ba mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang / sems can gyi byed pa rnams dang / bya ba rnams la yang dag pa'i grogs su 'gro ba'i brtsal ba mi brjod pa'o //
translated: teaching those teachings extensively to others; and seeking to be a true companion to beings in all their activities.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: What is patience that brings happiness here and in the next world? There are nine types.

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang ; bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul dang / lus dang / sems dub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang ; bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul dang / lus dang / sems dub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
translated: It is patience with regard to cold, heat, hunger, thirst, being bitten by gadflies, being bitten by mosquitoes, wind, sun, snakes, fatigue of body and mind, and the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: What is pure patience? It is of ten kinds:

original: gnod pa byas pa la phyis gnod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / dgra'i bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan gdags pa'i phyir brtson par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyis shad kyis byang bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa la phyis gnod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / dgra'i bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan gdags pa'i phyir brtson par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyis shad kyis byang bar byed pa dang /
translated: 1) not holding grudges, 2) not retaliating, 3) not harboring thoughts of enmity, 4) being ready to help even at the cost of one's life, 5) being ready to give one's own life, 6) being ready to give one's possessions, 7) being ready to do service, 8) being ready to do all these things without delay, 9) being ready to do them with a joyful mind, and 10) being ready to do them with a respectful attitude.

original: mi dga' bar byas pa ni mi dga' bar gyur kyang rung zhes gzhan dag 'chags su mi gzhug pa dang / de nyid kyi rkyen byas nas mi bzod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: mi dga' bar byas pa ni mi dga' bar gyur kyang rung zhes gzhan dag 'chags su mi gzhug pa dang / de nyid kyi rkyen byas nas mi bzod pa las brtsams te /
translated: What is patience that is difficult to carry out? It is of ten kinds:üîΩ1) patience in putting up with the disagreeable, 2) patience in accepting hardships, 3) patience in realizing profound Dharma, 4) patience in not retaliating, 5) patience in not being upset, 6) patience in not being discouraged, 7) patience in not being attached, 8) patience in not being afraid, 9) patience in not being angry, and 10) patience in not being envious.

original: shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa las brtsams te ston pa la shas cher sdug par 'dzin cing gus pa dang ldan pa dang / sems can la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa las brtsams te ston pa la shas cher sdug par 'dzin cing gus pa dang ldan pa dang / sems can la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa las brtsams te /
translated: He is generally endowed with a sense of shame and with a sense of integrity. He is generally devoted to the Teacher, beginning with patience. He is generally compassionate toward sentient beings, beginning with non-violence.

original: sems can rnams la shas cher snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / mi bzod pa'i chos grogs dang bcas pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la shas cher snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / mi bzod pa'i chos grogs dang bcas pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is free from the attachment of the realm of desire, because he has completely abandoned all impatience and its accompaniments.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nine aspects of vigor are the same as before.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of vigor?

original: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang ldan pa'i yongs su g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang ldan pa'i yongs su g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is a complete exertion which is endowed with four special qualities: object, aspect, application, and cause.

original: de la dmigs pa'i dge @279b ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i dge @279b ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The virtues which are the object of this effort are infinite, and they are gathered in order to benefit beings.

original: rnam pa ni sems mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sems mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: The aspect is the mental effort.

original: sbyor ba ni sbyangs pa'i bar chad med pa'i phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sbyangs pa'i bar chad med pa'i phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: The application is the non-error of the uninterrupted training.

original: rgyu mthun pa ni de las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yongs su g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni de las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yongs su g-yo ba'o //
translated: The natural outcome is the movement of body, speech and mind which arises from that.

original: brtson 'grus thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is all effort?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
translated: that which is based on the side of the householder and that which is based on the side of the monk.

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold according to circumstances:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: the armor-effort, the effort of accumulating the factors of virtue, and the effort of working for the benefit of beings.

original: dga' ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effort of delight?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: gos dang zas dang ma la cha dang stan dang bdag tu 'du shes kyang mi byed par dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pa dang / rigs mthun pa ma bor gyi bar du dus thams cad du brtson 'grus rtsom pa de lta bu des zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: gos dang zas dang ma la cha dang stan dang bdag tu 'du shes kyang mi byed par dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pa dang / rigs mthun pa ma bor gyi bar du dus thams cad du brtson 'grus rtsom pa de lta bu des zhugs pa dang /
translated: They are always engaged in cultivating virtuous qualities without regard for clothing, food, bedding, seats, or notions of self.

original: mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are engaged in such effort until they attain the qualities of realizing sameness.

original: ha cang gtugs pa yang ma yin la phyin ci ma log cing don dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang gtugs pa yang ma yin la phyin ci ma log cing don dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are neither excessively lax nor excessively tense, and they are endowed with unmistaken and meaningful effort.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is effort in all aspects? It is fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong bar byed pa dang / dkar po'i chos 'grub par byed pa dang / las yongs su dag par byed pa dang / shes pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong bar byed pa dang / dkar po'i chos 'grub par byed pa dang / las yongs su dag par byed pa dang / shes pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the effort that eliminates afflicted entities, that accomplishes virtuous entities, that purifies karma, and that increases knowledge.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effort of the holy person?

original: rnam pa lnga ste ;
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste ;
translated: It is fivefold:

original: ma btang ba dang / nyams pa myong ba dang / zhum pa med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / bstun te sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma btang ba dang / nyams pa myong ba dang / zhum pa med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / bstun te sbyor ba'o //
translated: uninterrupted, uninterrupted in the face of suffering, uninterrupted in the face of difficulty, uninterrupted in the face of distraction, and uninterrupted in the face of discouragement.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is effort in all its forms?

original: yon tan rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold.

original: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: In brief, it is thirteenfold.

original: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni /
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni /
translated: What is the sixfold effort?

original: rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gus pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gus pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: It is the effort of constant practice, the effort of devoted practice, the effort of the practice of the cause, the effort of the practice of application, the effort of the practice of non-disturbance, and the effort of the practice of non-satisfaction.

original: rnam pa bdun @280a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun @280a * //
translated: What is the sevenfold effort?

original: po ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa dang / mthun pa dang ldan pa dang / khyad par can dang / tshol ba po dang / bslab pa'i brtson 'grus dang / bdag nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor ba kun nas bsrung zhing 'khrul ba chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: po ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa dang / mthun pa dang ldan pa dang / khyad par can dang / tshol ba po dang / bslab pa'i brtson 'grus dang / bdag nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor ba kun nas bsrung zhing 'khrul ba chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The first is the effort of one who is intent, the second is the effort of one who is in accord, the third is the effort of one who is special, the fourth is the effort of one who seeks, the fifth is the effort of one who is trained, and the sixth is the effort of one who is engaged in self-purification and in the purification of error.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: What is effort in the face of difficulties? It is eightfold:üîΩThe bodhisattva is enthusiastic in giving to beggars who are in distress.

original: slong mo ba sdug bsngal ba rnams la slong ba'i snod la mngon bar spro ba dang / sems can ma rungs pa'i sdig pa chen po'i las byas pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas de dang bral ba'i phyir mngon par spro ba dang ;
analyzed: slong mo ba sdug bsngal ba rnams la slong ba'i snod la mngon bar spro ba dang / sems can ma rungs pa'i sdig pa chen po'i las byas pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas de dang bral ba'i phyir mngon par spro ba dang ;
translated: He is enthusiastic in freeing beings from evil, great sins, by means of the great compassion of the Dharma.

original: rab tu byung ba tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas de dang bral ba'i mngon par spro ba dang / btsal ba rnam pa lnga po sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas de dang bral ba'i mngon par spro ba dang / btsal ba rnam pa lnga po sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang /
translated: It is enthusiasm for the five kinds of search: for the sake of removing the suffering of suffering beings, one strives to find the means of removing it;

original: chos rnams yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / bya ba rnams yang dag par grogs su 'gro ba'i btsal ba la mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / bya ba rnams yang dag par grogs su 'gro ba'i btsal ba la mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: one searches for the teachings; one practices the teachings in accordance with the teachings; one teaches those teachings extensively to others; and one is enthusiastic about the search for the right conditions for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: What is diligence that brings happiness here and in the next world? It is ninefold:

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul dang / lus dang / sems dub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul dang / lus dang / sems dub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: cold, heat, hunger, thirst, being bitten by gadflies and mosquitoes, wind, sun, snakes, physical and mental fatigue, and the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: rnam par dag pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is pure effort?

original: rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: It is of ten kinds:

original: 'tsham pa dang / goms pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / legs par zin pa dang / dus su goms par brtson pa dang / mtshan ma rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / zhum pa med pa dang / snyoms pa dang / byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsham pa dang / goms pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / legs par zin pa dang / dus su goms par brtson pa dang / mtshan ma rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / zhum pa med pa dang / snyoms pa dang / byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: appropriate, habitual, non-distracted, well-controlled, timely, endowed with the investigation of signs, not depressed, balanced, and dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa dgu yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nine categories of meditation are as before.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of meditation?

original: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po rten dang / rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang phyogs kyis rab tu dbye ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po rten dang / rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang phyogs kyis rab tu dbye ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The one-pointedness of mind is distinguished in four ways: basis, aspect, nature, and orientation.

original: de la rten ni byang chub @280b sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang / bsams pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la rten ni byang chub @280b sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang / bsams pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The basis is the Bodhisattva Canon, preceded by hearing and reflection.

original: rnam pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The aspect is mundane and supramundane.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sems rtse gcig pa dge ba la sems gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sems rtse gcig pa dge ba la sems gnas pa'o //
translated: The nature is the virtuous one-pointedness of mind, the abiding of the mind.

original: phyogs ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: The orientation is the orientation of serenity, the orientation of transcendent insight, and the orientation of the path that unites the two.

original: bsam gtan thams cad gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan thams cad gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is concentration? It is twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold according to its nature:

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: concentration for abiding in happiness in this life, concentration for accomplishing the qualities of the bodhisattvas meditative absorption and concentration for acting for the sake of living beings.

original: dka' ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: What is difficult concentration? It is threefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la gnas pa mngon par bsgrub pa rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs shin tu 'dris pa dag gi gnas nas rang dgar bsam gtan gyi bde ba mchog de bzlog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la gnas pa mngon par bsgrub pa rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs shin tu 'dris pa dag gi gnas nas rang dgar bsam gtan gyi bde ba mchog de bzlog ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, having accomplished the vast and manifold meditative absorptions, and being well trained in them, turns away from the supreme happiness of meditative absorption, which he could enjoy at will.üîΩHe takes birth in the world of desire for the sake of living beings.

original: sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dpag tu med grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dpag tu med grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva accomplishes immeasurable, innumerable, inconceivable meditative absorptions, which transcend the domain of the disciples and solitary realizers, on the basis of meditative absorption.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, by means of the meditative concentrations,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is meditative concentration in all its forms? It is fourfold:

original: rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / rim pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / rim pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
translated: without applied thought but with sustained thought, joyful, and blissful.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: What is meditative concentration of holy beings? It is fivefold:

original: ro myong ba med pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ro myong ba med pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
translated: without relishing, associated with lovingkindness, associated with compassion, associated with joy, and associated with equanimity.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditative concentration in all its aspects?

original: yon tan rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold.

original: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu @281a * //
analyzed: spyir bsdoms na rnam pa bcu @281a * //
translated: In brief, it is tenfold.

original: gsum mo // de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni /
analyzed: gsum mo // de la yon tan rnam pa drug ni /
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattva is sixfold:

original: dge ba'i bsam gtan dang / sprul pa dang sprul pa la lung du ma bstan pa'i bsam gtan dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don legs par nges pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam gtan dang / sprul pa dang sprul pa la lung du ma bstan pa'i bsam gtan dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don legs par nges pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: the concentration of virtue, the concentration of emanation, the concentration of neutral emanation, the concentration of the serenity side, the concentration of the insight side, the concentration of the good ascertainment of the aims of self and other,

original: mngon par shes pa'i mthu yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i mthu yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: and the concentration of the accomplishment of the good qualities of the power of superknowledge.üîΩThe concentration of the bodhisattva is sevenfold:

original: rnam pa bdun ni ming la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni ming la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang /
translated: the concentration focused on the name, the concentration focused on the object, the concentration focused on the serenity sign, the concentration focused on the insight sign, the concentration focused on the equanimity sign, the concentration of the happy abodes in this life,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: and the concentration of the performance of the aims of others.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa la bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa la bsam gtan gang zhe na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: What is concentration in the absence of desire? It is eightfold:

original: dug dang / thog dang / rims drag po dang / 'byung ba dang / gdon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi ba bsgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byin gyis rlob pa'i bsam gtan dang / khams 'khrug pa las gyur pa'i nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: dug dang / thog dang / rims drag po dang / 'byung ba dang / gdon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi ba bsgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byin gyis rlob pa'i bsam gtan dang / khams 'khrug pa las gyur pa'i nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: It is concentration that blesses the mantras that are accomplished in order to pacify the harm of poison, lightning, contagious diseases, the elements, evil spirits and so on, concentration that completely pacifies the various illnesses that arise from the disturbance of the elements,

original: mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag byung ba'i tshe char sgrub bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs chu dang skom la yod pa rnams las legs par yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag byung ba'i tshe char sgrub bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs chu dang skom la yod pa rnams las legs par yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: concentration that produces rain when there is a great famine and concentration that completely protects from the various fears created by humans and nonhumans, such as water and thirst.

original: 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa zas dang skom gyis phongs pa rnams la zas skom nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dbul po longs spyod med pa rnams kyi longs spyod nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / phyogs bcu dag na sems can bag med pa rnams la legs par bskul ba'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa zas dang skom gyis phongs pa rnams la zas skom nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dbul po longs spyod med pa rnams kyi longs spyod nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / phyogs bcu dag na sems can bag med pa rnams la legs par bskul ba'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: the concentration of providing food and drink to those who are in the wilderness and who are suffering from hunger and thirst; the concentration of providing wealth to the poor; the concentration of properly exhorting those beings who are heedless in the ten directions;

original: sems can gyi don bya ba 'byung do cog legs par bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba 'byung do cog legs par bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: and the concentration of properly accomplishing all the aims of beings.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration that leads to happiness in this life and in the next?

original: rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: It is of nine kinds:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang rjes su @281b bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams la ngan song gis rnam par ston pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang rjes su @281b bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams la ngan song gis rnam par ston pa'i bsam gtan dang /

analyzed: legs par bskyang ba dang / khyim 'byor bar bya ba'i shes rab dang / rgyal po'i tshul dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i shes rab bo //üîΩ'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur pa'i shes rab gang zhe na rnam pa dgu ste ;
translated: the wisdom that is the knowledge of the various kinds of eloquence,üîΩthe wisdom that is the knowledge of

original: nang gi rig pa la shin tu rnam par byang zhing rab tu gnas pa'i shes rab dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la ni shin tu rnam par byang la /üîΩrab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga po shin tu rnam par byang ba de dag nyid la brten nas gdul ba rmongs pa rnams dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa gzhan dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
analyzed: nang gi rig pa la shin tu rnam par byang zhing rab tu gnas pa'i shes rab dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la ni shin tu rnam par byang la / rab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga po shin tu rnam par byang ba de dag nyid la brten nas gdul ba rmongs pa rnams dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa gzhan dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
translated: It is the wisdom that is very well purified and well established in the inner sciences, and the wisdom that is very well purified but not well established in the sciences of medicine, logic, grammar, worldly crafts and occupations.üîΩAnd it is the wisdom by which the bodhisattva, on the basis of those very five sciences that are very well purified, respectively teaches, causes others to take up,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: encourages, and delights others who are to be trained, who are confused, who are heedless, and who are correctly engaged.

original: rnam par dag pa'i shes rab gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i shes rab gang zhe na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: What is pure wisdom? It is tenfold:

original: de kho na'i don ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu legs par 'dzin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / phyin ci ma log ba dang phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir lan pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang /
analyzed: de kho na'i don ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu legs par 'dzin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / phyin ci ma log ba dang phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir lan pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang /
translated: It is twofold in terms of the object of reality, since it apprehends the mode and the extent of reality. It is twofold in terms of engagement, since it well engages cause and effect. It is twofold in terms of the object of investigation, since it investigates the unmistaken and the mistaken. It is twofold in terms of the object of discernment, since it discerns the knowable that is internal and external. It is twofold in terms of the object of thorough knowledge, since it thoroughly knows the knowable that is contaminated and uncontaminated. It is twofold in terms of the object of abandonment, since it abandons the afflictions of the three realms. It is twofold in terms of the object of realization, since it realizes the two kinds of no self. It is twofold in terms of the object of purification, since it purifies the two obscurations. It is twofold in terms of the object of attainment, since it attains the two kinds of omniscience.

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thabs kyi don rnam pa gnyis dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thabs kyi don rnam pa gnyis dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two aspects of the object of means are the correct knowledge of all that is to be done and not to be done. The two aspects of the object of culmination are the correct knowledge of the defilement of defilement and the purification of purification.

original: shes rab rnam pa lnga'i rab tu dbye ba bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa lnga'i rab tu dbye ba bcu po de dag ni /
translated: These ten aspects of the five kinds of wisdom

original: rnam par dag pa mchog gis rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa mchog gis rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the purities of supreme purity.

original: bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par bya @283b ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par bya @283b ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The skillful means of ripening oneself and sentient beings have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the term and so on of the skill in the basis and the based should be explained.

original: gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bslab pa gsum du bsdus pa las bslab pa gsum po snga ma snga ma ni gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bslab pa gsum du bsdus pa las bslab pa gsum po snga ma snga ma ni gnas pa yin la /
translated: Skill in the basis and the based is the six perfections subsumed in the three trainings. The former three trainings are the based,

original: phyi ma phyi ma ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: and the latter three are the basis.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: Skill in that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhi drug po de dag las du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhi drug po de dag las du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: the Lord, the Bhagavan, was asked, Bhagavan, from among those six bases, how many are the training in superior morality? and so on.üîΩIt should be understood that the first three are the training in superior morality.

original: dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ste /
translated: The first three are generosity, ethics, and patience.

original: sbyin pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i rgyu yang yin te mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la tshul khrims ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i rgyu yang yin te mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la tshul khrims ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: Generosity is also the cause of taking up morality, because the essence of morality is giving fearlessness, and morality is the essence of superior morality.

original: bzod pa ni tshul khrims kyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa ni tshul khrims kyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience is the retinue of morality.

original: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Concentration is the training in superior mind, because its nature is one-pointedness of mind.

original: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is the training in superior wisdom, because its nature is the discernment of phenomena.

original: brtson 'grus ni kun du 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni kun du 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I declare that effort is universal, because its nature is the application to all virtuous dharmas.

original: bslab pa gsum gyi grangs dang / go rims dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rgya cher ni sngar 'bras bu la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi grangs dang / go rims dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rgya cher ni sngar 'bras bu la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The number of the three trainings, their sequence, their definition, whether they exist or not, and so forth should be understood in detail as they were explained in the chapter on the results.üîΩ

original: gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /üîΩ// / de'i 'og tu mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to / // / de'i 'og tu mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The number of the three trainings, their sequence, their verbal definitions, their existence and nonexistence, and so on, should be understood in detail as they were explained in the chapter on the results.üîΩThe meaning of the words of the skill in means for the higher and the definite good, and so on, should be explained.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
translated: The higher is the heavens.

original: @284a * // nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: @284a * // nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The definite good is nirvana.

original: thabs ni de gnyis ka thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: thabs ni de gnyis ka thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: The means is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, the cause for attaining both of those.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of skill in that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las du ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las du ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn was asked, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, among those six bases of training, how many are the accumulation of merit?‚Äù and so on.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever is the training in superior morality is the accumulation of merit.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ste /
translated: Giving, morality, and patience

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are the nature of the three bases of meritorious action.

original: de la sbyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la des ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob bo //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la des ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob bo //
translated: Among them, giving is the meritorious action that arises from giving. By that, one obtains perfect resources.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la des ni lus phun sum tshogs pa thob /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la des ni lus phun sum tshogs pa thob /
translated: Morality is the meritorious action that arises from morality. By that, one obtains a perfect body.

original: bzod pa ni tshad med pa bzhi la sogs pa bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: bzod pa ni tshad med pa bzhi la sogs pa bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yin la /
translated: Patience is the meritorious action that arises from cultivating the four immeasurables.

original: des ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa thob pas na /
analyzed: des ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa thob pas na /
translated: Since it obtains the perfect retinue,

original: longs spyod dang lus dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs de ni mngon par mtho ba'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod dang lus dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs de ni mngon par mtho ba'i thabs yin no //
translated: that accumulation of merit, the cause of perfect resources, body and retinue, is the means for high rebirth.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
translated: Whatever is the training in superior wisdom is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: ye shes ni shes bya la phyin ci ma log par kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / rnam grangs 'dzin pa yin la ;
analyzed: ye shes ni shes bya la phyin ci ma log par kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / rnam grangs 'dzin pa yin la ;
translated: Wisdom is the unmistaken knowledge of the conventional truth and the extent of knowable objects and the retention of categories.

original: shes rab kyang chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yin pas bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs de ni nges par legs pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyang chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yin pas bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs de ni nges par legs pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: and wisdom is the knowledge and vision of the two realities that is unmistaken with regard to the ultimate reality of the thorough analysis of phenomena and with regard to the way things exist and the way they are characterized, and it is the means for attaining nirvana.üîΩI declare that effort and meditative concentration are universal.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni kun du 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan la brten nas ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bsgom @284b pa la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni kun du 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan la brten nas ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bsgom @284b pa la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi phyogs yin no //
translated: On the basis of effort and meditative concentration, one takes up and protects generosity and morality, and cultivates the immeasurables such as love.

original: de gnyis la brten nas shes rab rnam pa gsum la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: de gnyis la brten nas shes rab rnam pa gsum la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: On the basis of these two, one applies oneself to the three kinds of wisdom.

original: mkhas par bya ba'i thams cad la mkhas pa dang / bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu 'byed cing so sor rtog pa ni ye shes kyi phyogs yin no //üîΩbsod nams dang ye shes la ni rgyu yang yod /
analyzed: mkhas par bya ba'i thams cad la mkhas pa dang / bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu 'byed cing so sor rtog pa ni ye shes kyi phyogs yin no // bsod nams dang ye shes la ni rgyu yang yod /
translated: The side of wisdom is the skill in all that is to be known, the discernment of the truths, and the correct discernment of the dharmas that are wholesome, unwholesome, etc.

original: 'bras bu yang yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yod de /
translated: There is a cause and a result of merit and wisdom.üîΩWhat is the cause?

original: rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: bsod nams dang ye shes mthong ba dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur la 'dun pa dang / mthun pa la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes mthong ba dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur la 'dun pa dang / mthun pa la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa'o //
translated: the will to see, to abide in, and to increase merit and wisdom; the condition that is favorable to them and not opposed to them; and the previous practice of merit and wisdom.

original: 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result?

original: bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor bar 'khor zhing sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor bar 'khor zhing sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur te /
translated: And he is able to benefit sentient beings as he wishes.

original: de gnyis ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: These two are the results of merit.

original: ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi log pas ma yin pa dang / mkhas par bya ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang /
analyzed: ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi log pas ma yin pa dang / mkhas par bya ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang /
translated: On the basis of wisdom, the bodhisattva accumulates merit correctly, not falsely, and by means of the various immeasurable skills,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes a perfect buddha, a worthy one, a perfectly enlightened one.

original: de gnyis ni ye shes kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni ye shes kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: These two are the results of wisdom.

original: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa de ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa de ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: Thus, the accumulations of merit and wisdom, with their causes and results, are the means for high status and for definite goodness.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of skill in the means for high status and certain goodness, etc., has already been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu legs par shin tu bslab pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu legs par shin tu bslab pa la mkhas pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of skill in good, thorough training, etc., should be explained.

original: legs par shin tu bslab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: legs par shin tu bslab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in good, thorough training

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la legs par shin tu bslab pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la legs par shin tu bslab pa ste /
translated: is the good, thorough training in the six perfections.

original: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par bya ba'i don 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: Skill in the meaning to be known in that is taught here.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

analyzed: dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par grub pa ni de'i 'og tu chos spyad pa bcu po dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin pas de lta bus bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, one should train well in those six bases of training.

original: de la chos spyod pa bcu po dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos spyod pa bcu po dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: The ten Dharma activities are

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag gi yi ger 'drir bcug ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag gi yi ger 'drir bcug ste /
translated: having the bodhisattva canon, which is included in the Mahayana sutras, and so on, written out and

original: 'dzin pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa la gus par byas te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa la gus par byas te /
translated: having it preserved, worshipped, given to others, and respectfully taught.

original: sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa ste /
translated: One should engage in it through the aspects of reflection and meditation.

original: de dag thams cad ni bsod nams rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa skye ba'i @287a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni bsod nams rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa skye ba'i @287a * //
translated: All of these are the causes of the arising of the Mahayana sutras and so on that possess great merit.

original: lam yin no //
analyzed: lam yin no //
translated: It is the path.

original: dgu pa ni sbyor ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: dgu pa ni sbyor ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The ninth is the path of application.

original: bcu pa ni sgrib pa rnam par sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: bcu pa ni sgrib pa rnam par sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: The tenth is the path of the purification of obscurations.

original: de dag lam dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: de dag lam dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
translated: By means of the first eight of these paths, one generates the knowledge that arises from listening.

original: dgu pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dgu pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
translated: By means of the ninth, one generates the knowledge that arises from reflection.

original: bcu pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: bcu pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed do //
translated: By means of the tenth, one generates the knowledge that arises from meditation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pas ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pas ni /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva, by generating the knowledge that arises from listening,

original: dang por bdag nyid chos spyad pa dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chos btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang por bdag nyid chos spyad pa dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chos btsal bar bya'o //
translated: first of all seeks the Dharma in order to generate the knowledge that arises from listening by means of the first eight of the practices of the Dharma.

original: de'i 'og tu gzhan dag chos spyad pa brgyad po de nyid kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzhan dag chos spyad pa brgyad po de nyid kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: After that, he teaches the Dharma in order to cause others to generate the knowledge that arises from listening by means of those very eight practices of the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chos spyad pa dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chos spyad pa dang po brgyad kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva generates the knowledge that arises from listening in order to cultivate the Dharma by means of the first eight of the above ten Dharma activities.

original: chos tshol bas ji ltar tshol /
analyzed: chos tshol bas ji ltar tshol /
translated: How does he seek the Dharma?

original: ci'i phyir chos tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos tshol zhe na /
translated: For what purpose does he seek the Dharma?

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa rnams tshol lo //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa rnams tshol lo //
translated: In brief, he seeks the bodhisattva canon, the ≈õrƒÅvaka canon, the treatises of outsiders, and the knowledge of worldly arts and crafts.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva canon is the extensive section of the twelve divisions of the scriptures.

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod ni yan lag lhag ma rnams yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod ni yan lag lhag ma rnams yin no //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka canon is the remaining divisions.

original: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The treatises of outsiders are of three kinds:

original: gso ba'i bstan bcos dang / gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos dang / sgra'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: gso ba'i bstan bcos dang / gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos dang / sgra'i bstan bcos so //
translated: medical treatises, logical treatises, and grammatical treatises.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa ni /
translated: Knowledge of worldly arts and crafts is

original: bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of arts and crafts.

original: byang chub sems dpas btsal bar bya ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas btsal bar bya ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: The things that the bodhisattva should seek are, in brief,

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po nang gi rig pa dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po nang gi rig pa dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa dag yin no //
translated: the five sciences: inner science, the science of logic, the science of grammar, the science of arts and crafts, and the science of medicine.

original: de la nang gi rig pa ni /
analyzed: de la nang gi rig pa ni /
translated: Among them, the inner science

original: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as fourfold:

original: gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bstan pa'i don bsdu ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi @287b bka' zhes bya ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bstan pa'i don bsdu ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi @287b bka' zhes bya ba'i gnas so //
translated: the presentation of the designation of the basis, the presentation of the designation of the classification of terms, the summary of the meaning of the teaching, and the abode called the word of the Buddha.

original: de la gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo'i gzhi gsum gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de la gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo'i gzhi gsum gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdu ba'o //
translated: The exposition of the basis is the three bases of the Sutra, Vinaya, and Abhidharma, which are the collection of the Buddha's words.

original: ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The exposition of the classification of names is the classification of the names of all the Dharmas collected in the Buddha's words.

original: bstan pa'i don bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bkas bsdus pa'i bstan pa mtha' yas pa thams cad mdor bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bkas bsdus pa'i bstan pa mtha' yas pa thams cad mdor bsdu ba'o //
translated: The exposition of the summary of the meaning of the teaching is the summary of all the infinite teachings collected in the Buddha's words.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya ba'i gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya ba thams cad bsdus pas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid shes par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya ba'i gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya ba thams cad bsdus pas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid shes par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'o //
translated: The basis of the Buddha's words is the basis for understanding the Buddha's words themselves, since it includes all that is called the Buddha's words.

original: rang gi rig pa de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag ston pa'i rnam pa dang / byas pa chud mi za zhing ma byas pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur bas ston pa'i gnas so //üîΩgso ba'i rig pa ni gso ba'i bstan bcos te /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag ston pa'i rnam pa dang / byas pa chud mi za zhing ma byas pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur bas ston pa'i gnas so // gso ba'i rig pa ni gso ba'i bstan bcos te /
translated: One‚Äôs own knowledge is engaged in two ways: in the form of teaching the truth of cause and effect, and in the form of teaching the principle of the indestructibility of action and the non-experience of the results of actions not done.üîΩThe knowledge of healing is the treatise on medicine.

original: nad gso ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: nad gso ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of healing illness.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having four aspects:

original: nad la mkhas pa dang / nad ci las gyur pa la mkhas pa dang / nad byung ba bsal ba la mkhas pa dang / nad bsal nas phyis mi 'byung bar bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: nad la mkhas pa dang / nad ci las gyur pa la mkhas pa dang / nad byung ba bsal ba la mkhas pa dang / nad bsal nas phyis mi 'byung bar bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in diagnosing the illness, skill in determining the cause of the illness, skill in eliminating the arisen illness, and skill in preventing the future occurrence of the illness.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It is engaged in just those four aspects.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rig pa ni gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rig pa ni gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos te /
translated: The knowledge of logic is the treatise on logic.

original: brtag pa'i dus su yod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i dus su yod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the thing that exists at the time of investigation.

original: de ni rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having seven aspects:

original: smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal che ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba'i chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba gces pa la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal che ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba'i chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba gces pa la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: the basis of speech, the ornament of speech, the punishment for faulty speech, the origin of speech, and the essential points of speech.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, it is engaged in two ways:

original: pha rol klan ka tshol ba la brjod pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhan las byung ba'i phas kyi rgol ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: pha rol klan ka tshol ba la brjod pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhan las byung ba'i phas kyi rgol ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: in the form of showing the benefits of speech to those who seek to find fault with others, and in the form of showing the benefits of liberation from adversaries who arise from others.

original: sgra'i rig pa ni sgra'i bstan bcos te /
analyzed: sgra'i rig pa ni sgra'i bstan bcos te /
translated: The science of grammar is the treatise on grammar.

original: gdags pa'i rnam par gzhag pa brda sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa'i rnam par gzhag pa brda sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the grammar that establishes designations.

original: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as having six aspects:

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / don gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang zag gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa @288a * //
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / don gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang zag gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa @288a * //
translated: the establishment of the designation of phenomena, the establishment of the designation of objects, the establishment of the designation of persons,

original: dang / dus gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / grangs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzhi yan lag dang bcas pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dang / dus gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / grangs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzhi yan lag dang bcas pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: and the establishment of the designation of time, the establishment of the designation of number, and the establishment of the designation of the basis with its branches.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, it operates in two ways:

original: skad kyi byings kyi ngo bo nyid bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ston pa'i rnam pa dang / tshig legs par sbyar ba'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: skad kyi byings kyi ngo bo nyid bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ston pa'i rnam pa dang / tshig legs par sbyar ba'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: in the way of teaching the establishment of the accomplishment of the nature of the verbal root, and in the way of teaching the benefit of the proper composition of words.

original: bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa'o //
analyzed: bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the arts and crafts is the knowledge of the worldly arts and crafts.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as having twelve aspects:

original: snam su bya ba'i bzo dang / nyo tshong gi bzo dang / rgyal po'i zham 'bring bya ba'i bzo dang / yi ge dang / rtsis dang / shod 'god pa dang / grangs dang lag rtsis kyi bzo dang / ltas su lta ba'i bzo dang /
analyzed: snam su bya ba'i bzo dang / nyo tshong gi bzo dang / rgyal po'i zham 'bring bya ba'i bzo dang / yi ge dang / rtsis dang / shod 'god pa dang / grangs dang lag rtsis kyi bzo dang / ltas su lta ba'i bzo dang /
translated: the art of weaving, the art of buying and selling, the art of serving the king, the art of writing, calculation, record keeping, and counting on the fingers, the art of astrology,

original: blo gros kyi bzo dang / bskyed pa'i bzo dang / rdungs kyi bzo dang / snam bya ba'i bzo dang / sbyor ba'i bzo dang / g-yos bya ba'i bzo dang / rol mo'i bzo'o //
analyzed: blo gros kyi bzo dang / bskyed pa'i bzo dang / rdungs kyi bzo dang / snam bya ba'i bzo dang / sbyor ba'i bzo dang / g-yos bya ba'i bzo dang / rol mo'i bzo'o //
translated: the arts of intellect, the arts of creation, the arts of carving, the arts of weaving, the arts of compounding, the arts of cooking, and the arts of music.

original: de ni rang rang gi las dang / bzo'i gnas bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su grub pa ston pa'i rnam pas 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni rang rang gi las dang / bzo'i gnas bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su grub pa ston pa'i rnam pas 'jug go //
translated: It is engaged in the demonstration of the results of the accomplishment of one's own work and the arts.

original: ji ltar tshol zhe na mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gsum gyis tshol te /
analyzed: ji ltar tshol zhe na mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gsum gyis tshol te /
translated: How does he search? In brief, the bodhisattva searches in three ways:

original: gus pa chen po nye bar gzhog pa dang / 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
analyzed: gus pa chen po nye bar gzhog pa dang / 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
translated: by the great respect which he brings to it, by the excellence of his going, and by the excellence of his hearing.

original: de la gus pa chen po nye bar gzhog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gus pa chen po nye bar gzhog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The great respect which he brings to it is twofold:

original: sdug bsngal nyams su len cing tshol ba dang / bde ba khyad du gsod cing tshol ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su len cing tshol ba dang / bde ba khyad du gsod cing tshol ba'o //
translated: he searches for the Dharma with great respect, enduring hardships, and he searches for it with great respect, disregarding his own body and life.

original: 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The excellence of his going is fourfold:

original: yon tan 'dod pas chos smra ba'i gam du 'gro ba'i klan ka'i sems kyis ma yin pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pas 'gro ba'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba ji lta bu zhig btsal snyam pas 'gro ba'i bdag nyid sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan 'dod pas chos smra ba'i gam du 'gro ba'i klan ka'i sems kyis ma yin pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pas 'gro ba'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba ji lta bu zhig btsal snyam pas 'gro ba'i bdag nyid sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang /
translated: One goes to the Dharma teacher with a desire for the Dharma, not with the intention of finding fault.üîΩOne goes with respect, not with a mind inflated with pride.üîΩOne goes with the thought of seeking virtue, not for the sake of one's own livelihood.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o snyam pas 'gro ba'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o snyam pas 'gro ba'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
translated: One goes with the thought of applying oneself to the roots of virtue for oneself and others, not for the sake of gain and honor.

original: nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfection of listening is also twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nyan pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nyan pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bas nyan pa'o //
translated: listening without affliction and listening without distraction.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nyan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum dang bral bas nyan pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nyan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum dang bral bas nyan pa ste /
translated: Listening without affliction is listening free from three kinds of affliction:

original: @288b khengs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: @288b khengs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas nyan pa'o //
translated: He listens without the defilement of pride, without the defilement of contempt, and without the defilement of discouragement.

original: de la rnam pa drug gis na khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug gis na khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is without the defilement of pride in six ways:

original: dus su nyan pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dang ; sri zhu byed pa dang / mi khro ba dang / rjes su grub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol bas so //
analyzed: dus su nyan pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dang ; sri zhu byed pa dang / mi khro ba dang / rjes su grub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol bas so //
translated: he listens at the proper time, with respect, with deference, without anger, with a desire to understand, and without looking for fault.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is without the defilement of contempt in four ways:

original: chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag khyad du mi gsod pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag khyad du mi gsod pa'o //
translated: he is attentive to the Dharma, attentive to the person who preaches the Dharma, he does not despise the Dharma, and he does not despise the person who preaches the Dharma.üîΩHe is without the defilement of discouragement in four ways:üîΩhe is not discouraged by the magnitude of the subject, he is not discouraged by the profundity of the subject, he is not discouraged by the length of time required, and he is not discouraged by the effort required.

original: rnam pa gcig gis ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: By one aspect, he becomes free from the defilement of discouragement.

original: bdag nyid kyis mi lcogs so snyam du bdag nyid khyad du mi gsod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mi lcogs so snyam du bdag nyid khyad du mi gsod pa'o //
translated: He does not despise himself, thinking, ‚ÄúI am incapable.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi g-yeng bas nyan pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng bas nyan pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Listening with an undistracted mind is fivefold:

original: kun nas shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / rna blags pa dang / yid btud pa dang / sems kun gyis bsams nas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / rna blags pa dang / yid btud pa dang / sems kun gyis bsams nas nyan pa'o //
translated: with a mind that is fully aware, with a one-pointed mind, with ears pricked up, with a humble mind, and with a mind that is fully focused.

original: ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /
translated: Why does he seek?

original: byang chub sems dpa' nang gi rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nang gi rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
translated: The bodhisattva seeks the inner science for two reasons:

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to accomplish it by means of the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and in order to teach it to others.

original: gso ba'i rig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
analyzed: gso ba'i rig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
translated: He seeks the science of healing for two reasons:

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the establishment of the various aspects of sentient beings and because of the benefit of the great multitude of people.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rig pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i phyir tshol te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rig pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i phyir tshol te /
translated: The science of logic is sought for four reasons:

original: de nyid legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de nyid legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to understand well-spoken and badly-spoken doctrines as they really are, in order to defeat adversaries, in order to inspire faith in those who have no faith in the teaching,

original: dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
