translated: and in order to increase the faith of those who have faith.

original: sgo'i rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
analyzed: sgo'i rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir tshol te /
translated: The science of grammar is sought for two reasons:

original: tshig dang yi ge nges tshig bzang pos spyod pas legs par spyad de brjod pa la mos pa rnams gdags la yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la yang nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge nges tshig bzang pos spyod pas legs par spyad de brjod pa la mos pa rnams gdags la yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la yang nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should seek the treatises on grammar in order to speak well, that is, to speak with good words and letters, in order to generate faith in those who are devoted to speech, and in order to engage in the conventional usage of various etymologies for a single meaning.

original: bzo dang las kyi rig pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi phyir tshol te /üîΩsems @289a * //
analyzed: bzo dang las kyi rig pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi phyir tshol te / sems @289a * //
translated: One should seek the treatises on artistic crafts and skills for three reasons:üîΩfor the sake of sentient beings, in order to provide for them with little difficulty;

original: can rnams kyi don du tshegs chung dus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa byin pa'i phan 'dogs bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can rnams kyi don du tshegs chung dus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa byin pa'i phan 'dogs bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to generate affection for sentient beings; and in order to attract them with the gift of knowledge of artistic crafts and skills.

original: de dag ni rig pa'i gnas lnga pos so so'i dgos pa bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni rig pa'i gnas lnga pos so so'i dgos pa bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: These are the individual purposes of the five sciences.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po de dag tshol ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po de dag tshol ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas seek these five sciences in order to perfect the great accumulation of wisdom for unexcelled enlightenment.

original: thams cad la de ltar ma bslabs na rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la de ltar ma bslabs na rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one does not train in all of them, one will not gradually attain the unobstructed wisdom of omniscience.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag chos spyad pa brgyad po de nyid kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir chos ston pas ci zhig ston ci'i phyir ston zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag chos spyad pa brgyad po de nyid kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir chos ston pas ci zhig ston ci'i phyir ston zhe na /
translated: Then, in order to cause other bodhisattvas to generate the knowledge that arises from hearing through those very eight practices of Dharma, the bodhisattvas teach the Dharma. What do they teach? For what purpose do they teach?

original: gang btsal ba de nyid ston to //
analyzed: gang btsal ba de nyid ston to //
translated: They teach that very thing which they have sought.

original: bdag gi phyir btsal ba de nyid kyi phyir ston to //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir btsal ba de nyid kyi phyir ston to //
translated: They teach for that very purpose for which they have sought.

original: ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How do they teach?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: They teach in two ways:

original: mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa dang / yongs su dag pas ston to //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa dang / yongs su dag pas ston to //
translated: by speaking in accord with the Dharma and by teaching with complete purity.

original: de la mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The expression in accord with the Dharma means that the teaching is in accord with the benefit of others.

original: de rnam pa bco lnga ste spyod lam dang tshul dang mthun par gnas pa la ltos pa dang / chos la ser sna dang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med par ston pa dang tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston pa dang / don go rims bzhin du ston pa dang /
analyzed: de rnam pa bco lnga ste spyod lam dang tshul dang mthun par gnas pa la ltos pa dang / chos la ser sna dang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med par ston pa dang tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston pa dang / don go rims bzhin du ston pa dang /
translated: It has fifteen aspects: teaching in a manner that accords with the deportment and behavior of others, teaching without stinginess about the Dharma or holding the teacher's instructions close, teaching in a manner that accords with the sequence of words and letters, teaching in a manner that accords with the sequence of meanings,

original: chos kyang don dang ldan pa don kyang chos dang ldan par ston pa dang / yang dag par bstan par 'os pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par 'os pa rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyang don dang ldan pa don kyang chos dang ldan par ston pa dang / yang dag par bstan par 'os pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par 'os pa rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang /
translated: teaching the Dharma in a manner that accords with the meaning and teaching the meaning in a manner that accords with the Dharma, teaching correctly those who are worthy of correct teaching, causing those who are worthy of being made to take up the Dharma correctly to take it up,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par 'os pa rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par dga' bar bya bar 'os pa rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / 'jug sla bar ston pa dang / tshad ma gsum dang ldan par ston pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par 'os pa rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par dga' bar bya bar 'os pa rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / 'jug sla bar ston pa dang / tshad ma gsum dang ldan par ston pa dang /
translated: He praises those who are worthy of praise, delights those who are worthy of delight, teaches in a way that is easy to understand, teaches in a way that is endowed with the three valid cognitions,

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mthun par ston pa dang / rnam par ma 'khrugs par ston pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan par ston pa dang / 'khor thams cad dang ldan par ston te /
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mthun par ston pa dang / rnam par ma 'khrugs par ston pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan par ston pa dang / 'khor thams cad dang ldan par ston te /
translated: teaches in a way that leads to happy rebirths, teaches in a way that is consistent, teaches in a way that is not confused, teaches in a way that is endowed with the noble truths, and teaches in a way that is endowed with the entire retinue.

original: mdo gzhan las dus dang / bkur sti dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / 'dod par byed pa dang / mgu bar byed pa dang / spro bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las dus dang / bkur sti dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / 'dod par byed pa dang / mgu bar byed pa dang / spro bar byed pa dang /
translated: In other s≈´tras, he teaches in a way that is timely, respectful, sequential, connected, consistent, delightful, desirable, pleasing, inspiring,

original: sma mi 'bebs pa dang / rigs @289b pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to zhes gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sma mi 'bebs pa dang / rigs @289b pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to zhes gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is not condescending, reasonable, appropriate, unmixed, in accord with the Dharma, and in a way that is suited to the assembly.

original: yongs su dag pas ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pas ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa ston pa ste /
translated: He teaches with complete purity, that is, he teaches without being mixed up with the afflictions.

original: sems 'di rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sems 'di rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of minds:

original: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la byams pa'i sems kyis ston pa dang / nyes par ston pa rnams la phan pa'i sems kyis ston pa dang / bag med pa zhum pa rnams la snying brtse ba'i sems kyis ston pa dang / bdag la ni mi bstod /
analyzed: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la byams pa'i sems kyis ston pa dang / nyes par ston pa rnams la phan pa'i sems kyis ston pa dang / bag med pa zhum pa rnams la snying brtse ba'i sems kyis ston pa dang / bdag la ni mi bstod /
translated: He teaches with a mind of loving kindness toward sentient beings who do harm. He teaches with a mind of benefit toward those who teach incorrectly. He teaches with a mind of compassion toward those who are heedless and lazy. He teaches without praising himself

original: gzhan la ni mi smod par ston pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ni mi smod par ston pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar ston pa ste /
translated: or disparaging others. He teaches without hoping for gain, honor, or fame.

original: mdo gzhan las byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / phrag dog med pa'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis ston to zhes gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / phrag dog med pa'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis ston to zhes gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: In other scriptures, it is said that the teacher teaches with a mind of loving-kindness, a mind of benefit, a mind of compassion, a mind free of envy, and a mind free of material desires.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' chos spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' chos spyod pa /
translated: After that, the bodhisattva who practices the DharmaüîΩgenerates the knowledge that arises from devoted interest.

original: gus pas bsams pa las byung ba shes pa skyed par byed pa na gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: gus pas bsams pa las byung ba shes pa skyed par byed pa na gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: When he goes to a solitary place and reflects,

original: sems pa ni ji skad thos pa'i sems rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sems par byed de /
analyzed: sems pa ni ji skad thos pa'i sems rnams la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sems par byed de /
translated: he reflects on the teachings he has heard by means of eight kinds of attention that eliminate the resistances and cultivate the remedies.

original: thog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas chos rnams bsam pa rtsom par byed pa dang / rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor ba dang / rgyun du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas chos rnams bsam pa rtsom par byed pa dang / rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor ba dang / rgyun du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He begins by abandoning the topics that should not be reflected upon and then he begins to reflect on the teachings. He does so constantly, devotedly, and continuously.

original: lhod par mi byed pa dang / rigs pas dpyad par bya ba la rigs pas dpyod cing rigs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / mos par bya ba la mos par byed cing mos pas yid la byed pa gtong bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: lhod par mi byed pa dang / rigs pas dpyad par bya ba la rigs pas dpyod cing rigs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / mos par bya ba la mos par byed cing mos pas yid la byed pa gtong bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: They do not relax their effort, they do not contradict reason when they investigate what should be investigated, they do not give up their interest in what they are interested in,

original: don la rton par byed kyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / thog mar 'jug pa nas kyang sems la 'jug cing skabs ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: don la rton par byed kyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / thog mar 'jug pa nas kyang sems la 'jug cing skabs ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang /
translated: they rely on the meaning and not on the letter, they understand the teaching of the dark and the teaching of the great just as it is, they engage their minds from the beginning and do not engage at the wrong time,

original: zhugs nas kyang yang dang yang du yid la byed pas na snying po nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang yang dang yang du yid la byed pas na snying po nyid thob par byed de /
translated: and having engaged, they obtain the essence by repeatedly bringing it to mind.

original: yal bar mi 'dor bas sems so //
analyzed: yal bar mi 'dor bas sems so //
translated: They do not neglect it.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sems par byed pa la go rims bzhin du phan yon rnam pa brgyad yod de /üîΩthog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i @290a * //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sems par byed pa la go rims bzhin du phan yon rnam pa brgyad yod de / thog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i @290a * //
translated: Thus, there are eight benefits from the eight kinds of attention to the elimination of adverse elements and the cultivation of the counteragent, respectively.

original: gnas rnams spangs nas chos rnams bsam pa rtsom par byed na sems rmongs pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas rnams spangs nas chos rnams bsam pa rtsom par byed na sems rmongs pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: First, when one begins to reflect on the teachings, having eliminated those subjects that are not to be reflected upon, one's mind is not confused or distracted.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba dang gus pas sbyor bas rgyun du sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba dang gus pas sbyor bas rgyun du sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Second, one's attention is continuous, because one is always engaged in the teachings and one is engaged in them with devotion.

original: lhod par mi byed na sngar ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs shing khong du chud par 'gyur la ;
analyzed: lhod par mi byed na sngar ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs shing khong du chud par 'gyur la ;
translated: Third, one understands and penetrates the meaning that one has not previously understood.

original: rtogs pa'i don yang chud mi za zhing mi gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩrigs pas dpyad par bya ba la rigs pas dpyod cing rigs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed na /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don yang chud mi za zhing mi gsal bar mi 'gyur ro // rigs pas dpyad par bya ba la rigs pas dpyod cing rigs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed na /
translated: Fourth, one does not lose the meaning that one has understood, nor does it become unclear.üîΩFifth, one does not rely on others with regard to the teachings that one has examined with reason, because one examines them with reason and does not contradict reason.

original: rigs pas brtags pa'i chos de la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pas brtags pa'i chos de la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sixth, one is not led astray by others with regard to the teachings that one has examined with reason.

original: mos par bya ba la mos par byed cing /
analyzed: mos par bya ba la mos par byed cing /
translated: He is convinced of what is to be believed.

original: mos pas yid la byed pa gtong bar mi byed na /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi /
analyzed: mos pas yid la byed pa gtong bar mi byed na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi /
translated: He does not abandon the mental attentions that are based on conviction.

original: bdag gi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe domain of the TathƒÅgatas is not the domain of my mind.‚Äù

original: chos de dag yid ches shing mi spong bas bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos de dag yid ches shing mi spong bas bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By having confidence in those teachings and not rejecting them, he does not harm or injure himself.

original: kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not have any wrongdoing.

original: don la rton par byed kyi tshig 'bru la mi rton na ;
analyzed: don la rton par byed kyi tshig 'bru la mi rton na ;
translated: ‚ÄúHe relies on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He penetrates all the statements of the Lord Buddha that were made with a specific intention.

original: nag po bstan pa'i mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang ba chos nyid dang 'gal ba dang / chen po bstan pa'i mdo sde la 'jug /'dul ba la snang /
analyzed: nag po bstan pa'i mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang ba chos nyid dang 'gal ba dang / chen po bstan pa'i mdo sde la 'jug /'dul ba la snang /
translated: He does not engage with the s≈´tras that teach the dark side, which do not appear in the Monastic Code, which contradict reality, and which are not the Great Way.üîΩHe engages with the s≈´tras that teach the bright side, which do appear in the Monastic Code, which do not contradict reality, and which are the Great Way.

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: He understands them correctly, just as they are.

original: de kho na'i don las sus kyang bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: de kho na'i don las sus kyang bskyod pa'am /
translated: No one can shake him from the meaning of reality.

original: bsgul bar mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgul bar mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it cannot be shaken.

original: thog mar 'jug pa nas kyang sems pa la 'jug cing skabs ma yin pa mi 'jug pa na bzod pa sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog mar 'jug pa nas kyang sems pa la 'jug cing skabs ma yin pa mi 'jug pa na bzod pa sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the very beginning, when one enters into the thought of enlightenment, one enters into the thought of enlightenment, and not into the thought of the disciples, and one obtains the patience that one did not have before.

original: zhugs nas kyang yang dang yang du yid la byed pas snying po nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang yang dang yang du yid la byed pas snying po nyid thob par byed de /
translated: Having entered into it, one makes it the very essence by repeated attention.

original: yal bar mi 'dor bar sems na sgom pa la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yal bar mi 'dor bar sems na sgom pa la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not abandon it, one enters into the practice.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyad pa bcu pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyad pa bcu pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ni /
translated: After that, the bodhisattva generates the knowledge that comes from meditation by means of the ten dharmas of the bodhisattva.

original: bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag yongs su rdzogs nas bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba sgom par byed de /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag yongs su rdzogs nas bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba sgom par byed de /
translated: When one has completed the eight kinds of thought, and one enters into the practice by means of the aspects of meditation, then one cultivates serenity, insight, the cultivation of serenity and insight, and the delight in serenity and insight.

original: de la zhi gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is serenity?

original: byang chub sems dpa' @290b bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam dang / don tsam gyi dmigs pa la sems nges par gtad nas spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / sems yongs su g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dmigs pa thams cad la mos pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @290b bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam dang / don tsam gyi dmigs pa la sems nges par gtad nas spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / sems yongs su g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dmigs pa thams cad la mos pa na /
translated: The bodhisattva, because of the complete perfection of these eight kinds of mental orientation, focuses his mind on the object which is the mere thing and the mere meaning, which are inexpressible, and then, by means of the attention which is the idea free from all conceptual elaboration and free from all distraction of the mind, he has conviction in all objects.

original: nang gi ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma rnams la sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma rnams la sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa'o //
translated: He enters into the nine states of mind which are the stabilization of the mind on the signs of internal meditative concentration, by means of the four kinds of attention and the six forces.

original: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight?

original: zhi gnas yongs su bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang / gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas yongs su bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang / gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entry into the four investigations and the four kinds of thorough analysis by means of the attention which is the cultivation of serenity and the wisdom which consists of the mental attentions to the signs of those very doctrines which one has reflected upon.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of calm abiding and profound insight?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rtag tu sbyor zhing gus par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rtag tu sbyor zhing gus par sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the constant practice of calm abiding and profound insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the delight in calm abiding and profound insight?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma de dag gnyis las sems mi g-yo ba la rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du ba med par 'jug cing gnas pa dang / sdud cing mi 'phro ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byed pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma de dag gnyis las sems mi g-yo ba la rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du ba med par 'jug cing gnas pa dang / sdud cing mi 'phro ba gang yin pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byed pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the non-diffusion of the mind in both of them, the non-diffusion of the mind in the signs of calm abiding and profound insight.üîΩThe Bodhisattva, in proportion as he practices calm abiding and profound insight, abides in the delight of calm abiding and profound insight.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In proportion as he practices calm abiding and profound insight, he obtains the purification of calm abiding and profound insight.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su dag pa de lta de ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa che ba dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su dag pa de lta de ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa che ba dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more pure his serenity, the more pure will be his physical and mental pliancy, and the more it will increase and grow.

original: ji lta ji ltar lhag mthong yongs su dag pa de lta de ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba che ba dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lhag mthong yongs su dag pa de lta de ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba che ba dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more pure his insight, the more pure will be his knowledge and vision, and the more it will increase and grow.

original: bsgom pa'i bya ba ni 'dir zad de /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i bya ba ni 'dir zad de /
translated: This is the extent of the practice of meditation.

original: rten la yod pa'i gnas ngan len bsal bar bya ba dang / shes bya thams cad la shes pa dang / mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rten la yod pa'i gnas ngan len bsal bar bya ba dang / shes bya thams cad la shes pa dang / mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
translated: It is the removal of the negative tendencies that exist in the basis, and the purification of knowledge and vision with regard to all knowable things.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam de thams cad kyang bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam de thams cad kyang bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And all of the bodhisattva‚Äôs path of meditation is accomplished by means of these four kinds of meditation.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' @291a * //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' @291a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva

original: khams brtas pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par grub pa'i 'og tu mos pas spyad pa'i sa la chos spyod pa bcu'i rim gyis shes rab rnam pa gsum skyes pa ni /
analyzed: khams brtas pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par grub pa'i 'og tu mos pas spyad pa'i sa la chos spyod pa bcu'i rim gyis shes rab rnam pa gsum skyes pa ni /
translated: After the roots of virtue conducive to liberation are fully developed, then on the level of practice through belief, by the process of the ten Dharma activities, the three kinds of wisdom are born.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yang dag par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yang dag par grub pa yin te /
translated: This is the full development of the roots of virtue conducive to penetrative insight.

original: chos yang dag par grub pa des bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos yang dag par grub pa des bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: By that full development of the Dharma, one should train well and thoroughly in those six bases of training.

original: theg pa las yongs su mi nyams ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam las shes rab dang / snying rje gnyis kyis yongs su mi nyams te /
analyzed: theg pa las yongs su mi nyams ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam las shes rab dang / snying rje gnyis kyis yongs su mi nyams te /
translated: Not falling away from the vehicle refers to the fact that bodhisattvas do not fall away from the vehicle, which is the path to the nonabiding nirvana, the perfect accomplishment of the twofold goal for self and other, through the twin forces of wisdom and compassion.

original: de ni byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is taught by the line, ‚ÄúOne should guard the spirit of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi theg pa las yongs su mi nyams pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi theg pa las yongs su mi nyams pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva should train well and thoroughly in those six bases of training, because he does not fall away from his own vehicle.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bas ni /
translated: In that regard, the line ‚Äúthe spirit of enlightenment‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan te /
translated: teaches the vehicle of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'grub pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'grub pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ste /
translated: The vehicle of the bodhisattvas is the path to the nirvana that is not a resting place, the perfect achievement of the aims of self and other.

original: de byang chub kyi sems zhes kyang bya yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub kyi sems zhes kyang bya yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is called the spirit of enlightenment and also the right aspiration.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: In that regard, the spirit of enlightenment is the intention that focuses on unsurpassed enlightenment and all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas des ni 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas des ni 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
translated: The intention focused on unsurpassed enlightenment is the perfection of one's own aim, and thus it does not dwell in cyclic existence.

original: sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas des ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas des ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
translated: The intention focused on all sentient beings is the perfection of others' aims, and thus it does not dwell in nirvana.

original: de nyid yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the right aspiration.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: All right aspirations are summarized as five types:

original: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po ste /
translated: aspiration to generate the thought of enlightenment, aspiration for birth, aspiration for the sphere of activity, right aspiration, and great aspiration.

original: de dag gis rab tu dbye ba ni sngar bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gis rab tu dbye ba ni sngar bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Their divisions are as taught in the chapter on skill in perfecting the intentions.

original: rjes su bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa de las yongs su mi nyams par bstan te /
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa de las yongs su mi nyams par bstan te /
translated: The term ‚Äúprotection‚Äù indicates that one does not fall away from that vehicle.

original: de ni shes rab dang snying rjes @291b yongs su mi nyams te /
analyzed: de ni shes rab dang snying rjes @291b yongs su mi nyams te /
translated: One does not fall away from it through wisdom and compassion.

original: shes rab kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas pa'i phyir bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub cing 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas pa'i phyir bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub cing 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
translated: Through wisdom, one realizes all phenomena just as they are and thus one‚Äôs own aim is perfectly accomplished, for one‚Äôs element of aspiration focused on unsurpassed enlightenment grows. One does not remain in samsara.

original: snying rjes sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pas de'i phyir shes rab dang snying
analyzed: snying rjes sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pas de'i phyir shes rab dang snying
translated: Through compassion, one does not abandon any sentient being and thus one‚Äôs element of aspiration focused on all sentient beings grows. One‚Äôs aim for others is perfectly accomplished, for one does not remain in nirvana.

original: rje ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub par byed pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par byed pa yin pas theg pa de las yongs su mi nyams shing rjes su bsrung ba yin te /
analyzed: rje ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i bsam pa'i khams brtas par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par grub par byed pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par byed pa yin pas theg pa de las yongs su mi nyams shing rjes su bsrung ba yin te /
translated: Lord means the unsurpassed enlightenment, the realm of the intention that focuses on all sentient beings, the perfect accomplishment of the aims of self and other, and the nonabiding in samsara and nirvana.

original: de lta bus bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bus bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is the vehicle that does not degenerate and protects from those, one should apply oneself to the six bases of training in that way.

original: som nyi med pa zhes bya ba ni som nyi ni yang dag par sgrub pa thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: som nyi med pa zhes bya ba ni som nyi ni yang dag par sgrub pa thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa yin la /
translated: As for being free of doubt, doubt is an obstacle to all correct practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen som nyi thams cad yang dag par sel bar byed pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni som nyi med pa ste ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen som nyi thams cad yang dag par sel bar byed pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni som nyi med pa ste ;
translated: Since the bodhisattvas' spiritual masters completely eliminate all doubt, those who rely on a spiritual master are free of doubt.

original: de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by relying on the spiritual master.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas som nyi med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas som nyi med par 'gyur la /
translated: Relying on the spiritual master, one becomes free of doubt.üîΩAnd being free of doubt, one should train well and thoroughly in those six bases of training.

original: som nyi med pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to da la rnam pa du ma dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya /
analyzed: som nyi med pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to da la rnam pa du ma dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya /
translated: How many aspects should one know to be the spiritual master of the bodhisattva?

original: rnam pa dus ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa dus ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin /
translated: How many aspects are the spiritual master's meaningful activities?

original: rnam pa du dang ldan na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi'i gnas la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa du dang ldan na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi'i gnas la mkhas pa yin /
translated: How many aspects are the spiritual master's skill in the bases of faith?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis 'dul ba gzhan dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba du yod /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis 'dul ba gzhan dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba du yod /
translated: How many activities of the spiritual master are there for other disciples?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa dus rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa dus rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: How many aspects are complete in the bodhisattva's reliance on the spiritual master?

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes dus ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes dus ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya /
translated: The bodhisattva should listen to the Dharma from a spiritual teacher at the right time.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zag chos smra ba la gnas /üîΩdu ni yid la mi bya zhe na rnam pa brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig @292a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zag chos smra ba la gnas / du ni yid la mi bya zhe na rnam pa brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig @292a * //
translated: The bodhisattva should rely on a spiritual teacher, a person who teaches the Dharma.

original: par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya ste /
translated: What should he not pay attention to? When he has eight qualities, the bodhisattva should be known as a spiritual teacher.

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: He is established in morality, has much learning, has realization, has compassion, is fearless, is patient, does not get discouraged,

original: dge ba'i tshig dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshig dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and has virtuous speech.

original: rnam pa lngas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin te /
translated: The spiritual teacher‚Äôs activity is fruitful in five ways.

original: ma gsol bar sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam du 'dzud pas phan 'dogs pa dang / dam bcas pa'i rtsom pa 'bras bu yod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ma gsol bar sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam du 'dzud pas phan 'dogs pa dang / dam bcas pa'i rtsom pa 'bras bu yod par byed pa dang /
translated: They benefit by not being asked to do anything for sentient beings, by knowing perfectly the aims of this life and the next, by being led onto the true path, by making their undertakings fruitful,

original: phyogs mi 'dzin cing snying rje snyoms pas so //
analyzed: phyogs mi 'dzin cing snying rje snyoms pas so //
translated: and by being impartial and compassionate toward all.

original: rnam pa lnga dang ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi'i gnas la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi'i gnas la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The spiritual master is a basis for faith in five ways:

original: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / brtan pa dang ldan pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / phrag dog med pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no //üîΩdge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdul ba gzhan dag la /
analyzed: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / brtan pa dang ldan pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / phrag dog med pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no // dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdul ba gzhan dag la /
translated: he or she is perfect in moral discipline, perfect in learning, perfect in generosity, perfect in concentration, and perfect in wisdom.üîΩThe spiritual master is a basis for faith in five ways:üîΩhe or she is perfect in moral discipline, perfect in learning, perfect in generosity, perfect in concentration, and perfect in wisdom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: The spiritual master is a basis for faith in five ways:üîΩhe or she is perfect in moral discipline, perfect in learning, perfect in generosity, perfect in concentration, and perfect in wisdom.

original: gleng bar byed pa dang / dran par byed pa dang / 'doms par byed pa dang / rjes su ston par byed pa dang / chos ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gleng bar byed pa dang / dran par byed pa dang / 'doms par byed pa dang / rjes su ston par byed pa dang / chos ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is one who speaks, who reminds, who instructs, who teaches, who reveals the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva's reliance on the spiritual teacher is fulfilled in four ways:

original: rim gro byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / yo byad stobs pa dang / bka' bzhin byed pas so //
analyzed: rim gro byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / yo byad stobs pa dang / bka' bzhin byed pas so //
translated: by service, by attendance, by supplying material needs, and by practicing the teachings.üîΩThe bodhisattva should listen to the teachings with five attitudes:üîΩthe attitude of respect, the attitude of eagerness, the attitude of desire for the teachings, the attitude of desire for the meaning, and the attitude of desire to put the teachings into practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes lngas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes lngas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should listen to the teachings with five attitudes:

original: dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab rgya chen po thob pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi don gyis mig gi 'du shes dang / shes bya yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa'i don gyis snang ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab rgya chen po thob pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi don gyis mig gi 'du shes dang / shes bya yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa'i don gyis snang ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the attitude of respect, the attitude of eagerness, the attitude of desire for the teachings, the attitude of desire for the meaning, and the attitude of desire to put the teachings into practice.

original: tshe 'di la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dga' ba khan ma tho ba med pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i don gyis dga' ba kha na tho ba med pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i don gyi 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dga' ba khan ma tho ba med pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i don gyis dga' ba kha na tho ba med pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i don gyi 'bras bu dang /
translated: The idea of the absence of blame, in the sense of the cause, which is the joy of serenity and insight in this life.

original: phan yon che ba'i 'du shes kyis so //
analyzed: phan yon che ba'i 'du shes kyis so //
translated: The idea of great benefit, in the sense of the result, which is the cause of attaining nirvana and the unsurpassed state of complete enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zag chos smra ba la gnas lnga yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zag chos smra ba la gnas lnga yid la mi byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva does not think about five things with regard to the spiritual master, the person who teaches the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims nyams par yid la mi bya ba dang rigs dma' bar yid la mi bya ba dang / byad bzhin ngan par yid la mi bya ba @292b dang ; snyan pa med par yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par yid la mi bya ba dang rigs dma' bar yid la mi bya ba dang / byad bzhin ngan par yid la mi bya ba @292b dang ; snyan pa med par yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He does not think about his impaired morality, his low social class, his ugly appearance, or his lack of eloquence.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu la rnam pa de lta bus bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu la rnam pa de lta bus bstan te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, in this way, teaches the spiritual master,

original: som nyi med par gyur pas /
analyzed: som nyi med par gyur pas /
translated: and, free from doubt,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The six bases of training should be applied to the statement, ‚ÄúOne should train well and thoroughly in those six bases of training.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúStage‚Äù refers to the stage of the bodhisattva who is situated in the householder‚Äôs life and the stage of the bodhisattva who is situated in the renunciant‚Äôs life.

original: de ni rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúContinuous application to virtue‚Äù is taught by the statement, ‚Äúcontinuous application to virtue.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs nas rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs nas rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag legs par shin tu bslab par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: The six bases of training should be applied to the statement, ‚ÄúOne should train well and thoroughly in those six bases of training,‚Äù in order to teach that the bodhisattva who is situated in the householder‚Äôs life and the bodhisattva who is situated in the renunciant‚Äôs life should train well and thoroughly in the six bases of training by means of continuous application to virtue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i chos ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i chos ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, there are four dharmas for the bodhisattva who is continuously engaged in virtue in the situation of being in the householder stage and in the situation of being in the renunciant stage.

original: las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: They are: good performance of action, skill, helping others, and dedication.

original: de la las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa ni /
translated: Good performance of action

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: is fourfold:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nges par 'byed pa dang / byang bar byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nges par 'byed pa dang / byang bar byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa'o //
translated: performance of the perfections, performance of the aids to enlightenment, constant performance, and performance without fault.

original: mkhas pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: Skill is tenfold:

original: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi sdang ba bsal ba dang / tha mal pa rnams 'jug par bya ba dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba thabs la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi sdang ba bsal ba dang / tha mal pa rnams 'jug par bya ba dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba thabs la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is skill in means in dispelling the hostility of hostile beings, in engaging indifferent beings, in bringing to maturity those who have been engaged, and in liberating those who have matured.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is skill in all worldly treatises, skill in the activities of taking up the bodhisattva vow, skill in right aspiration, skill in the vehicle of the disciples,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa chen po la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa chen po la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the vehicle of the solitary sages, and skill in the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis kha cig la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / kha cig la bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa dang / kha cig la @293a * //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis kha cig la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / kha cig la bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa dang / kha cig la @293a * //
translated: It is benefiting others by means of the four social practices: accomplishing the welfare of some, accomplishing the happiness of some,

original: phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the means of accomplishing benefit and happiness.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni byang chub sems dpa' las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa dang mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo gsum po dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags so cog thams cad snying thag pa nas dad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni byang chub sems dpa' las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa dang mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo gsum po dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags so cog thams cad snying thag pa nas dad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: The dedication is the bodhisattva's dedication of all the roots of virtue that he has accumulated in the past, is accumulating in the present, and will accumulate in the future, with a mind full of faith and from the very depths of his heart, to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, by means of the three doors of bestowing benefit on others, namely, by means of the correct performance of action, by means of skill in means, and by means of the dedication itself.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa gnyis ka chos bzhi po de dag la yang dag par sbyor du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la gnas pa gnyis ka chos bzhi po de dag la yang dag par sbyor du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although the bodhisattva, whether he is a householder or one gone forth to homelessness, is perfectly engaged in these four dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa bas rab tu byung ba shin tu khyad ches khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa bas rab tu byung ba shin tu khyad ches khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva who is one gone forth to homelessness should be known as being far superior to the bodhisattva who is a householder.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni bu smad yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa las yongs su ma grol gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni bu smad yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa las yongs su ma grol gyi /
translated: Thus, the householder bodhisattva is not free from the fault of keeping a wife and family,üîΩbut the ordained person is free from that.üîΩThe householder is not free from the suffering of the afflictions and attachment due to farming, business, service to the king, and so on, for the sake of that very family he keeps,

original: rab tu byung ba ni de las yongs su grol ba dang / khyim pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyi ched du zhing las dang nyo tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / chags pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su ma grol gyi /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni de las yongs su grol ba dang / khyim pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyi ched du zhing las dang nyo tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / chags pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su ma grol gyi /
translated: but the ordained person is free from that.üîΩThe householder is not able to practice celibacy alone, as is taught in the Vinaya, but the ordained person is able to.

original: rab tu byung ba ni de las yongs su grol ba dang / khyim pas ni tshangs par spyod pa gcig pu nges par lu gu rgyud bzhin du bstan par spyod mi nus kyi rab tu byung bas ni nus pa dang / khyim pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la mngon par shes pa dul zhing /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni de las yongs su grol ba dang / khyim pas ni tshangs par spyod pa gcig pu nges par lu gu rgyud bzhin du bstan par spyod mi nus kyi rab tu byung bas ni nus pa dang / khyim pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la mngon par shes pa dul zhing /
translated: The householder is not able to practice all the factors of enlightenment, to be disciplined and to have supernormal knowledge,
